Some people tend to be hurry to complete their tasks, while others seem to prefer the opposite position. After deeply pondering over this issue, I also develop my own perspective. I favor the former; that is, I prefer to live in a higher pace condition. The first and foremost reason lies in the inevitable fact that we need to save time for accomplishing some important tasks, and a fitting example of which can be found in my experience of missing exam. I just failed to participate in the university entrance exam because I thought I had enough time for eating breakfast and transporting to the testing place; while I was stocked in a traffic jam and then missed the first test. Therefore, we can start to agree that we have to be eager in our lives. Apart from the one I have mentioned above, another equally important aspect is keeping in high pace condition can prevent me from getting lazy. If I can avoid being a sluggish person, I can have a higher probability of fulfilling my dream successfully. For instance, I had spent more time on practicing playing piano so that I won a piano competition, defeating those spending less time on practicing. Hence, from this case we are capable of stating that keeping our pace higher is important. Admittedly, on the other hand, there might be some people proclaiming that with a slower pace can enjoy their lives more because it is not necessary for them to notice the time control or acquire the fame of succeed. However, from my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying. I do not think that those people with slower pace losing the piano competition can be really happy. In contrast, it is really joyful for me that I can immerse in the joy of the victory and accomplishment. Based on the reasons demonstrated above, I believe that living in a higher pace is better because the advantages of this are qualitatively greater than that of the opposite. In other words, I prefer to live in high pace. It is not to say, of course that other points of view are totally without merit. Still, I am firmly convinced that the reasons I proposed in favor of my own sentiment are much more tenable and plausible.
llm: The debate about whether to rush through life or take it easy has sparked a longstanding discussion. Some people tend to be in a hurry to complete their tasks, while others seem to prefer the opposite position, adopting a slower pace. After deeply pondering over this issue, I also developed my own perspective. As a firm believer in the importance of time management, I prefer to be in a hurry to go places and get things done.The first and foremost reason lies in the inevitable fact that we need to save time for accomplishing some important tasks. In today's fast-paced world, where deadlines are tight and responsibilities are numerous, being quick and efficient is essential. By hurrying to complete tasks, I can manage my time effectively, free up space for other activities, and ultimately achieve more in less time. For instance, when working on a project, hurrying to finish the initial stages allows me to have ample time for revisions and improvements, thereby ensuring a better outcome.Another equally important aspect is that keeping in a high pace condition can prevent me from getting lazy. When I'm in a hurry, I stay focused and motivated, which enables me to push through challenges and maintain productivity. This, in turn, helps me develop a strong work ethic and build momentum, making it easier to tackle subsequent tasks. Furthermore, being in a hurry encourages me to prioritize tasks, make smart decisions, and avoid procrastination, all of which are valuable skills for success in both personal and professional spheres. In conclusion, I firmly believe that being in a hurry to go places and get things done is the better approach, as it allows me to make the most of my time, stay motivated, and achieve my goals efficiently.

question: Tourism is a multibillion-dollar industry that supports economic development. However, some people think that it causes too much damage to the local environment and culture. What do you think?
human: Tourist trade is becoming a powerful engine for the economy. Nevertheless, some individuals believe that this position ignores the ecological and environmental destruction, as a result of tourist activities, and its adverse effects on local communities and ecosystems. While both positions seem reasonable, my view is that, through proper management and regulation, a booming tourist industry is an excellent source of economic growth and wealth for rural and urban areas.The most obvious merit is that tourism can vastly boost economic development in a particular state or region. This takes place, not only through direct expenditure from tourists, but also because it provides direct and indirect jobs to the community, including retail, agriculture, and in the service industry. The increasing tax and the expansion of local markets for accommodation, luxury goods amongst others are also a result of a solid, well-regulated tourism programs. Furthermore, tourism provides a considerable number of direct and indirect jobs to the community, including retail, hotels, transport, agriculture, and in the service industry. This increase of job opportunities allows more people to make significant contribution to society through the purchasing of commodities by their growing incomes. As a result, this gives energy to the economic cycle, generating local economic prosperity in return.Some people may oppose these, citing the environmental and cultural destruction caused by tourism. In fact, compared to the tourism industry, other alternatives, like resource extraction and manufacture, are far worse destroyers. For instance, paper mills pour hundreds and thousands of tons of contamination into rivers, causing severe water pollution. On the other hand, the dramatic majority of tourist, particularly those who tend to spending a wealth of time and money locating and visiting rustic villages, are well educated. It is illogical to believe that these rational folks will not conduct themselves decently if required to do so.After careful consideration of both sides of the argument, the tourism sector is desirable for its important socioeconomic advantages. In conclusion, it is evident that under suitable administration, the benefits of tourism outweigh its drawbacks.
llm: The tourism industry has become a significant contributor to the global economy, with billions of dollars being generated annually. In my opinion, tourism can vastly boost economic development in a particular state or region, creating a ripple effect that benefits the local community. One of the most notable advantages of tourism is the creation of jobs, both direct and indirect. The industry provides employment opportunities in various sectors, including retail, hotels, transport, agriculture, and the service industry. This not only improves the standard of living for individuals but also contributes to the overall economic growth of the region.However, some people may oppose tourism, citing the environmental and cultural destruction caused by the influx of tourists. It is true that unregulated tourism can lead to pollution, destruction of natural habitats, and erosion of cultural heritage. Over-tourism can also put a strain on local resources, leading to issues such as overcrowding, traffic congestion, and strain on infrastructure. Nevertheless, I believe that these negative impacts can be mitigated with proper planning, management, and regulation.Many countries and regions have successfully implemented sustainable tourism practices, which prioritize environmental conservation and cultural preservation. By adopting such practices, tourism can become a tool for economic development while also protecting the local environment and culture. In conclusion, while there are valid concerns about the impact of tourism, I firmly believe that its benefits outweigh the drawbacks. With responsible management and planning, tourism can be a powerful driver of economic growth, job creation, and community development, ultimately improving the lives of people in the region.

question: The government should allocate more funds to public services instead of wasting money on arts such as music, painting and so on. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Give your own opinion
human: The issue of governmental financing provision to aesthetic features in the society has sparked a heated debate. While some argue that the budget allocation to the arts is waste of national resources and the money should instead be spent on public services, I contend that this investment in field of the arts would be in the best interest of a society.First of all, there is no doubt that governments are liable for providing societies with appropriate public services and adequate facilities in an efficient way. Admittedly, no one should suffer from any sort of deficiency in field of health, education, transportation and communication. However, these could only help individuals with their physical requirements. There is also a burden on the government to highly concern about the people mental health initiatives which would be unconsciously or sensibly provided by the arts.On top of this, the arts play a pivotal role in all-round development of a society. No developed country could be named that music, painting, literature and other fields of arts are out of its government consideration. Enriching people's life and enlightening their thoughts, the arts basically affect the enhancement of societies in many positive ways.Furthermore, investing in art could bring employment opportunities and could end in return of capital occasionally. The investment could be paid back through the values of the created works of art which as a matter of fact should be considered as national possessions. To sum up, not only could investing in art be considered as wasting money at any kind, but also it would enriches the culture of the society and governments and individuals would benefit from it in multiple ways.
llm: The issue of governmental financing provision to aesthetic features in the society has sparked a heated debate. Some argue that the budget allocation to the arts is a waste of national resources and the money should instead be spent on public services. However, I contend that this investment in the field of the arts would be in the best interest of a society.Allocating funds to the arts, such as music, painting, and other creative pursuits, may seem frivolous to some, but it has numerous benefits that can have a positive impact on the community. For instance, art programs can provide a platform for social commentary, fostering critical thinking and sparking conversations about important issues. Moreover, art can also play a significant role in promoting cultural diversity and preserving national heritage. By investing in the arts, the government can promote tourism, create jobs, and stimulate local economies.Furthermore, the arts have been proven to have a positive impact on mental health and education. Studies have shown that exposure to art can improve cognitive function, boost self-esteem, and enhance academic performance. Additionally, the arts can provide a healthy outlet for emotional expression and stress relief, contributing to a more well-rounded and balanced society.In conclusion, while some may view the allocation of funds to the arts as a waste of resources, I firmly believe that it is a vital investment in the well-being and development of a society. Rather than diverting funds from public services, the government should strive to find a balance between supporting essential services and nurturing the creative sector. By doing so, they can create a more vibrant, diverse, and prosperous community that benefits from the numerous advantages that the arts have to offer.

question: The idea of having a single career is becoming an old fashioned one. The new fashion will be to have several careers or ways of earning money and further education will be something that continues throughout life.
human: The career itself became the motto of living since the beginning of industrialization in the late 19th century. People usually tend to have a single career as a means of living. However, a modern trend reveals that new generations are more interested to perform several jobs and also would like to gain multiple higher educational certificates in order to earn more and to gain financial security.A full time job with a steady income was enough for a potential employee to support himself and his family. But with the recent recession, almost all the countries all over the world are seeing significant economic downfall. This overwhelming crisis is prompting delayering and reduction of workers. As a result, people are focusing on doing several jobs or gaining further qualification to secure their economic condition.Moreover, the arrival of technology has also been playing a major role promoting further unemployment. The official term of it is named "Technological Unemployment". North American economists have published reports after scrutinizing the recent American economic situation that, technology is eliminating more jobs than creating one. For example, robots, automation and softwares are taking over manual human workers professions such as clerks, interpreters, security services, retails and specially in manufacturing companies. Thus many people's jobs are now at high stake. The best way to ensure a flexible earning is getting more jobs. Last but not least, corporational policy to to pay less to inferiors is another reason that drives labours to work on different sectors.For the reasons mentioned above, I believe that people are now more conscious to gain more educational qualification and also are more interested to work on various fields simultaneously to earn more and support themselves.
llm: The notion of having a single career is rapidly becoming a relic of the past. In today's fast-paced and ever-evolving job market, the trend is shifting towards having multiple careers or sources of income. This shift is particularly evident among the new generation, who are more inclined to explore diverse career paths and pursue multiple higher educational certificates. The primary motivation behind this trend is the desire to earn a higher income and achieve financial security.In the past, a full-time job with a steady income was sufficient for an individual to support themselves and their family. However, the recent recession has led to a significant economic downturn worldwide, rendering this traditional approach insufficient. The economic instability has prompted individuals to rethink their career strategies and seek alternative sources of income. As a result, many are now opting for multiple careers, which can provide a safety net and increased financial stability.Furthermore, the pursuit of multiple higher educational certificates has become a norm among the new generation. This approach not only enhances one's skill set and knowledge but also opens up new career opportunities. The concept of lifelong learning has gained prominence, with many individuals choosing to continue their education throughout their lives. This ongoing pursuit of knowledge and skills enables them to stay adaptable and competitive in the job market, ultimately leading to greater financial security and stability. In conclusion, the idea of having a single career is indeed becoming outdated, and the new trend of pursuing multiple careers and continuous education is likely to dominate the future of employment.

question: Some people think that computers are more of a hindrance than a help in today's society. Others believe that they are such indispensable tools that they would not be able to live or work without them. Discuss both opinions and give your opinion
human: Computer is a modern device that is useful for human life. People use computer particularly for work, study, even for communication. However, many people argue that computer more give obstacle than a help in social life. Other sides believe that it becomes prominent thing, and they cannot do anything without that device. However, I strongly believe that computer can influence society, and people's lives have already been controlled by device. I would argue that this modern device has been a major hindrance to some people. A study conducted by Mediabank shows that majority of Australian adults do not socialize with their families and friends as much as they used to, due to the fact that they spend almost nine hours a day dealing with computers as to produce efficient time in working. As it can be seen from the example, the idea that computers could be a help has been neglected.However, using computer can make people easier to complete their work. Businessmen, for example, use computer device to presentation or communication with their colleagues. Communication by feature-computer such as email and internet help busy businessmen to make deal with relation even in different country. This is due to using computer more efficient and, many workers cannot do more in work without computer.In conclusion, in era technology like this age, computer becomes important thing in human life. Every day, people cannot pass the day without stay in front of computer or using it. This situation becomes lifestyle habits, and nowadays human activities are influenced by computer use.
llm: The impact of computers on society has been a topic of debate in recent years. Some people think that computers are more of a hindrance than a help in today's society. They argue that computers have led to a decline in face-to-face interactions, resulting in social isolation and decreased human relationships. Moreover, they claim that the over-reliance on computers has made people lazy and dependent on technology, hindering their ability to think critically and solve problems independently.However, I strongly believe that computers can have a profoundly positive influence on society, and people's lives have already been significantly controlled by these devices. Computers have revolutionized the way we communicate, access information, and perform various tasks. They have enabled global connectivity, facilitating instant communication and collaboration across geographical boundaries. Additionally, computers have improved efficiency and productivity in various industries, such as healthcare, education, and finance, leading to better services and outcomes.Furthermore, computers have opened up new avenues for entertainment, education, and personal development. They provide access to a vast array of educational resources, enabling people to acquire new skills and knowledge. Computers have also enabled people to work remotely, offering flexibility and convenience. In conclusion, while some people may view computers as a hindrance, I firmly believe that they are an indispensable tool that has transformed and will continue to shape our lives and society for the better. As technology continues to evolve, it is essential to harness its potential to improve our lives and create a more connected and productive world.

question: Some employers are giving increased importance to social skills. However, others still believe qualifications are the most important. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Ê
human: With the increased educational level of workforce, there are growing number of employers seeking criteria other than qualifications such as social skills in their employee selection process. However, some employers still believe that qualifications should be the most paramount criterion. The essay intends to explore both sides of arguments and also present my own opinion. Firstly, some people suggest that qualification should be the foremost measurement to determine the value of a employer. It is of importance that workers should be well educated and trained to perform duties of their job. Specifically, people who work in professional fields such as medicals are required to have a university degree and years of experience. Social skills seem to be less important as they cannot contribute to the success of a surgery. On the other hand, it is no doubt that the importance of social skills have been recognized by increasing number of employers. It is because people nowadays are required to work as a team in their jobs frequently. Interpersonal skill plays an essential role in helping colleagues to cooperate with each other, especially when conflicts arise. Better social skills allow them to resolve disagreements in a much more harmony way. Besides, organization have been transformed to customers oriented. Excellent social skills can help employees maintain strong relationship with their clients which thus lead to a better customer satisfaction.To my view, I incline to believe qualification is still the fundamental determinant of an employee's competency of their jobs. Yet, the importance of social skills should not be neglected as those skills can help one to perform their job effectiveness and efficiency by facilitating interaction and communication with others.
llm: The debate about what makes a suitable candidate for a job has been ongoing, with some employers emphasizing the importance of social skills, while others still prioritize qualifications. In recent years, there has been a growing number of employers seeking criteria other than qualifications, such as social skills, in their employee selection process. This shift in focus is driven by the realization that social skills, including communication, teamwork, and problem-solving abilities, are essential for effective collaboration and productivity in the workplace.On one hand, qualifications are undoubtedly important, as they demonstrate a candidate's knowledge and expertise in a particular field. Employers who prioritize qualifications argue that they provide a clear indication of a candidate's ability to perform specific tasks and duties. Moreover, qualifications are often seen as a reliable measure of a candidate's commitment to their profession and their willingness to invest time and effort in acquiring the necessary skills.On the other hand, social skills are becoming increasingly valued by employers, as they recognize that a candidate's ability to work with others, communicate effectively, and adapt to new situations is crucial for success in today's fast-paced and dynamic work environment. Employers who prioritize social skills argue that these skills are essential for building strong relationships with colleagues, clients, and customers, and for driving business results through effective teamwork and collaboration.In my opinion, while qualifications provide a foundation for a candidate's technical abilities, social skills are equally important in determining a candidate's potential for success in the workplace. I believe that employers should strike a balance between the two, considering both qualifications and social skills in their selection process. By doing so, employers can ensure that they hire candidates who not only possess the necessary technical skills but also the social skills required to thrive in a team-based work environment. Ultimately, this balanced approach will lead to more effective and productive teams, driving business success and growth.

question: Some people believe that charities should give aid to those who need the aid most, wherever they live. Some people believe that charity organisations would better concentrate on people in their own countries instead. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
human: The world has become more prosperous than ever yet a great number of people are still living in poverty or suffering by wars or disasters. Charity organisations have been playing an important role to provide support to those people. However, it is controversial whether the help should go to the people who need it most or the citizens of the country where the charity organisations are located. My view is that international aid should be prioritised.International aid is critical because people from other countries may be facing much more serious problems. Many people, for example in some African countries, are living below the basic standards. They lack food, water or clothes which keep them warm, not to mention the education needs. What is worse, people who live in countries that are confronted with wars or natural disasters are facing even more severe issues such as security, homelessness or the pain of losing best friends or family members. It is clear that those people are in desperate need of international support.Despite the importance of helping those beyond our national borders, it is reasonable to lend a hand to our fellow citizens. After all, charity organisations are mainly funded by the home country thus there is a high demand that the money should be spent in the place where it is collected. Another reason is that, even within the most developed countries, there are still poor people who lack their basic needs. By solving the problems in the home country, it is beneficial for social stability and steady economic growth.In conclusion, people from unfortunate countries need more international assistance while helping citizens in the home country is also necessary.
llm: The debate on whether charities should prioritize aid to those in need globally or focus on their own countries has sparked intense discussion. On one hand, some argue that charities should provide aid to those who need it most, regardless of their geographical location. International aid is critical because people from other countries may be facing much more serious problems that require immediate attention. For instance, many people, especially in some African countries, are living below the basic standards of living, lacking access to fundamental necessities like clean water, food, and shelter. In such cases, providing aid can be a matter of life and death.On the other hand, some people believe that charity organizations would be better off concentrating on people in their own countries. This perspective is also understandable, as there are often significant needs within one's own nation that require attention. Despite the importance of helping those beyond our national borders, it is reasonable to lend a hand to our fellow citizens who may be struggling with poverty, homelessness, or other socio-economic challenges. By supporting local communities, charities can foster a sense of unity and contribute to the overall well-being of their country.In my opinion, a balanced approach is the most effective way forward. Charities should not have to choose between helping those abroad and those at home. Instead, they can allocate their resources in a way that addresses both international and domestic needs. This could involve partnering with international organizations to provide global aid while also maintaining local programs that support community development and welfare. By adopting such a dual-focus strategy, charities can make a positive impact both at home and abroad, ultimately contributing to a more equitable and compassionate world.

question: Students at schools and universities learn far more from lessons with teachers than from others sources (such as the internet, television).To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: The way in which children today study is radically different from any previous generations, and the increased availability and relatively low price of modern technology has been instrumental in this change. Despite the argument of some people that learners can obtain more useful knowledge from teachers than from other sources, I firmly believe that both alternative sources and traditional teaching methods from educators are equally important in children's acquisition of knowledge.It is undeniable that the widespread of alternative sources of knowledge has played an important role in students' acquisition of knowledge. Computers can be programmed to provide an endless numbers of questions in diverse range of fields, and as the students answer these questions, the facts has been learned and reinforced. A case in point is the reading and listening parts of TOEFL iBT exams, as candidates have to answer many questions in a limited period of time. Moreover, when students have some academic problems, they can post those to some websites and receive correct answers from unknown people in faraway places without any costs. Besides, in the past, conducting a research require long hours of searching in library shelves, now all can be done at a click of a button. Thus, technologies are vital in students' learning.On the other hand, schools and university are places in which students gather to be educated and learn from each others as well as formal educators. At schools, students' development has been orchestrated stage by stage, step by step by experienced teachers, and their acquisition of knowledge is guided and backed up in a systematic way. Therefore, formal education approaches are also indispensable. To put it all in a nutshell, I pen out saying that alternative sources information and traditional education systems are equally important in children's development. So students should learn both from their teachers as well as modern technology to gain the best learning outcome.
llm: The way in which children today study is radically different from any previous generations. The increased availability and relatively low price of modern technology has been instrumental in this change, making it easier for students to access a wide range of information from various sources. While some may argue that students learn more from lessons with teachers than from other sources, I partially disagree with this statement.On one hand, teachers play a vital role in providing guidance, support, and feedback to students, which are essential for their academic and personal development. Face-to-face interaction with educators allows students to ask questions, clarify doubts, and engage in discussions, promoting a deeper understanding of the subject matter. Furthermore, teachers can tailor their teaching methods to meet the needs of individual students, making learning more effective.On the other hand, alternative sources such as the internet and television also offer a wealth of information that can supplement traditional teaching methods. The internet, in particular, provides access to a vast array of educational resources, including online tutorials, educational videos, and interactive learning materials. These alternative sources can be especially useful for students who prefer self-paced learning or need to review material outside of the classroom.In conclusion, both alternative sources and traditional teaching methods from educators are equally important in children's acquisition of knowledge. Rather than relying solely on one or the other, a balanced approach that combines the strengths of both is likely to yield the best results. By leveraging the benefits of modern technology and the guidance of teachers, students can develop a more comprehensive understanding of the subject matter and acquire the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in today's rapidly changing world.

question: Popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: A world sportive competition event is watched by almost every country around the world and provide social stimulus and people gathering. However, while people view these sportive events as vital in release international problems, others think that they are just entertainment to distract people. I believe that they are important somehow, but not essential.As a matter of fact, world sport events provide positive waves for number of people. The main purpose of such competitions is to enjoy and share emotions between supporters though their favorite team. These emotions are shared locally in our village or city, nationally in our own country but even internationally too. Obviously these events gather people and their nationalist pride feeling is increased. For example, the football world cup taking place every four years is a very followed event during which everyone is having fun.Moreover, these sports events are not essential in other issues such as politics or other international affairs. Thus, if the general atmosphere during the show is peaceful and fraternal, the reality is different. In other words, this is the "calm before the storm". After the Olympics games are finished, everything came back to normal and all the game competition is forgotten by the majority. To picture it, recently, Putin was pleased to open the last winter Olympic games and gather international countries, but actually it has been just facade and Putin didn't listen international warning after he conquered the Crimea.Finally, an international sports event is a very good thing to gather people, let them dream, being proud of their nationality and forget problems, but just for a while. These meetings are in none case here to interact with international affairs.
llm: The notion that popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions play a crucial role in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way is a topic of debate. I agree to a certain extent with this opinion. On one hand, the football World Cup, for instance, is a world sportive competition event that is watched by almost every country around the world. This global event provides a social stimulus, bringing people together and fostering a sense of community and camaraderie. The excitement and pride associated with watching one's national team compete can be a powerful catalyst for patriotic emotions, which can be released in a safe and controlled environment.Moreover, these events have the potential to transcend cultural and linguistic barriers, promoting international unity and understanding. The sheer scale of these events, with millions of people gathering to watch and celebrate, creates a shared experience that can help to break down national and cultural divides. However, while many people view these sportive events as vital in releasing international problems and easing tensions, others think that they are just entertainment, designed to distract people from more pressing global issues. Some critics argue that the euphoria and national pride generated by these events can also be a source of division and conflict, rather than unity and cooperation.In conclusion, while international sporting events like the football World Cup have the potential to ease international tensions and release patriotic emotions in a safe way, their impact should not be overstated. They can be a powerful tool for promoting international unity and understanding, but they should not be seen as a substitute for meaningful diplomatic efforts to address the complex problems that face the global community. Ultimately, the value of these events lies in their ability to bring people together and foster a sense of shared humanity, rather than as a means of distracting from or resolving deeper international conflicts.

question: Many people use distance-learning programmes (study material post,TV,internet...)to study at home. But some people think that it cannot bring the benefit as much as attending college or university. Do you agree or disagree?
human: With the tremendous development in information technology, long-distance education enables people to study at home without going to school. Whether this teaching approach is more beneficial to pupils than the traditional way sparks off a heated debate. From my perspective, I agree with the view that students can acquire more benefits from the remote education.To begin with, studying at home save the pupils enormous time and considerable expense. Students who use distance-learning programs can cut down their commuting time, tuition fees, textbook fees and so forth just by an internet connection. This especially makes a significant difference for the children who live in the far-off countryside and the children whose families are living below the poverty-line.Besides that, long-distance education provides students the opportunity to access the immense knowledge resources and a variety of teaching approaches. Pupils can obtain materials for their curricula just by one mouse click, such as science reports, study posts, documentary records, etc. A student can even select a specific online course based on his own preference and time schedule so he can control the learning progress and make satisfactory achievement on this course.It is undeniable that traditional education has its advantages in face-to-face communication, mental inspiration and physical educations. These make remarkable contributions in providing immediate feedbacks and cultivating pupils' personalities. But with the improvements in streaming and sensor technologies, remote education can eliminate the obstacles of distance and body contacts.In conclusion, I concede that traditional education has some merits like feedbacks and inspirations that cannot be replaced in the near future. However, distance-learning outweighs the conventional way not only with its efficiency, convenience and economic value, but also with the self-regulated education that pupils can study on their own purpose.
llm: The advent of distance-learning programs has revolutionized the way people access education, with many opting to study from the comfort of their homes. While some argue that this method of learning cannot compare to the traditional college or university experience, I strongly disagree. In fact, distance-learning programs offer a multitude of benefits that make them an attractive alternative to conventional education.One of the most significant advantages of distance learning is the ability to cut down on unnecessary expenses. With just an internet connection, students can access study materials, thereby eliminating the need for commuting, which in turn reduces costs associated with transportation, tuition fees, and textbook fees. This makes quality education more accessible and affordable to a wider range of people, including those who may be financially constrained or have mobility issues.Moreover, long-distance education provides students with the unparalleled opportunity to access immense knowledge resources and a variety of teaching approaches that might not be available locally. The internet is replete with educational resources, including online lectures, e-books, and interactive learning platforms, which cater to different learning styles and preferences. This diversity in educational content ensures that students can engage with materials in a way that is most effective for them, potentially leading to better learning outcomes.In conclusion, distance-learning programs are not only a viable alternative but also a beneficial one, offering flexibility, cost savings, and unparalleled access to educational resources. As technology continues to advance, the quality and accessibility of distance learning will only improve, making it an increasingly attractive option for those seeking to further their education. Therefore, I firmly believe that distance learning can indeed bring as many benefits as attending a college or university, if not more.

question: There are many extinct species in the world nowadays. Some people say we should protect these animals from dying out, while others say we should concentrate more on problems of human beings. Discuss both opinions and give your personal view.
human: Many animals today are in danger of extinction owing to various reasons. While some people believe it is important to protect these endangered species, others argue that problems of human beings deserve more attention. In my opinion, we should give priority to our own issues.Animal protectionists may base their argument on the ground that biodiversity is essential to maintain the balance of ecosystem. If certain species are absent from this system, such kind of balance is likely to be disrupted and other species, including human beings, will come under threat. Therefore, it is our responsibility to keep as many species on the Earth as possible.However, I think species extinction is quite natural according to the theory of evolution. The environment on the Earth has been transformed many times since the first species came into being. A great number of plants and animals died out because they were unable to fit into the new environment. On most occasions, the process of extinction of some species is irrevocable and we can do nothing about it.Furthermore, human beings nowadays are still faced with many urgent problems such as starvation, disease and wars. When these problems are taken into account, extinction of some animals recedes greatly in importance and it is not sensible to devote our limited resources to animals that have been past help. We should put our own survival and sustainment in order first before considering the conservation of other species.In conclusion, more emphasis should be laid on human beings other than animals, and it is better to let nature take its course with regard to species extinction.
llm: The issue of extinct species has sparked a heated debate about whether we should prioritize protecting animals from dying out or focus on human problems. On one hand, animal protectionists argue that safeguarding endangered species is crucial for maintaining the balance of our ecosystem. They base their argument on the ground that biodiversity is essential to preserve the delicate harmony of nature. By protecting animals, we ensure that the ecosystem remains intact, which in turn supports human life and well-being. For instance, the loss of pollinators like bees can have devastating effects on our food supply, highlighting the interconnectedness of species and ecosystems.On the other hand, some people contend that we should concentrate more on problems affecting human beings, such as poverty, disease, and inequality. They point out that extinction is quite natural according to the theory of evolution, where species adapt and evolve or face extinction. Moreover, the environment on Earth has been transformed many times since the first species came into being, with natural events like climate change and geological upheavals leading to the demise of certain species. From this perspective, human issues take precedence over animal conservation.In my opinion, while human problems are undoubtedly pressing, I believe that animal protection and conservation are equally important. The loss of species can have unforeseen and far-reaching consequences for the health of our planet. Furthermore, many human problems, such as poverty and disease, are intricately linked to environmental degradation and the loss of biodiversity. Therefore, I think that we should strive to find a balance between addressing human issues and protecting endangered species, recognizing that the well-being of our planet and its inhabitants are inextricably linked. By preserving biodiversity, we ultimately ensure the long-term survival and prosperity of human societies.

question: Universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject. To what extend do you agree or disagree.
human: In today's context, education is the most significant factor which ultimately determines one's future. In my personal opinion, I am totally agreed with the view that there should not be any room for partiality in terms of gender while allocating seats for students in every university courses. There appear to be various reasons often strike in my mind in support of this position. To begin with, judging student's skills and abilities should only be based on their academic qualifications and talents rather than gender in particular. Nowadays, both male and female students are equally competitive to each other and deserve to produce impressive results in various field of education. In India, for example, female students are more often likely to grab more number of top scorer positions in every year higher secondary school examinations. Furthermore, female students are highly interested in learning courses such as mechanical engineering which demands physical activities in their lab workshops, unlike previous generation females. In addition, due to increasing exposure on current affairs and knowledge on cutting-edge technological developments, female graduates are more willing to take huge responsibilities in their workplace, despite its intensive stress and pressure. For example, Chanda Kochhar, who is the CEO of India's second largest bank called ICICI bank and prominently awarded as the country's most powerful female head in business sector. In conclusion, I am firmly supporting the view, that every student either male or female should be given fairly equal opportunity to purse their education in all university subjects, provided they should meet the required qualifications rather than putting limitations based on their gender. Government should take interim measures, to regulate admission process for university courses which enables every student to get benefit.
llm: In today's context, education is the most significant factor which ultimately determines one's future. With this in mind, the question of whether universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject is a contentious issue. In my personal opinion, there should not be any room for partiality in terms of gender while allocating seats for students in every university course. This stance is grounded in the principle of equality and fairness, which are essential for fostering a just and progressive society.There appear to be various reasons that often strike in my mind in support of this position. Firstly, accepting equal numbers of male and female students promotes diversity and inclusivity, which are crucial for a rich and vibrant academic environment. When both genders are represented equally, it encourages a broader range of perspectives, leading to more comprehensive and balanced discussions. Furthermore, equal representation helps to break down gender stereotypes and biases that may exist in certain subjects, thereby promoting a more level playing field for all students.Moreover, ensuring equal numbers of male and female students in every subject can help address historical imbalances and promote gender equality in fields where one gender has traditionally been underrepresented. This is particularly significant in subjects like science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM), where women have often been minority. By actively working towards parity, universities can play a pivotal role in challenging and changing these dynamics, contributing to a more equitable society.In conclusion, the principle of accepting equal numbers of male and female students in every subject aligns with the values of equality, fairness, and progress. It is not only a matter of social justice but also a strategy to enrich academic environments and prepare students for a world where collaboration and mutual respect between genders are paramount. Therefore, I strongly agree that universities should strive for this balance, as it reflects a commitment to providing equal opportunities for all, regardless of gender.

question: One of the consequences of improved medical care is that people are living longer and life expectancy is increasing. Do you think the disadvantages of this development outweight the disadvantages?
human: Along with the development of technologies, advanced medical care has played an important role in the improvement of life expectancy. Although the increase in life expectancy has some pressure on the Medicare system, I am inclined to believe that the advanced medical care brings with it more benefits than disadvantages.The main advantage of high-tech medical care is that people are better taken care so that they have a good health. They can contribute effectively to the development of the economy because healthy workers can create more productivity. In other words, they do not have to spend more time in health checking or treatment so this saves an amount of time as well as cost.In addition, a community with the elderly who have a good health has a major role to play in a sustainable development of a society. In facts, young people will be happy as their parents, grandparents are healthy. It can be said that the improvement of medical care makes a better life for all people.On the other hand, some people maintain that the increase in life expectancy puts a high pressure on the economic system because more pension have to spend for Medicare instead of investing in other sectors of the economic system. Although it is real in some aspects, I believe that the capital that spend on taking care the elderly is contributed by these people during their working time, so they are worth to have good care. They have given their effort to the society so that young people, the governments have a responsibility to improve the Medicare system.By way of conclusion, it is true that the development of the health care system helps people have a better life. It helps people build a sustainable society where people can live a happy life when they are old.
llm: The significant advancement in medical care has led to a substantial increase in life expectancy. Advanced medical care has played an important role in the improvement of life expectancy, allowing people to live longer and healthier lives. The main advantage of high-tech medical care is that people are better taken care of, resulting in good health and a higher quality of life. This development has numerous benefits, outweighing the disadvantages.A community with a significant number of healthy elderly individuals has a major role to play in the sustainable development of a society. The experience and wisdom that older generations possess can be invaluable assets to the community. They can share their knowledge, provide guidance, and contribute to the social and economic development of the society. Furthermore, a healthy elderly population can also reduce the burden on the healthcare system, as they require less medical attention and care.In conclusion, the improvement in life expectancy due to advanced medical care is a positive development that has numerous benefits for individuals and society as a whole. While there may be some disadvantages, such as increased pressure on pension and social security systems, the advantages of a healthy and experienced elderly population far outweigh the drawbacks. Therefore, it is essential to continue investing in advanced medical care to ensure that people can live long, healthy, and productive lives, contributing to the sustainable development of our society. By doing so, we can create a brighter future for generations to come.

question: Some people believe that a college or university education should be available to all students. Others believe that higher education should be available only to good students. Discuss these views. Which view do you agree with? Explain why.
human: The purpose of education is always a controversial topic among people and society, especially in high level such as college or university. Some people think that all students should deserve to be educated at this level. However, in my opinion, it should be better to leave this type of type of training for a certain group of good, knowledgeable learners.First, focusing only on talented students is a better option because it helps academic institutions maintain their high education quality. Unlike middle school or high school, university and college require far a lot of ability and skills to keep up with an enormous amount of complex knowledge. In fact, some students may be capable in high schools, but the pressure of higher education is tough even for talented ones. That explains why it is only suitable for a limited people, and opening up for everyone will be fatal for institutions, since they need to somehow lower the materials so that it is practical for everyone.Secondly, university should only accept good students because it gives better human resources for sophisticated purposes. Some people argue that this may lead to 'social division', when someone with high education refuses to do the called 'low jobs', but actually it gives no harm to the whole community. Those standard jobs will always be available for everyone, while complex ones should be only handled by the best people, who start their career from the best institutions. I think limiting the number of people who can be admitted by universities is a good choice since it will reward the motivation of students and constantly keep them in the difficult level of learning, which makes them do the best to improve themselves. Ultimately, this improves the overall quality of education and gives the best people to serve in the most necessary needs of the society.To sum thing up, I agree that everyone should have a compulsory education level up to high school, but the above divisions should be only the realm of the best students. This will improve the quality of both universities and students, thus placing people in positions which suit them most.
llm: The purpose of education is always a controversial topic among people and society, with differing opinions on who should have access to higher education. While some argue that college or university education should be available to all students, others believe that it should be reserved for good students. In my opinion, it should be better to leave this type of training for a certain group of good, knowledgeable learners.Focusing only on talented students is a better option because it helps academic institutions maintain their high education quality. When universities accept only good students, they can ensure that their programs are being utilized effectively, and that students are able to fully grasp and apply the knowledge and skills being taught. This, in turn, enables academic institutions to produce high-caliber graduates who are well-equipped to contribute to their respective fields.Furthermore, university should only accept good students because it gives better human resources for sophisticated purposes. By selectively admitting top students, universities can cultivate a pool of talented and dedicated individuals who are capable of driving innovation, innovation, and progress in various industries. This selective approach to admission not only benefits the students themselves but also society as a whole, as it ensures that the most talented and motivated individuals are being educated and trained to tackle complex challenges and make meaningful contributions.In conclusion, while making higher education available to all students may seem like an equitable approach, I firmly believe that reserving it for good students is the more effective and beneficial strategy. By doing so, academic institutions can maintain their standards, produce high-quality graduates, and ultimately provide society with the skilled and knowledgeable human resources it needs to thrive.

question: Agree or disagree? Universities spend money on improving facilities (labs and general requirements) better than hiring famous teachers.Ê
human: There is a hotly debated issue over whether universities should spend money on improving facilities is more than hiring famous teachers, and this topic can be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to prefer that schools should invest in renewing facilities, while other seem to believe that famous teachers is more conducive to students. After deeply pondering over this issue, I develop my own perspective as well. I favor the former; that is, I prefer to spend money on improving facilities. The first and foremost reason lies in an inevitable fact that the more advanced facilities we have, the more chances we can increase our knowledge. For example, library is a good place for students to study or research. They can concentrate on the subjects with a tranquil ambience; also, there are a lot of references for students to utilize. With this convenient and versatile facility, students can improve their learning condition. Therefore, we can commence to agree that certain facilities are beneficial to students. Moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that students are not always staying in classrooms. They have numerous activities in school. Consider a circumstance in which a student who is a member of jazz ensemble in their school. He must need a better auditorium for him to have an extraordinary performance. With this distinguished performance, the student would acquire an unforgettable and valuable experience burring deeply in his mind. Hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that students would prefer school to spending on improving facilities.Admittedly, on the other hand, there might be some people proclaiming that schools should spend money on hiring prestigious teachers because they can impart their students well. However, according to my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying owing to its imprudence. A student is good or not do not depend on whether he has a good teacher but is decided by his effort on study. It is useless to hire a super famous teacher to teach those who behaviors as sluggards. Based on the reasons demonstrate above, I believe that improving facilities is the best way for school because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the other. In other words, students can procure more advantages from better facilities. It is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. Still, I an firmly convinced that the reasons I have proposed in favor of my sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.
llm: The debate about how universities should allocate their resources has sparked a longstanding discussion. Some people tend to prefer that schools should invest in renewing facilities, such as laboratories and general infrastructure, while others seem to believe that hiring famous teachers is more conducive to students' learning experiences. In my opinion, I agree that universities spend money on improving facilities better than hiring famous teachers.On one hand, hiring renowned educators can undoubtedly bring prestige and intellectual stimulation to a university. Famous teachers can share their valuable insights and experiences, offering students a unique opportunity to learn from the best in their field. However, the benefits of hiring famous teachers are somewhat limited. Once the teacher leaves, the university is left with the same outdated facilities, which can hinder the learning process and stifle innovation.On the other hand, improving facilities provides a more sustainable and far-reaching impact on students' educational experience. State-of-the-art laboratories, advanced technology, and well-maintained infrastructure can enhance the overall learning environment, fostering a more engaging and effective learning experience. Modern facilities can also attract more students, faculty, and research grants, ultimately leading to a more vibrant academic community. Moreover, improved facilities can accommodate a larger number of students, providing equal opportunities for learning and growth.Based on the reasons demonstrated above, I believe that improving facilities is the best way for schools because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the other. By investing in facilities, universities can create a conducive learning environment that benefits all students, regardless of the teachers they have. In conclusion, while hiring famous teachers has its merits, I firmly believe that improving facilities is a more prudent and beneficial investment for universities, leading to a better educational experience for students.

question: Do you agree or dis agree with the following statement? High schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Some people state that high schools should allow students to study what they want to. They believe this motivates students to study. I think, however, students should study a broad range of subjects from literature to mathematics. I believe that tertiary education should make students prepare for specialization at university. In addition, it should be to some extent paternalistic to prevent students from avoiding hurdles.To begin with, students have to find one or more fields of study in which they are really interested. They should not decide their future major without trying a broad range of subjects, otherwise they might miss valuable encounter with the subject. For instance, a would-be mathematician student may be strongly intrigued by philosophy and make a success in the field.Next, students should obtain knowledge from a variety of academic fields. General education plays a significant role in specialized education. Science today, for example, is said to be more and more specialized, but in order to solve a problem scientists have to combine knowledge from chemistry to physics. In addition, although textbooks used in higher education are labelled particular subjects, in fact they require basic understanding of other subjects. For instance, you sometimes need knowledge about physics to read a text on chemistry. Therefore, high school students should learn broadly and prepare future learning at university.Last but not least, students have tendency to shun difficulties. They might avoid tough courses, but instead attend mainly Mickey Mouse courses and enjoy themselves too much. This might result in limited choices in the future. Therefore, schools should be responsible for their future and protect them.In summary, students should find interesting subjects and acquire general knowledge to prepare higher education at tertiary education. Besides, high school must be responsible for their future with well-planned curriculum.
llm: The statement that high schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study is one that I strongly agree with. Allowing students to explore their interests and passions can have a profound impact on their academic and personal growth. It is essential for students to find one or more fields of study in which they are really interested, as this can foster a sense of excitement and motivation towards learning.Moreover, students should not decide their future major without trying a broad range of subjects. By exploring various fields, such as science, math, humanities, or languages, they can gain a deeper understanding of what truly captivates them. For instance, a student may think they are interested in pursuing a career in engineering, but after taking a course in psychology, they may discover a new passion. By allowing students to study the courses they want, they can make informed decisions about their future academic and career paths.Additionally, tertiary education should make students prepare for specialization at university. High school is a critical period for students to lay the foundation for their future studies. By permitting students to study the courses they are interested in, high schools can help them develop a strong foundation in their desired field, and better prepare them for the specialization that will occur at the university level. This, in turn, can lead to greater academic success and a more fulfilling university experience.In conclusion, allowing high school students to study the courses they want is crucial for their academic and personal development. It enables them to discover their true interests, make informed decisions about their future, and prepare for specialization at the university level. By giving students the autonomy to choose their courses, high schools can empower them to take ownership of their learning and set them up for success in their future academic pursuits.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Games are as important for adults as they are for children. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: As people grow up, the arguments about the importance of games arise. Some people think that, adults need playing games as children do. However, in my opinion, games are no longer too important for them for several reasons.The first reason is that games become unnecessary for people when their careers begin. Someone may argue that games help adults relax and become more balanced in life. But, more often, the pressure of work and family commitment force them to abandon their lifelong hobbies, and as a result, they cannot spend enough time and effort to their favorite games as they did in 15 or 20 years ago. For example, in my country, except for a minor part of professional athletes, the majority of people stop playing games seriously as soon as they find a decent job. They often feel that such games become more troublesome than enjoyable for their daily lives.Another reason should be mentioned is that adults often do not pursue games as a competitive activity, while children are always keen on competition and winning. For youngsters, maintaining their desire to win often develops many outstanding characteristics whether they participate sport events or not. For example, my younger sister likes fencing, and thanks to her desire to win, she never gives up when facing a difficult situation, or even becoming hurt. On the other hand, adults often consider such behaviors as childish and drop them immediately. In fact, a competitive person usually finds it difficult to cooperate with friends and colleagues. Because of that, they no longer play games for any moderate achievements, and gradually lose their interest in such activities.To sum up, I think adults do need to play games, but their styles are often distinct from children's, which are often less competitive and more enjoyable. Along with the high requirement for family and work, games are just some leisure activities for adults, not something necessary as they are meant to be for children.
llm: The statement that games are as important for adults as they are for children has sparked a heated debate. While some people think that adults need playing games as children do, providing them with essential skills such as problem-solving and teamwork, I disagree. In my opinion, games are no longer too important for adults for several reasons.Firstly, the pressure of work and family commitments force them to abandon their lifelong hobbies, including playing games. Adults have numerous responsibilities, such as providing for their families, paying bills, and managing their careers, which leave them with little time for leisure activities like gaming. As a result, they often have to prioritize their obligations over their personal interests.Moreover, adults' physical and mental needs are different from those of children. While games can be beneficial for children's cognitive and motor skills development, adults require more practical and relevant activities to maintain their well-being. For instance, exercise, reading, or spending time with family and friends are more essential for adults' physical and mental health.Additionally, the nature of games has changed significantly over the years, with many games now being designed specifically for children or younger audiences. The complexity and content of these games may not appeal to adults, who may find them immature or uninteresting. In contrast, adults may prefer more mature and intellectually stimulating activities, such as puzzles, strategy games, or educational programs.In conclusion, while games can be beneficial for adults, I believe that they are not as important for them as they are for children. The demands of adulthood, combined with the different needs and preferences of adults, make games a less significant part of their lives.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Modern technology is creating a single world culture. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: There are many different opinions regarding world culture. Some people think that all the countries in the world cannot have a single culture. However, in my view, a single modern culture is being created by modern technology for the following reasons.Firstly, most of the countries have the same educational system based on technology. Teachers give topics to the students who should research on the internet to find data, and then students should type their research by using computer and even give a presentation by using PowerPoint. For example, students who are studying in Iran use the same software, Microsoft, to type their homework or have presentation compared to Canadian students.Secondly, new technology has created some similar jobs all around the world. Computer technology is a growing job in most of the countries, and students are being encouraged to study in this field. For example, many immigrants in Canada who have the degree in computer technology fields can easily go to Canadian universities and find jobs with good salaries. This example shows that jobs that are related to technology are in demand in most of the countries.Some people might argue that there are some cultures such as making foods which are unicq in each culture, and technology cannot affect them. This point has some merits on the surface; however, many countries such as Canada, the USA, and British have many restaurants which serve many foods form different countries and cultures. In fact, cooks can find many new food recipes easily on the Internet. For example, two days ago, I went to a Canadian restaurant, and I ate noodle, sushi, which are Chinese foods, and Greek salad.To sum up, new technology has affected cultures of the world, and we can see many similarities in many cultures. In fact, new technology has influences on educational system, jobs and foods in the world.
llm: The advent of modern technology has led to a significant impact on cultures around the world, and I agree that it is creating a single world culture. The widespread use of technology has bridged geographical gaps, allowing people from different cultures to connect and share ideas. As a result, we can observe many similarities emerging across cultures. For instance, students in Iran use the same software, Microsoft, to type their homework or give presentations as their counterparts in Canada. This homogenization of technological tools is a clear indicator that a single modern culture is being created.A single modern culture is being created by modern technology for several reasons. Firstly, the internet and social media platforms have made it possible for people to access and share information from anywhere in the world. This has led to a globalization of ideas, values, and beliefs, which are being adopted by people across different cultures. Secondly, the use of similar technological tools and platforms has created a sense of uniformity, where people from different cultures are using the same language, symbols, and imagery to communicate and express themselves.Furthermore, modern technology has also led to the emergence of global trends and fashions, which are being followed by people across different cultures. For example, the use of smartphones, online shopping, and streaming services are becoming increasingly popular across the world, transcending cultural boundaries. In conclusion, the impact of modern technology on cultures is undeniable, and it is clear that a single modern culture is being created. As technology continues to advance and spread, we can expect to see even more similarities emerging across cultures, ultimately leading to a more homogenized and interconnected world.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: Nowadays it is much easier to achieve success with the help from one's family than what is like before
human: There are many factors that contribute to one's success. However, which factor is the most influential one is open to debate. Some people believe that nowadays the assitance from family is quite a essential factor in one's success. It seems that one can achieve success more easily with the help from his or her family. I agree with this statement. In my opinion, family plays a more important role in helping one to pursuit success. There are a couple of reasons.First of all, more and more people have the opportunity to receive education from university. Since our parents receive better education than our grandparents did, they can provide more advices and helps in our career. In the past, seldom people have the chance to attend a collage. For example, my grandparents did not get a education even in high school, so when my father had difficulty in solving a problem in his childhood, he had to go to his teacher for help. Things have changed a lot. I grow up in a better condition than my father did. Whenever I have problems, I can always ask my parents for help. They can solve the problem quickly because they have learned quite a lot. What is more, family members can help us in many other aspects. For example, when I did not know what major to choose when I attend university, my father told a lot about different majors. He shared his own experience with me, which helped me quite a lot. Parents are quite experienced than their child, they can guide them toward the right direction. Besides, parents can told their children as many as they can. What they want is help their child to make a progress.In a word, our parents and other family members can help us a lot in our life. I believe that with the help of our family, we can achieve success quite easily.
llm: The statement that nowadays it is much easier to achieve success with the help from one's family than what it was before has sparked a heated debate. Some people believe that nowadays the assistance from family is quite an essential factor in one's success. In my opinion, family plays a more important role in helping one to pursue success. There are a couple of reasons that support this view.Firstly, the financial support provided by family can greatly alleviate the burden of achieving success. With the rising costs of education and living expenses, it is becoming increasingly difficult for individuals to make ends meet, let alone pursue their goals. Family assistance, whether it be financial or emotional, can provide a safety net, allowing individuals to take risks and focus on their passions. For instance, many entrepreneurs rely on family loans or investments to get their businesses off the ground.Secondly, the emotional support and guidance provided by family can be just as valuable as financial assistance. Having a supportive family can provide a sense of security and motivation, driving individuals to work harder and push through challenges. Additionally, family members can offer valuable advice and mentorship, helping individuals navigate the complexities of their chosen path. For example, a parent who has experience in a particular field can provide invaluable guidance and connections to their child.In conclusion, while some may argue that success is solely dependent on individual effort, I firmly believe that family plays a significant role in helping one achieve success. The financial and emotional support provided by family can be a crucial factor in overcoming obstacles and staying motivated. As such, I agree that nowadays it is much easier to achieve success with the help from one's family than what it was before.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
human: There are many different opinions regarding hobbies. Some people would rather watch TV. However, in my view, reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies for the following reasons.Firstly, fiction books pay more attention to details. In fact, we can know characters, places, and times of a novel very well during reading it. Most of the novels describe not only main characters but also other people in the novels, where each scene is happening. For example, after I read animal farms which is a story of Russian revolution, I could understand the leaders and different segments of the Russian people. However, a movie just gives us a very small review of its stories and characters.Secondly, reading a novel is more convenient. Some novels have around 100 pages and readers cannot finish them in just one hour. Yet these people can continue to read their novels wherever they find free time such as in bus or trains. For example, I have started to read a novel since last week. I do not have enough time to read a novel in one day, so I usually read it when I am coming home from English class. In contrast, I cannot watch a complete movie because I can just sit in front of TV for 15 minutes and after that, I have to study.Some people might argue that people enjoy watching TV when they know they can learn many things such as learning a language by watching movies. This point has some merits on the surface; however, movies are not a good idea to learn a language for beginners since characters in movies speak very fast and unclear for language learners. For these learners it is better to start by reading some novels which are more comprehensible and enjoyable.To sum up, reading fictions is more pleasant because these books have more depth, are much easier to use, and more useful for language learners.
llm: The statement that reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies has sparked a debate among book lovers and movie enthusiasts. In my opinion, I strongly agree with this statement. Reading fiction, such as novels and short stories, is more enjoyable than watching movies for several compelling reasons.Firstly, fiction books pay more attention to details, allowing readers to immerse themselves in the world created by the author. Unlike movies, which are limited by time and visuals, novels can delve deeper into the characters' thoughts, feelings, and backstories, providing a richer and more engaging experience. This level of detail enables readers to develop a more profound connection with the story and its characters.Secondly, reading a novel is more convenient than watching a movie. Many novels have around 100 pages or less, making them easily consumable in short periods. In contrast, movies typically require a significant time commitment, often exceeding two hours. This makes it challenging for individuals with busy schedules, like students, to watch a complete movie. For instance, I often find myself with only 15 minutes of free time before I need to study, which is insufficient to watch a movie, but perfect for reading a few chapters of a book.In conclusion, reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies due to its attention to detail and convenience.
