In addition to the previous point, various zoos do not have the proper implements or policies that assure the quality of animal care. For instance, I recall my first trip to a zoo, at age eight. I was shocked by the cruelty which animals were treated. I can not think of any staff memeber who did not have an improper behaviour towards the animlas in the zoo. They beat them up because they did not wanted to eat their meals and then excused themselves saying that it was a way to train the animals.In conclusion, I strongly believe that we have to assit animals and provide them the best quality of life possible. Scientific facts showed the damage that zoos can inflict on animals. Moreover, many zoos do not meet the standards of care required for them.
llm: The debate about whether animals should be kept in zoos has sparked intense discussion among animal lovers and conservationists. While many people state that zoos are a great asset to animals, as they provide a safe and controlled environment for them to thrive, others believe that they are inferior creatures and therefore do not deserve our attention. However, in my opinion, we must help animals live safely and comfortably in their own environment, rather than confining them to enclosures for human entertainment.Keeping animals in zoos can be detrimental to their well-being, as it can cause them undue stress and disrupt their natural behavior. For instance, many animals in zoos exhibit abnormal behaviors such as pacing, self-mutilation, and aggression, which are clear indicators of their distress. Furthermore, zoos often fail to provide animals with the space and stimulation they need to thrive, leading to a poor quality of life. On the other hand, allowing animals to live in their natural habitats ensures that they can roam freely, hunt, and interact with their own kind, thereby promoting their physical and mental health.Moreover, conservation efforts should focus on protecting and preserving natural habitats, rather than relying on zoos as a means of conservation. By preserving and restoring natural ecosystems, we can ensure the long-term survival of species, rather than relying on artificial environments. In conclusion, while zoos may have some benefits, I firmly believe that animals should be free to live in their own environment, where they can thrive and live safely and comfortably. It is our responsibility to protect and conserve their natural habitats, rather than keeping them in captivity for our own entertainment.

question: A university plans to develop a new research center in your country. Some people want a center for business research. Other people want a center for research in agriculture (farming). Which of these two kinds of research centers do you recommend for your country? Use specific reasons in your recommendation.
human: Most of the universities in the world seek to develop some research in some countries. These researches can be aimed for several fields such as business or agriculture. If a university plans to develop a new research in my country and I have to choose between establishing a centre for business research or a centre for agriculture research, I would opt for the second one.First of all, my country has a lot of land which is useful for the agriculture. Most of these lands are left without any treatment. The centre for research in agriculture can help my co-citizens to better exploit these land. This centre can also help people there to solve their issues related to their land. Especially, if they have no knowledge or education in this field.Secondly, the centre for research in agriculture helps the economy of my country to improve. The agriculture field has only thirty percent as a market part. The centre of research can raise the market part of this field by developing the agriculture products. For example, the dates are the most important agriculture product in my country. The centre of research for agriculture can make some research in how to get a good quality of this product, how to treat the Palme and maybe how to treat the land of the palms.Another reason that makes the centre of research for the agriculture more important than the centre of business research is that the first one can create a lot of jobs. Obviously, showing people how to exploit a land and get good agriculture products will push people to think about working in the field of agriculture rather than working in business or other field to make money. Some people think that a centre of business research is more important because we have to be in parallel with the advanced countries which have focused in business field. For me being a developed country does not mean that we have to focus only in business, but we have to focus on what really bring us to the level of self satisfaction, and the agriculture for our country is the field that can realize that.My country need to focus more on the agriculture by establishing centers for research in this field, which will have some very positive consequences on agriculture people work, on the economy and on the employment.
llm: If a university plans to develop a new research center in my country, I would strongly recommend establishing a center for research in agriculture over a center for business research. This decision is driven by the potential of agricultural research to directly benefit the local population and contribute significantly to the country's economic development.Firstly, a center for research in agriculture can empower my fellow citizens to better exploit the land. By developing innovative farming techniques, improving crop yields, and enhancing the quality of agricultural products, the center can help increase food security and provide farmers with the tools they need to compete in both local and international markets. This not only enhances the livelihoods of those directly involved in farming but also contributes to the overall food supply, benefiting the entire population.Secondly, such a center can play a crucial role in improving the economy of my country. Notably, the agriculture field currently accounts for only thirty percent of the market share, indicating a vast potential for growth. By investing in agricultural research, the university can help unlock this potential, leading to increased productivity, job creation, and economic expansion. Moreover, a thriving agricultural sector can contribute to a more balanced economy, reducing dependence on other sectors and fostering sustainable development.In conclusion, given the potential to enhance land use, improve food security, and boost the national economy, a center for research in agriculture is the more beneficial choice for my country. It aligns with national interests, supports local communities, and has the potential to drive meaningful economic growth, making it a recommendation that I firmly stand behind.

question: People learn in different ways. Some people learn by doing things, other people learn by reading about things, others learn by listening to people talk about things. Which of these methods of learning is best for you? Use specific examples to support your choice.
human: People have a lot of things to learn in their lives. They use several ways to broaden their knowledge and their skills. One of these several ways of learning that I prefer is doing things by my self rather than learning by reading about things or learning by listening to people talking about. There are a lot of reasons to recommend this method for who is serious about learning some thing in their lives.First of all, learning by doing things develops our maturity. When you do things by your self, you learn to depend on yourself. You will not be in need to refer to books or persons. The fact of doing things by ourselves can help us to get some experiences that would strong our maturity. For example if some one wants to learn how to be a leader, they have to experience this by being in a real situation of leading a team or a group, or even a situation. We can not be leaders by reading books or by listening to person talking about leading. Secondly, learning by doing things is more exciting than learning by reading about things or listening to people talking about. There are a lot of things in life that should be learnt by doing them. Reading about things or listening to people talking about can rarely submit the same sensation or the same excitement to some one who wants to learn about the same thing. People who want to learn how to swim have to go to the beach or to the swimpool and laid themselves in the water to feel and know what is swimming. Nor listening to people or reading about can teach them swimming.Another reason that makes learning by doing things more advantageous than learning by reading about things or listening to people talking about is that we find more motivation to continuing on learning by doing things. With the time, Reading about things or listening to people talking about could become more and more boring. Learning by doing things gives us more and more pleasure especially if we success in learning perfectly this things. So we become motivated to learn other things by doing them.The history shows that learning by doing things is the best way and the best method to learn things. People should not depend only on reading or listening to people talking about things to learn. They should try and keep trying until they learn what they want to learn.
llm: People learn in different ways, and with so many things to discover in life, it's essential to find the most effective method that suits each individual. Throughout our lives, we are presented with numerous opportunities to broaden our knowledge and skills, and we often utilize several ways to achieve this. Among the various methods of learning, I strongly prefer learning by doing things myself, rather than relying on reading about them or listening to others talk about them.Learning by doing things has been the most impactful for me, as it not only helps me understand concepts better but also develops my maturity. When I engage in hands-on experiences, I am forced to think critically and make decisions independently. This approach has taught me to depend on myself, rather than relying on others for guidance. For instance, when I was learning to cook, I didn't just read recipes or watch cooking videos. Instead, I started preparing meals on my own, making mistakes, and learning from them. This practical experience not only improved my cooking skills but also boosted my confidence in taking on new challenges.By doing things myself, I have learned to take responsibility for my actions, to problem-solve, and to adapt to new situations. These skills are invaluable and have benefited me in many areas of my life, from academics to personal projects. Furthermore, learning by doing encourages experimentation, creativity, and innovation, which are essential for personal and professional growth. In conclusion, while reading and listening are valuable learning tools, I firmly believe that doing things myself is the best method for me, as it fosters independence, maturity, and a deeper understanding of the world around me.

question: Many people think that cheap air travel should be encouraged because it gives ordinary people the freedom to travel further. However, others think that this leads to environmental problem, and so air travel should be more expensive in order to discourage people from having it. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
human: In recent years, many airlines offer to their customers more and more number of cheap flights. People have various different views about cheap air travel. Although there are good arguments in favour of this trend should be encouraged, I personally think that cheap flight can make many serious problem.It is undeniable that cheap air fares have broadened travel possibilities for many people, particularly for the lower income group. These days, millions of people can travel around the world for work or pleasure. They can develop their careers, broad their knowledge, and interact with many other people from varied cultural backgrounds. Moreover, travels also help to promote the tourist industry development, boost the economy and job markets of many countries.On the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. Apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airport that may be grown the air pollution for people who live and work close to it. However, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. Burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxide into environment that cause the Earth to heat up. In fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce CO2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines. In conclusion, I would argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. However, it does not mean that air travel should be more expensive. Instead, people should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions caused by their lifestyle choices.
llm: The advent of cheap air travel has sparked a heated debate about its impact on society and the environment. On one hand, many people believe that affordable air fares should be encouraged as they have broadened travel possibilities for many individuals, particularly those from lower income groups. This has given ordinary people the freedom to travel further, exploring new destinations and experiencing different cultures. Cheap air fares have made it possible for people to visit their loved ones who live abroad, or to take a dream vacation that was previously unaffordable.On the other hand, there are those who argue that the growth of cheap flights has a negative impact on the environment. The burning of plane fuel releases carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, which contributes to global warming, causing the Earth to heat up. This has severe consequences, including rising sea levels, more frequent natural disasters, and unpredictable weather patterns. To mitigate these effects, some advocate for making air travel more expensive to discourage people from flying, thereby reducing the carbon footprint of the aviation industry.In my opinion, while the environmental concerns are valid, I believe that cheap air travel should still be encouraged, but with a caveat. Airlines and governments should invest in sustainable aviation practices, such as using biofuels, improving fuel efficiency, and implementing carbon offsetting schemes. This way, the benefits of affordable air travel can be balanced with the need to protect the environment. Ultimately, a balanced approach that considers both the social and environmental implications of cheap air travel is necessary to ensure that the freedom to travel is preserved for future generations.

question: Should governments spend more money on improving roads and highways, or should governments spend more money on improving public transportation(buses, trains, subways)? Why?Ê
human: Many people think that governments should spend money on improving roads and highways while the others say that it would be better to spend money on public transportation. In my opinion, governments should certainly spend money on the public transportation system because it would deal with problems that the rising number of private cars is creating.First, the using of public transportation reduces the amount of resources using on transportation. Cars depend on gasoline, which is a non-renewable resource. Therefore, the more cars we use means that the faster gasoline in this world is used up. In the contrary, if the public transportation is efficiently used, the amount of gasoline consuming per person will be much lower. And this definitely helps to reserve our invaluable natural resource, gasoline.Second, public transportation helps to solve the air pollution problems. Averagely, public transports use much less gasoline to carry people than private cars. It means that by using public transports, the less gas exhaust is pumped to the air and people will no longer have to bear the stuffy situation on the roads, which is always full of fumes.Last but not least, using public transportation is much safer than private transportation. According to National Safety Council, riding the bus is over 170 times safer than private care. Thus there is no reason that governments should hesitate to invest in public transportation, a healthy, safe and economical way of transporting.In short, I can say for certain that spending money on improving public transportation is necessary because it is the key to protect our world, creating a healthy and safe environment for people to live in.
llm: The debate on whether governments should allocate more funds to improve roads and highways or enhance public transportation has been ongoing. In my opinion, governments should certainly spend money on the public transportation system. This is because the rising number of private cars is creating numerous problems that can be mitigated through the use of public transportation.Firstly, using public transportation reduces the amount of resources used on transportation. When people opt for buses, trains, or subways, they significantly decrease the demand for private cars, which in turn, leads to a reduction in fuel consumption and the subsequent strain on natural resources. This is a crucial step towards sustainable development and conservation of energy.Secondly, public transportation helps to solve air pollution problems. The excessive number of private cars on the road contributes to a significant increase in air pollution, which has severe consequences on the environment and public health. By encouraging the use of public transportation, governments can reduce the number of vehicles emitting harmful pollutants, thereby improving air quality.Moreover, public transportation is a safer mode of travel. According to the National Safety Council, riding the bus is over 170 times safer than driving a private car. This is a compelling reason for governments to invest in public transportation, as it would lead to a reduction in accidents and fatalities on the road.In conclusion, governments should prioritize spending on public transportation over improving roads and highways. By doing so, they can effectively address the problems created by the rising number of private cars, including resource depletion, air pollution, and road accidents. Investing in public transportation is a step towards creating a more sustainable, safer, and environmentally friendly transportation system.

question: Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer?
human: Everyone has their method to success in life. At school or university, success depends on how we study. Some students benefit a lot when they study with groups. In fact, I agree with the idea of studying a lone since it helps me to focus more and establish my personality. llm: When it comes to studying, students have different preferences. Some students benefit a lot when they study with groups, as it allows them to discuss and understand complex topics better. Group study sessions can be engaging and interactive, helping students to stay motivated and retain information more effectively. However, I prefer to study individually because it helps me to concentrate more on the subject matter.Studying alone enables me to focus on my weaknesses and work on improving them at my own pace. We are building our personalities when we study alone, as it fosters independence, self-discipline, and responsibility. This, in turn, helps me to become a more confident and self-assured individual. In conclusion, while group study sessions have their benefits, I firmly believe that studying individually is more effective for me. It allows me to concentrate, build my personality, and develop essential life skills that will benefit me in the long run. question: Some people believe that the Earth is being harmed (damaged) by human activity. Others feel that human activity makes the Earth a better place to live. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Whether human activity is making the Earth a better place to live or damaging it is a debatable issue. Some people advocate the idea that human activity is advantageously influencing to the Earth. However, I strongly believe that human activities are having a bad effect upon our planet, for human are polluting the Earth's environment, exhausting natural resource and threatening the living of other species.People are corrupting their ecosphere. In recent decades, concurrently with the increase of human consume, the waste discarded by human also multiplies. These wastes including household waste and industrial waste are so big that a "new" continent is now being formed in the sea from garbage. Furthermore, the industrial exhaust gases are adulterating the air, causing the insalubrious phenomenon such as acid rain, global warming or climate change.Besides, people are draining the Earth's natural resources. These resources such as oil, coal are vital for human activity, therefore nowadays, the exploitation activities of these resources are increasing dramatically to adapt to the infinite need of people. Researchers indicated that most of natural resources are un-recyclable and only several decades after, the Earth's natural resources are totally exhausted. At that time, human activity will be seriously affected due to the dependence on these resources.Also, people are endangering other species' live. Hunting has been a fundamental activity of human for having food. Through million years of hunting, especially in recent centuries with the innovation of rifle and dynamite, people have killed many animals and even have made some kinds of them become extinct. Moreover, people, suffering from the population pressure, are expanding their living area; consequently, the living area of other species narrowed. This narrowing of living region is pushing many creatures to the brink of extinction.All in all, from discussed reasons, we can conclude that human activity are gradually destroy the Earth since it is polluting the Earth environment, depleting the resource and imperiling other species' lives.
llm: The debate about whether human activity is beneficial or detrimental to the Earth has sparked intense discussion. In my opinion, human activity is causing irreparable harm to the planet. The overwhelming evidence suggests that our actions are polluting the Earth's environment, exhausting natural resources, and threatening the livelihood of other species.One of the most significant issues is pollution. Human activities such as industrial production, vehicle emissions, and waste disposal are releasing massive amounts of toxic substances into the air, water, and soil. This not only harms the environment but also has severe consequences for human health. Furthermore, the depletion of natural resources such as oil, coal, and gas is occurring at an alarming rate. The extraction and consumption of these resources are not only finite but also contribute to pollution and climate change.In addition to environmental degradation, human activity is also endangering the lives of other species. Deforestation,, as a result of human expansion and development, has led to the loss of habitats and extinction of countless species. The destruction of ecosystems has a ripple effect, impacting the delicate balance of nature and ultimately threatening the survival of many plants and animals. For instance, the reduction of biodiversity due to human activities has severe implications for the health of our planet and its ability to sustain life.In conclusion, the evidence clearly indicates that human activity is damaging the Earth. The pollution of the environment, exhaustion of natural resources, and threat to other species are all pressing concerns that need to be addressed. It is imperative that we take collective action to mitigate these effects and work towards a more sustainable future. By adopting environmentally friendly practices, conserving natural resources, and protecting biodiversity, we can reduce the harm caused by human activity and preserve the Earth for future generations.

question: A company is going to give some money either to support the arts or protect the environment. Which do you think the company chooses? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: If I had the opportunity to help a company make a decision on spending money either on supporting the arts or helping the environment, I would choose the latter without hesitation for the reasons below. First, conservation is more urgent now than at any time in history. According to a statistic conducted by the International Animal Preserving Association, we have only ten percent of the animals that have ever existed, which means that the biodiversity of our home is grievously endangered. What's more, rising sea levels, caused by global warming, have reached a level that is threatening human's life in many countries. If we continue discharging carbon dioxide with non-environmentally friendly cars, nations like Japan will be submerged and weather patterns could change, causing flooding, drought, and an increasing amount of damaging storms. In short, the ecosystem is in its worst condition ever and if we didn't take harsh measures now, we never will.Furthermore, supporting environment protection will benefit the company eventually. Nowadays, an increasing amount of people pay more attention to conservation; therefore, sponsoring conservation is a more efficient method of advertising. Just imagine if the project your company is sponsoring effectively improves the environment, then your company would be known as an environmentally-friendly company and benefit from it in this consumer-oriented society.Finally, conservation leads us to a higher standard of living. I confess that art is one of the best ways of entertaining human beings, but, with exhaust fumes and acid rain, we do not have the energy and enthusiasm to appreciate the paintings or photographs. Biodiversity and a more beautiful nature are not only the results of abetter environment but also are the necessities of photography and other types of art.To sum up, although supporting art will benefit the human beings and the company in short-term interest, I still hold the environment protection for long-term interest.
llm: When considering where to allocate their funds, I believe the company should choose to protect the environment. The current state of the ecosystem is in its worst condition ever, with devastating consequences such as climate change, deforestation, and species extinction. If we didn't take harsh measures now, we never will, and the future of our planet would be at stake. By supporting environmental protection, the company can contribute to preserving natural resources, reducing pollution, and promoting sustainable practices.Moreover, supporting environment protection is a more efficient method of advertising. In today's eco-conscious society, consumers are more likely to trust and support companies that prioritize environmental responsibility. By investing in environmental protection, the company can enhance its brand image, build customer loyalty, and ultimately increase its market share. For instance, companies like Patagonia and Reformation have successfully promoted their environmental efforts, resulting in a significant boost in sales and customer engagement.Additionally, conservation efforts can lead us to a higher standard of living. By protecting natural habitats and preserving biodiversity, we can ensure the long-term health and well-being of our communities. This, in turn, can lead to improved air and water quality, reduced climate-related disasters, and increased access to natural resources. For example, a study by the National Park Service found that every dollar invested in national parks generates approximately $10 in economic benefits, demonstrating the positive impact of environmental conservation on local economies.In conclusion, given the severity of the environmental crisis and the numerous benefits of conservation, I firmly believe that the company should choose to protect the environment. Not only is it a moral imperative, but it also presents a sound business strategy, allowing the company to enhance its reputation, contribute to a higher standard of living, and ultimately, ensure a sustainable future for generations to come.

question: We all work or will work in our jobs with many different kinds of people. In your opinion, what are some important characteristics of a co-worker (Someone you work closely with) ? Use reasons and specific examples to explain why these characteristics are important.Ê
human: At work, you meet people with diverse backgrounds and you are required to maintain sound relationships with many of them in order to have a pleasant work environment. However, the relationship you need to maintain with your co-worker is the most important one since he or she is the person who works very closely with you, and in most instances you have to rely on him or her. Therefore in my view, a good co-worker needs to have three most important characteristics such as cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship.The co-workers should be cooperative with one another. If they do not cooperate, there will be lots of disputes. I once had a co-worker who was too family conscious. Therefore he always left office sharp on time without giving any consideration whether the work has been finished or not. Most of the time, I had to do his work in order to protect him from getting caught to the supervisor who was a very authoritative person. However, one day I wanted to be off early because I had to take my mother to the doctor. When I requested my co-worker to give a helping hand to finish my work early, he turned down my request giving a silly excuse. From that day onwards I did not offer him any support and finally he was transferred from our department to a distant location as a punishment for his irresponsibility. Therefore, I believe if the co-workers do not corporate with each other that would be devastating in a work environment.The co-workers need to trust each other. They should not act on suspicion. This is a very important aspect in the work environment. I came across a situation once such that one of my subordinates used to suspect his co-worker for carrying tales to me. To a certain extent his suspicion was valid as his co-worker made several attempts to highlight the drawbacks of him. However I never encourage tale carriers as a principle and therefore his co-worker gave up talking ill against him with me. But this mistrust continued and created very unpleasant situations for everybody in my department. Finally, the co-workers should believe in fellowship. This helps them to enjoy their work life while building up very strong personal relationships. After all, you spend most of your day at office. If you have a good company in office, it is certainly a blessing.
llm: In the workplace, we often find ourselves surrounded by diverse individuals with unique personalities, traits, and working styles. As we collaborate with our colleagues to achieve common goals, certain characteristics of a co-worker stand out as particularly valuable. In my opinion, a good co-worker needs to have three most important characteristics: cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship.First and foremost, cooperation is essential in a co-worker. When individuals cooperate, they work together seamlessly, sharing ideas and expertise to produce high-quality results. On the other hand, if they do not cooperate, there will be lots of disputes, misunderstandings, and ultimately, a decrease in productivity. For instance, in a team project, cooperation among members ensures that tasks are delegated effectively, deadlines are met, and the final product is a culmination of collective efforts.Trustworthiness is another vital characteristic of a good co-worker. When we trust our colleagues, we feel secure in sharing our ideas, relying on them to complete tasks, and taking risks together. This trust fosters a sense of security and stability, allowing us to work more efficiently and effectively. For example, if a co-worker is trustworthy, we can confidently assign them a critical task, knowing that they will complete it to the best of their abilities.Lastly, fellowship is crucial in creating a positive and supportive work environment. A co-worker who demonstrates fellowship is approachable, friendly, and willing to lend a helping hand. This characteristic helps to build strong relationships among team members, promoting a sense of belonging and camaraderie. When we enjoy good fellowship with our co-workers, we are more motivated, engaged, and committed to our work. In conclusion, cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship are the three most important characteristics of a good co-worker. These traits are essential in creating a harmonious, productive, and successful work environment, where individuals can thrive and grow together.

question: Distance learning and online computer classes should replace classroom learning.
human: During these digital age, the online classes has become more interest and more common in the society. Almost every school develops their online class systems. One question I always thought about is whether online computer classes should replace classroom learning. Although, online classes have many advantages, for me, I prefer traditional learning classes for several reasons.First, the participant with the others like classmates or professors is still an important factor in studying. Working in group leads to more discussion and more opinion among the class. Consequently, the discussion class results in expanded children vision and their respect to others roommate's ideas. Unlike the distance learning that children have few opportunities to discuss with their friends.Second, classroom learning provides other activities than studying. During student's free time, they have a number of activities that they can join, such as playing sports, going to lab, or going to library. These activities lead to more interact with their friends. Connection with friends improves their IQ abilities, furthermore, they have a chance to learn about their societies. While the online course keeps the children at their home only.Lastly, in school, there are professors that guided you during you had a problem or needed an advice. The professor provides good answers to you. They do not mind helping you, and they never leave you alone when you got a problem. In contrast, in distance learning, these aspects of the professor had reduced their important. The professor has been assigned to teach only. Moreover, there will be a long response from the teachers when children ask them a question.In conclusion, traditional learning still has many benefits to the students. But in the future, it seems that the distance learning become more popular and ordinary in schools.
llm: In today's digital age, online classes have become increasingly popular and common in society. As technology continues to advance, the concept of distance learning and online computer classes has gained significant attention. One question that has always sparked my interest is whether online computer classes should replace traditional classroom learning. On one hand, online computer classes offer a range of benefits, including flexibility and convenience. Students can learn from the comfort of their own homes, at their own pace, and can easily access course materials and resources. This is particularly beneficial for those with busy schedules or living in remote areas with limited access to educational institutions. Moreover, online classes can also provide personalized learning experiences, as students can interact with instructors and peers from diverse backgrounds, fostering a more inclusive and global learning environment.On the other hand, traditional classroom learning provides a unique set of benefits, including face-to-face interactions, hands-on experiences, and socialization opportunities. Classroom learning allows students to engage in discussions, ask questions, and receive immediate feedback, which can be lacking in online settings. Additionally, traditional classrooms provide a structured learning environment, which can help students stay motivated and focused.However, considering the rapid advancements in technology and the growing demand for online learning, it is possible that online computer classes could complement or even replace traditional classroom learning in certain contexts. With the use of advanced tools and platforms, online classes can now provide immersive and interactive learning experiences that rival those found in traditional classrooms. Ultimately, a balanced approach that combines the benefits of both online and traditional learning may be the most effective way to cater to the diverse needs and preferences of students in the digital age.

question: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
human: The issue at hand is whether it should be obligatory for university students to attend classes. This is an interesting question because it affects a great amount of students worldwide. Nonetheless there are various different policies regarding this topic. An important aspect might be whether one desires to optimize the learned knowledge or the amount of valuable experiences for the students. However, to my mind students should be free not to attend classes because it improves the quality of student life as well as their learning motivation and teaches important life skills.Firstly, a liberal policy is very feasible. Checking for attendance requires a lot of bureaucracy. Especially for larger classes it is impossible to check for everybody to attend. So an optional attendance saves time and money.Secondly, some students might learn better at home on their own, for instance, by reading the textbook. This problem occurs especially if the lecturer is lethargic. By letting students choose not to attend class you give them the opportunity to escape bad teaching. Thus they are able to save precious study time and dive into the course syllabus independently.In addition, being free to stay away from classes improves flexibility and therefore quality of student life. Sometimes the wild party on Thursday night is too good to end already at midnight only because of a lecture on Friday in the morning. With a liberal policy students are able to postpone the learning to the afternoon which gives a feeling of freedom and improves time efficiency. Research has shown that the more satisfied the students are with those life aspects, the better they perform in academic areas.Finally, psychology knows two types of motivation. There is intrinsic motivation which comes from your own mindset. And there is extrinsic motivation which comes from the praise and laud of other people. Intrinsic motivation is known to be much more desirable because it leads to better learning and well-being. However, in order to gain intrinsic motivation students need to become aware of their strengths and aims. By giving students the freedom to choose about class attendance they might rather be thinking about why they decided to study and learn to motivate themselves. These are crucial skills for the duration of their study and their whole life time.To conclude, it is clear that going to classes should be optional for students. I hold this belief due to the improvement of students' current experience as well as the valuable skills and knowledge they obtain for their whole life afterwards.
llm: The debate over whether university students should be required to attend classes has sparked intense discussion. While some argue that mandatory attendance is necessary for academic success,,assistantThe debate over whether university students should be required to attend classes has sparked intense discussion. While some argue that mandatory attendance is necessary for academic success, I firmly believe that students should be free not to attend classes. This freedom improves the quality of student life, as it allows them to balance their academic responsibilities with other aspects of their lives, such as part-time jobs, extracurricular activities, and personal relationships. When students are not forced to attend every class, they can manage their time more effectively, leading to reduced stress and improved overall well-being.Furthermore, the option to miss classes enhances learning motivation. When students are given the autonomy to choose when to attend classes, they are more likely to be motivated to learn and engage with the material that truly interests them. This approach encourages self-directed learning, where students take ownership of their education and are more invested in their academic pursuits.Additionally, being free to stay away from classes teaches important life skills, such as time management, responsibility, and self-discipline. In the real world, individuals are not always required to be present in a specific location at a specific time. By allowing students to make their own attendance decisions, universities can help them develop these essential skills, preparing them better for their future careers and personal lives.Another significant benefit of optional class attendance is improved flexibility. Students may need to attend to personal matters, health issues, or other commitments that cannot be rescheduled. By not requiring them to attend every class, universities can accommodate these needs, providing a more flexible and accommodating learning environment. This flexibility is particularly important for students who may have non-traditional schedules or responsibilities, such as caring for a family member or working to support their education.In conclusion, allowing students the freedom not to attend classes is beneficial for their overall educational experience. It enhances their quality of life, boosts learning motivation, teaches valuable life skills, and offers the flexibility that many students need to succeed. By trusting students to make responsible decisions about their attendance, universities can foster a more autonomous, motivated, and well-rounded student body.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
human: Place of living has the most significant affect on our lives and we have to choose it according to several factors. Some people prefer to live in tall buildings and crowded areas, whereas others prefer to live in a small and calm town. I would prefer to live in a small town and I think a small town has some advantages, such as good weather, a healthy life and better facilities.Firstly, the first advantage of living in a small town is a healthy life that we can obtain due to many items. One of the conditions that helps us to be healthy is good weather and less population that exist in a small town. Also, in a small town there are less crowded and less traffic. Living in a place with less pollution such as air pollution or sound pollution helps us to have a healthier life and one of the main consequences is less stress and more happiness. Moreover, in a small town foods and materials we need are healthier than in big cities and there are fresh foods and fruits. Regardless of some exceptions, it is obvious that living in small towns is healthier than in big cities.Secondly, another advantage of small towns is living costs. Living cost is one of the important concerns in every society and then, in a small town living cost is fewer than in big cities. Therefore, in a small town we can live in big houses with good landscapes, also because of less crowded spaces we have more facilities and more services. Transportation cost is less than in big cities and we have less traffic so that we can save time and money.In conclusion, I prefer to live in a small town and I think it has some advantages such as less stress, because of better weather conditions and also, better relationship within a town. In small town people know each other and have better deal together than big cities therefore on big cities people feel alone and depress more than small cities. However it is an obvious fact that people in small town have more happiness and friendship and less illness and stress.
llm: When it comes to choosing a place to live, people often find themselves torn between the tranquility of a small town and the vibrancy of a big city. As for me, I would prefer to live in a small town, and for good reason. Small towns have several advantages that make them an attractive choice for residence. Firstly, the weather in small towns is often more pleasant and the environment is cleaner, contributing to a healthier life. Additionally, small towns usually have better facilities, such as parks and community centers, which foster a sense of community and provide ample opportunities for outdoor activities and socialization.Secondly, the living costs in small towns are significantly lower compared to big cities. This is a crucial factor, as living costs are one of the most important concerns in every society. The affordability of housing, food, and other necessities makes small towns more accessible to people from all walks of life. Furthermore, the close-knit community in small towns means that people are more likely to know and look out for each other, creating a stronger sense of belonging and cooperation. In contrast, big cities can often feel impersonal and isolating, with individuals frequently feeling alone despite being surrounded by thousands of people. The anonymity of city life can be overwhelming and disconnecting, whereas in small towns, the familiarity and camaraderie among residents create a warm and supportive environment.In conclusion, the combination of good weather, a healthy lifestyle, better facilities, lower living costs, and a stronger sense of community make small towns the preferable choice for me. The unique blend of natural beauty, economic practicality, and social warmth that small towns offer creates an ideal setting for a happy, healthy, and fulfilling life.

question: In many countries, young people leave rural areas to study or work in cities. What do you think are reason of this? Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
human: These days, there are increasing numbers of young people from the countryside moving to cities in search of jobs and educational opportunities. Personally, I think it has some drawbacks that will be discussed in this essay together with some reasons about this.To begin with, the major cause that leads to urban migration of young adults is that cities often offer more well-paid jobs and study chances compared to rural areas. Obviously, many large companies and universities often locate in cities which are hailed as promising lands to develop their career. Therefore they move to big cities to pursue academic career and find jobs in order to have a higher standard of living. For example, if a gradate stays in the city after leaving his college and seeks a job with good salary instead of returning his village to do farm work, he could perhaps buy a house or his own car after a short time. However, this phenomenon sometimes poses several negative consequences. There can be no doubt that the burgeoning number of young adults from the countryside flocking to cities gives rise to overpopulation in cities. As a result, cities cannot provide adequate space for thousands of dwellers that might lead to poor housing conditions and sanitation. Additionally, it might put strain on the environment. If there are more people in the cities, there would be large numbers of vehicles on the road, which causes air pollution.In conclusion, young people tend to study or work in urban areas since these provide them many educational opportunities and career potentials. In my opinion, however, I do not approve of this trend due to negative effects such as low quality of life and affecting the environment.
llm: The migration of young people from rural areas to cities has become a widespread phenomenon in many countries. These days, there are increasing numbers of young people from the countryside moving to cities in search of jobs and educational opportunities. The reasons behind this trend are multifaceted. On one hand, cities offer better infrastructure, advanced technology, and a wider range of career options, making them more attractive to young people seeking to improve their socio-economic status. On the other hand, rural areas often lack access to quality education, employment opportunities, and modern amenities, pushing young people to leave their homes in pursuit of a brighter future.However, personally, I do not approve of this trend due to the negative effects it has on the quality of life and the environment. The influx of young people into cities leads to overcrowding, increased competition for resources, and a subsequent low quality of life. The strain on urban infrastructure results in issues such as traffic congestion, housing shortages, and elevated crime rates. Furthermore, the migration of young and able-bodied individuals from rural areas accelerates the aging of rural populations, affecting the social and economic fabric of these communities. Additionally, the environmental impact of urbanization, including pollution and loss of biodiversity, cannot be overlooked.While the advantages of urbanization, such as economic growth and cultural diversity, are undeniable, I believe that the disadvantages outweigh them. The depletion of rural areas' workforce and the deterioration of urban environments are significant concerns that need to be addressed. It is essential for governments and policymakers to invest in rural development, providing young people with incentives to stay in or return to their hometowns, thereby promoting a more balanced and sustainable development across all regions. By doing so, we can mitigate the negative consequences of this trend and ensure a better future for both rural and urban communities.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. High school students should take a course on basic economics
human: In today's community, economy becomes the order of the day. Getting to know the theory in this area seems really important for our students. Then, the earlier we jump into this area, the more skillful we will be. Thus, in my point of view, although it will take some time on it, high school students should take a course on basic economics. Let me explain it in detail.For the primary concern, it can provide students a sense of direction in academy. Basic economic class can help the students touch the surface of this field, let them to know what this subject mainly discuss. That will help the students cultivate their own interest and a sense of career orientation. Finally, students may study harder for their economic dreams. On the other hand, economy is always correlate with politics, students can study specialized knowledge along with some Politian status, which may open their vision toward the nation and don't get limited in the textbooks. Besides, there is also an intimate connection between economy and enterprises, students can also gain knowledge more practical and vivid.In addition, the basic economic course can also help with the students when they go to college. They may feel more readily to learn the knowledge in this field and save much time, with that they are able to study more efficiently and more deeply than other students. That as well would provide the students with more confidence and let them become more compatible.Considering all those factors above, I suggest the basic course of economic is necessary.
llm: I strongly agree with the statement that high school students should take a course on basic economics. In today's community, economy becomes the order of the day, and understanding its principles is essential for making informed decisions. The earlier students jump into this area, the more skillful they will be in navigating the complexities of the economic world. By introducing economics in high school, the students will have a head start in developing their critical thinking and problem-solving skills, which are crucial in making sound economic decisions.Taking a course on basic economics will not only benefit students in their personal lives but also prepare them for their future academic pursuits. When students go to college, the basic economic course can also help them in various ways. For instance, it will provide them with a solid foundation to tackle more advanced economic concepts, making their transition to higher education smoother. Moreover, the knowledge of economics will enable them to make more informed decisions about their career choices, investment options, and financial planning, ultimately leading to a more secure and stable financial future.In conclusion, incorporating a basic economics course into the high school curriculum is a prudent decision. It will empower students with the knowledge and skills necessary to thrive in today's economy, making them more competitive and prepared for the challenges of the real world. By learning about economics early on, students will be better equipped to manage their financial resources, make smart investment decisions, and contribute to the economic growth of their communities. Therefore, I firmly believe that high school students should take a course on basic economics to set themselves up for success in their future endeavors.

question: University education should be restricted to the very best academic students, rather than being available to a large proportion of young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Universtiy is an entrance to life. It equips us with a package of wisdom and virtue to succeed. It is the importance of university that raises a question whether students with best scholastic performance deserve university study or just any young wishful people. Both sides are to be discussed before a conclusion is reached.To begin with, outstanding academic students are eligible for university due to their intellectual advantage. To be precise, such abstract or complicated informatin, easily absorbed by those students, may prove as a matter of pressure for those who lack equivalent skills. Besides, it is undeniable that one deserves what he has done. University is like a gift presented to those who have gone to great length to attain.However, university is not just about academic studies but also a place to nurture artistic talent and develop soft skills. Therefore, it should be up for grabs for a majority of young people, who wish to pursue their passion as well as develop comprehensively. What is more, there is a tendency for social vices to rise if university is to be restricted to only the best people. Apart from the disheartened ones, many devoiding of neccessary preparations are likely to be recipes for failure when applying for jobs, mostly the white-collar ones.In conclusion, university restriction has both pros and cons. In my opinion, it will yield more negative results than positive ones. That's why it should be made available for a wide range of learners.
llm: The notion that university education should be restricted to only the very best academic students has sparked a heated debate. While some argue that this approach ensures academic excellence, others believe it is unfair and restrictive. In my opinion, I partially disagree with this statement, as I believe university education should be accessible to a broader range of students, not just those with outstanding academic records.On one hand, outstanding academic students are undoubtedly eligible for university education due to their intellectual advantage. They have demonstrated exceptional academic ability, which can be nurtured and developed further in a university setting. These students are likely to make significant contributions to their chosen field, and restricting university education to them would ensure that only the most capable individuals are equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to excel.On the other hand, university is not just about academic studies, but also a place to nurture artistic talent and develop soft skills. Students from diverse backgrounds and with varying strengths can benefit from university education, even if they are not necessarily the top academic performers. University provides a platform for students to explore their passions, develop critical thinking, and acquire essential life skills, such as communication, teamwork, and problem-solving. By restricting university education to only the best academic students, we risk denying opportunities to talented individuals who may not excel academically but have other valuable skills to offer.In conclusion, university restriction has both pros and cons. While it may ensure academic excellence, it also limits opportunities for students with diverse talents and strengths. Therefore, I believe that university education should be accessible to a broader range of students, rather than being restricted to only the very best academic students. By doing so, we can foster a more inclusive and diverse learning environment, where students can develop their unique strengths and contribute to society in meaningful ways.

question: Prevention is better than cure. Out of a country's health budget, a large proportion should be diverted from treatment to spending on health education and preventative measures. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: In today's world, the concept of the welfare state requires governments to provide sustainable healthcare and health education to their citizens. I completely agree with the idea that governments should devote a greater portion of their health budgets to health education and means for precautions.The first reason why education and preventative measures should receive a greater budget is the potential improvements in health system. I believe that decreasing the number of patients in the health system can lead hospitals and healthcare centers to be managed effectively which will result in better treatments for current patients. Therefore, society should be educated and became aware of health issues so that the potential precautions on the way of illnesses can be taken instead of trying to provide treatment for the increasing number of patients.The second reason why governments should allocate more budget on prevention from illness and providing health education is the welfare of the society. In my opinion, there is nothing more important than health in a human's life and the happiness and welfare come with health. Therefore, a government's role should be providing means that lead its citizens to learn how to prevent from potential illness that can cause misery in people's lives. For example, the marketing campaign of Ministry of Health in Turkey which aimed smoking problem among the youth increased the well-being of those who quit smoking and adapted a better lifestyle after the campaign.In conclusion, a greater proportion of the budget should be allotted to education and prevention issues in comparison with treatment due to achieve more effective health system and greater level of well-being.
llm: The notion that prevention is better than cure has gained significant traction in recent years, and for good reason. In today's world, the concept of the welfare state requires governments to provide sustainable healthcare and health education to their citizens. This implies that a substantial portion of a country's health budget should be allocated towards health education and preventative measures, rather than solely focusing on treatment.By diverting a large proportion of the health budget towards health education and preventative measures, governments can empower citizens with the knowledge and skills necessary to maintain a healthy lifestyle. This can include initiatives such as public awareness campaigns, vaccination programs, and health screenings. These measures have been proven to be highly effective in reducing the incidence of diseases and promoting overall well-being. Moreover, the costs associated with preventative measures are often significantly lower than those associated with treatment, making them a cost-effective solution in the long run.Furthermore, investing in health education can have a ripple effect, influencing not only individual health outcomes but also the overall healthcare system. By promoting healthy behaviors and lifestyles, governments can reduce the burden on healthcare systems, leading to a more efficient allocation of resources. In conclusion, a greater proportion of the budget should be allotted to education and prevention issues in comparison with treatment. This approach will not only improve health outcomes but also contribute to a more sustainable and equitable healthcare system. By prioritizing prevention, governments can ensure that their citizens receive the care and support they need to thrive, while also promoting a culture of health and wellness that benefits society as a whole.

question: With the pressures on todayÕs young people to succeed academically, some people believe that non-academic subjects at school (eg: physical education and cookery should be removed from the syllabus so that children can concentrate wholly on academic subjects. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Students have become more and more stressed during the last few years due to the increase in academic tasks assigned by their teachers to improve their academic success. While some people believe that non-academic subjects should be completely removed, I strongly disagree with that.To begin with, from the health point of view, schools should not only deliver academic subjects. If physical education is removed from the syllabus, there will be considerable negative effects on students’ health. For instance, after studying and sitting in the classroom for the whole morning, it is better for students to do some outdoor activities, such as stretching, jogging and playing ball games, in order to improve their learning ability during the afternoon classes. Removing physical classes from school education will not only be harmful to young people’s health, it will also decrease their learning capability.In addition, schools are responsible for developing their students into well-rounded people. It is more important for a person to success in life than to success only academically. Success in life should be the ultimate goal of a student, which requires more than academic knowledge, but also practical life skills such as cooking, good communication skills and teamwork spirit. Thus, school education should not only focus on the academic development of a student as it is much more crucial to teach them how to be independent and live a good life.Some people may argue that students can learn practical skills after school hours from their parents. However, I believe that it is not a good idea because most young people would rather watch TV or play computer games after school instead of learning life skills from their parents. Moreover, parents are usually too busy with their daily jobs to teach their children the life skills.In conclusion, I strongly believe that non-academic subjects are as essential as academic subjects for a student’s development. Therefore, schools should not remove these subjects.
llm: The notion that non-academic subjects, such as physical education and cookery, should be removed from school syllabuses to allow students to focus solely on academic subjects is a misguided one. I strongly disagree with this perspective, as I firmly believe that non-academic subjects are as essential as academic subjects for a student's development. Physical education, for instance, is crucial for maintaining students' physical and mental well-being. If it were to be removed from the syllabus, there would be considerable negative effects on students' health, including increased obesity rates, sedentary lifestyles, and related health problems. Moreover, physical education also plays a significant role in teaching students valuable life skills such as teamwork, discipline, and perseverance.Schools are responsible for developing their students into well-rounded people, equipped with a broad range of skills and knowledge that extend beyond academic excellence. Success in life requires more than just academic knowledge; it also demands practical life skills, such as cooking, time management, and social skills, which are often taught through non-academic subjects. By removing these subjects, schools would be neglecting their responsibility to provide students with a holistic education.In conclusion, non-academic subjects like physical education and cookery are vital components of a student's educational journey. They provide students with essential life skills, promote physical and mental well-being, and foster personal growth. Rather than removing these subjects, schools should strive to strike a balance between academic and non-academic subjects, ensuring that students receive a comprehensive education that prepares them for success in all aspects of life.

question: When people move to another country, some of them decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which one do you prefer? Support your answer with specific details.
human: When people move to another country, most likely, they will face the choice between following the customs of the new country or keeping their original one. Some people choose the former one to assimilate themselves into the new culture, while some insist the latter one because the new customs are difficult to be accepted. As for me, I would follow the new customs, if I migrated to another country.On one hand, it will be easier for people to assimilate into a new country, if they follow the new customs. When people migrate to a new country, they are likely to suffer the culture shock, because of the difference between two cultures. The custom is just a form of the culture and following the custom is a good way to know more about this culture. For example, if one wore in white and went to common Viharas to observe a rather longer-than-usual, full-length Buddhist sutra in Buddha's Birthday in India, he or she would learn something about Indian religion and culture. As a result, people understand the culture, and then they adapt to the new country.On the other hand, keeping own customs stably might cause discrimination. When people insist to keep their own customs and refuse to accept the new one, they regard themselves as a special group in the new country. The local people may also regard them as a special group as well and separate them from the main-stream society. One example of this is that the Chinese immigrants in Indonesia in 1969. They formed Chinatown and kept Chinese language and customs in it. While the Indonesians stopped working at 4:00 pm and went home for rest, Chinese immigrants were still working. Although being much richer than local people, they faced the discrimination. Their houses and private cars were buried by local people, because the locals were jealous of Chinese people, who had so much wealth, which should have been theirs. If the Chinese immigrants had followed the local customs and assimilated into Indonesia, they would not have been regards as a group of Chinese and discrimination might have been alleviated.All in all, the immigrants should follow the customs in the new country, which can help them survive from the culture shock sooner, and assimilate to a new culture.
llm: When people move to another country, they are often faced with a difficult decision: whether to follow the customs of their new home or to keep their own traditions. This choice can have a significant impact on their ability to integrate into their new society. On one hand, adopting the customs of the new country can make it easier for individuals to assimilate and feel a sense of belonging. By following local norms and practices, people can more easily build relationships with their new neighbors, coworkers, and community members. This, in turn, can lead to a smoother transition and a greater sense of comfort in their new environment.On the other hand, some people prefer to keep their own customs and traditions, even in a new country. While this can be a way to maintain a strong sense of cultural identity, it can also lead to isolation and segregation. When people insist on keeping their own customs and refuse to accept the new ones, they may be regarded as a special group, separate from the rest of society. This can make it challenging for them to fully integrate and participate in the social and cultural life of their new country. In some cases, it may even lead to misunderstandings and conflicts with the local community.In my opinion, adopting the customs of the new country is the preferred choice. By doing so, individuals can demonstrate their willingness to adapt and be a part of their new society. This does not mean that they have to abandon their own cultural heritage, but rather find a way to balance their old traditions with their new life. By being open to new customs and practices, people can enrich their own cultural experience and build stronger connections with the people around them. Ultimately, embracing the customs of a new country can lead to a more harmonious and successful integration into a new society.

question: Is it more important to be able to ework with a group of people on ta tem or to work independently? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
human: Nowadays, as the world is getting smaller, we need to be able to cooperate. Working in team is a necessary skill that every individual must master for success. Despite the importance of working in team, I still believe that the capability of working independly is more significant.Of course, effective cooperation can make things easier and faster, but in many important cases when team-working is not possible, the ability to work alone will help. The apperant example is that there are a lot of tests that do not allow team-working. Let's imagine that you perform really well when you can discuss the problems with other people, but you have no experience of working alone, standardized tests such as SAT, TOEFL may be your nightmares. Testing is a very important aspect of life, and still the majority of tests do not allow you to work in team. Therefore, if you want to get brilliant achievements such as going to college, acing your school's final tests, you should consider learning to work on your own.Moreover, the ability to work alone will help you increase your ability to work with other people. Working in team does not mean that you do not have to come up with your ideas. Everybody in a team must have his/her own opinion first, then discuss them with other members. When we work in team, we still think individually because our brain are not connected but separate. When everyone in a team can come up with his/her own ideas, working in team will definitely more effective.In conclusion, working with a group a people and working individually are all important. Both skills are necessary for a successful life. Nevertheless, the capablity of working alone is the foundation for the skill to work in team and plays a significant role in a lot of situations.
llm: When it comes to achieving success, whether in academics or professional settings, the debate often arises as to whether working in a team or working independently is more important. Despite the importance of working in a team, I still believe that the capability of working alone is more significant. This may seem counterintuitive, given the emphasis often placed on teamwork and collaboration in modern work and educational environments. However, there are several compelling reasons to support the notion that working independently holds greater value.For example, there are a lot of tests that do not allow team-working. Standardized tests, final exams, and assessments that evaluate individual knowledge and understanding are all conducted independently. Therefore, if you want to get brilliant achievements such as going to college or acing your school's final tests, you should consider learning to work on your own. The ability to focus, analyze, and solve problems independently is crucial in these situations. It demonstrates not only one's mastery of the subject matter but also their ability to think critically and make decisions without reliance on others.Moreover, working independently fosters a deeper level of personal responsibility and self-discipline. When one works alone, they must motivate themselves, manage their time effectively, and ensure the quality of their work without the support or crutch of a team. These skills are invaluable in both personal and professional development, as they equip individuals with the ability to undertake projects, set goals, and achieve them through their own efforts. In conclusion, while teamwork is undoubtedly important, the ability to work independently is a fundamental skill that underpins individual success and achievement. It is through working alone that one can truly demonstrate their capabilities, knowledge, and character, making it a more significant trait than teamwork.

question: Do you agree that people should have hobbies and do physical activities that are very different from one's work?
human: Whether or not people should have hobbies and do physical activities has been a controversial question. Different people have different ideas. Some people think we should focus on our jobs, but I don't agree with them. Having one's own hobbies and doing physical activities can bring us a lot of benefits.First, having hobbies and doing physical activities is the best way to keep fit. Looking at the computer screen all day long can make us daze, so doing some sport and hobbies can prevent us from becoming too fat or short-sighted. My neighbor Tom once was a computer engineer in a big company. He ate fast food everyday and never went out to exercise. When he found out that he was too fat to find a girlfriend, he made up his mind to loose weight. He started to jog every morning. After a moth, he is thinner and finds a girlfriend.Also, doing something for a long time can be boring, having hobbies and doing sports can refresh our mind. For example, at school, students have breaks every class so that they can relax for a few minutes and prepare for the next class. Humans are not robots; we can't keep working for twenty-four hours. Doing sports or hobbies for a short time can recharge our batteries.Last, we should develop at least one personal hobby, not to show off, but express our emotion when we feel depressed or pressured. Playing musical instrument is a good way, I can play classical guitar. When I meet difficulties in studies, I will take my guitar and play the song Green Sleeves. It makes me feel better and gives me the confidence.Although it may take us a lot of times to develop our personal hobbies, but doing so can bring us a healthy body, a refreshed mind and a way to release pressure and sadness. Hence, I think it is good for us to have hobbies and do physical activities which are different from our work.
llm: The idea that people should focus solely on their jobs and not engage in hobbies or physical activities outside of work is a notion that I strongly disagree with. Some people think that dedicating all our time to our profession is the key to success, but I firmly believe that having hobbies and doing physical activities that are very different from one's work is essential for a healthy and balanced life.Engaging in physical activities and hobbies is the best way to keep fit, both physically and mentally. It allows us to recharge and refocus, which can lead to improved performance and productivity in our jobs. Moreover, doing something for a long time can be boring and monotonous, and having hobbies can refresh our mind and provide a much-needed break from the routine. Hobbies can also provide an outlet for self-expression and creativity, which can be particularly beneficial when we feel depressed or pressured.For instance, playing a musical instrument is a great way to express our emotions and alleviate stress. It provides an opportunity to channel our feelings into something positive and creative, which can be incredibly therapeutic. Furthermore, hobbies can also provide a sense of accomplishment and pride, which can boost our self-esteem and confidence. In conclusion, having hobbies and doing physical activities that are different from one's work is not only beneficial but also necessary for a happy and fulfilling life. It allows us to maintain a healthy work-life balance, reduce stress, and express ourselves in new and exciting ways.

question: Should government spend more money on improving roads and highways, or should governments spend more money on improving public transportation (buses, trains, subways)? Why? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
human: The population explosion results in the high demands of transportation. Many countries have suffered from pollution, noisy and casualty for a long time. From my perspective, the most possible solution to these problems is improving roads and highways because of three crucial reasons.First and foremost, we all know that upgrading public transportation will surely aggravate the pollution and accidents. The buses, cars and trains regularly emit a noxious gas which causes lots of fatal diseases such as lung cancer and pneumonia. Moreover, the sound emanates from the engines can worsen our hearing. Most importantly, there are many accidents happening on the roads. For example, in my country, buses are attributed to the cause of skyrocketing of accidents. Each year, Vietnam has approximately twelve thousand people die of accidents which is equivalent to the death toll of the tsunami in Japan.Secondly, investing in roads and highways can broaden the area and allow more public transportation to work. Not only buses but also other personal vehicles can move easily on the roads. For instance, I always leave school at the time that everybody rushes into the roads and hastily goes home. It is extremely troublesome for me to escape from the crowd on the roads in only one hour. In contrast, if the roads are enlarged, everyone can go home in short time and there are hardly any collisions. Last but not least, spending on renovating the highways and roads can improve the quality. All of us are afraid of moving on the rough roads with lots of portholes. Those bad conditions result in many terrible accidents and make several people feel worried.
