We should not accuse the drivers of causing accidents because a part of the responsibility belongs to the authorities. What's more, a smooth surface makes the transportation and movement become safer and easier.In a nutshell, the advantages of upgrading the roads which I mentioned above are totally convincing and indispensable. I am usually inclined to this idea and I hope that the government will regard the investment in building roads as the most important thing.
llm: The debate over whether governments should prioritize improving roads and highways or public transportation has been ongoing for years. Many countries have suffered from pollution, noise, and casualties for a long time, posing significant threats to the environment, health, and safety of citizens. From my perspective, the most possible solution to these problems is improving roads and highways, because of three crucial reasons.Firstly, improving roads and highways can significantly reduce traffic congestion, which is a major contributor to pollution and noise. By expanding and enhancing the road network, vehicles can move more efficiently, reducing the time spent on the road and subsequently decreasing the emission of harmful gases. Secondly, improving roads and highways can lead to a reduction in casualties. Well-maintained roads with proper signage and markings can minimize the risk of accidents, ensuring a safer commute for drivers and pedestrians alike.Thirdly, improving roads and highways can have a positive impact on the economy. Efficient transportation networks are essential for the movement of goods and services, and by investing in roads and highways, governments can facilitate trade and commerce, leading to economic growth and development. In conclusion, while improving public transportation is also important, I firmly believe that improving roads and highways is the most effective solution to the problems of pollution, noise, and casualties that many countries face. By prioritizing road improvement, governments can create a safer, more efficient, and more sustainable transportation system that benefits both the environment and the economy.

question: Some people believe that the best way of learning life is by listening to the advice of family and friends. Other people believe that the best way of learning about life is through personal experience. Compare the advantages of these two different ways of learning about life. Which do you think is preferable?
human: Life is full of challenges, difficulties and unexpected obstacles. Therefore, learning about life, which is useful for foreseeing problems and be assertive enough to overcome them are needed. Two main ways of learning about life are listening to the advice of family and friends and learning through personal experience. Both ways are good to follow because they all have their own distinct advantages.On one hand, the way of learning life through listening to the advice of family and friends is more realistic than the latter. Family members such as your parents are experienced in life so they can give you proper and sincere guidance on every aspect of life. And friends, people who are the same generation with you, they are understand your favorite and ability enough to tell you which is suitable for you, which is not. By listening to your family and friends advice, you can definitely avoid many unexpected things.On the other hand, finding out life through personal experience can help you become more independent and mature. For one thing, there are so many grate things that you can missed if you don't experience it by yourself. For example, a friend told you not to try skydiving because it was so dangerous. If you did as he told, you could fail to see how wonderful it is to be fall freely. In addition, family and friends accidentally harm you by giving you advice all the time. You will grow to be dependent and reliant. In contrast, free yourself and do what you desire without notice about consequences is the way that success people would like to choose.According to myself, both ways are good, but I prefer the latter. It is because growth is a long process that experience is indispensable. I believe that experiencing the real life by myself, I could learn more than just obey the advice. Parents and other predecessors used to experience their own life by themselves, why don't the younger try to do the same?In summary, each way learning life has its own benefits. But to me, learning about life through personal experience seems more appropriate.
llm: The age-old debate about the best way to learn about life has sparked intense discussion among individuals. Two main ways of learning about life are listening to the advice of family and friends and learning through personal experience. According to my perspective, both ways are good to follow because they both have their own distinct advantages. On one hand, the way of finding out about life through listening to advice is more realistic than the latter. By listening to the experiences and wisdom of family and friends, one can gain valuable insights and avoid potential pitfalls. This approach allows individuals to learn from others' mistakes and successes, thereby saving time and energy.On the other hand, learning through personal experience, though potentially more risky, seems more appropriate to me. By navigating life's challenges and making mistakes, individuals can develop resilience, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills. Personal experience allows people to learn and grow at their own pace, and the lessons learned are often more memorable and impactful. Moreover, personal experience fosters independence, self-reliance, and confidence, which are essential for personal growth and development. While listening to advice can provide a foundation, it is through personal experience that one can truly understand and apply the lessons learned. In conclusion, both ways of learning about life have their merits, but learning through personal experience is, in my opinion, the more preferable approach, as it allows individuals to develop a deeper understanding of themselves and the world around them.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Childhood is the happiest time of a person's life.
human: Everyone has happy moments during their life. These happy moments are both in their childhood and their adulthood. In my opinion, childhood is the happiest time of a person's life.First, in childhood most people are happier than in adulthood. They do not have to worry about bills, jobs, how would their life be in the future. They just worry about two things: to have fun, learn and be happy. A child's daily life is school, playing and sleeping. For example, when I was young I just came home from school and then I would took my bike or soccer ball and go out and play with my friends in my neighborhood. Moreover, I did not have to worry about costs and other things, I just had fun and learned. Also, people are most creative when they were children, children imagine new things and games just to have fun and be happy.Second, childhood is the period where people go to school and learn. Therefore, school memories are one of the best memories in a person's life. There you learn, to find your first love, to make new long-lasting friendships and of-course you will have a lot of fun. For example, my father's best moments in his life are in his school years. Moreover, he is still in-touch with some of his classmates and sometimes they get together and share their childhood memories.In other words, childhood is, indeed, the most happiest moments in a person's life. There is only one life and one childhood and people should live their childhood thoroughly.
llm: The statement that childhood is the happiest time of a person's life has sparked a lot of debate among people. In my opinion, childhood is indeed the happiest time of a person's life. During this stage, most people are happier than they are in adulthood. The main reason for this is the simplicity and carefree nature of childhood. A child's daily life typically revolves around school, playing, and sleeping, which are activities that bring them immense joy and satisfaction.In contrast, adulthood is often filled with responsibilities, stress, and pressure, which can weigh heavily on a person's mental and emotional well-being. Children, on the other hand, are free from these burdens and are able to live in the moment, enjoying the simple pleasures of life. Additionally, people are most creative when they were children, as their imagination and curiosity are at their peak. This creativity allows them to express themselves freely and find joy in the simplest of things.The absence of worries and responsibilities in childhood also means that children are able to form strong bonds with their family and friends, which is essential for their emotional development. Furthermore, the memories and experiences gained during childhood play a significant role in shaping a person's personality and outlook on life. Overall, I firmly believe that childhood is the happiest time of a person's life, and it is a stage that should be cherished and nurtured. By embracing the simplicity and wonder of childhood, people can carry the happiness and creativity of this stage into their adult lives, leading to a more fulfilling and joyful existence.

question: Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: With technology advances, food has become easier to prepare in modern days. People now can use kitchen appliances such as microwave and toaster to cook their meals easier and more convenient than before. Also, instant food products take only a few minutes to be made into delicious meals. These changes make cooking so easy-to-use and time-saving as to improve the way we live to a great extent.First of all, people have more chance to do other activities they like since food preparation is no longer time-consuming. For instance, such a change has liberated many housewives from tedious cooking process and gave them additional time to do something more meaningful like accompanying family or doing a job. On the other hand, more people can sleep a bit later to go to work because they only need a couple of time to prepare for the breakfasts.At the second point, since food preparation has become easier and more convenient, it is certainly great to preserve diverse kinds of foods at home. People can have a variety of dishes even in a small meal and choose whatever they like. More men, on the other hand, are willing to participate in cooking that they had never done before. This transformation may bring positive impacts to family in some cases.In conclusion, the time-saving, simple food preparation process gives us more time to do other activities, more chance to select diverse kinds of foods and more willingness to cook meals. Of course, there may be some other perspectives that I neglected to fully consider. Nevertheless, for the reasons that I have presented above, I would assert that this change has improved our life significantly.
llm: The advent of technology has revolutionized the way people prepare food, making it easier and more convenient than ever before. With the advancement of technology, food preparation has become a breeze, significantly improving the way people live. One of the primary reasons for this improvement is the invention of kitchen appliances such as microwaves and toasters. These appliances have enabled people to cook their meals quickly and efficiently, saving them a considerable amount of time and effort.In the past, cooking was a tedious and time-consuming process that required hours of preparation and cooking. However, with the advent of modern kitchen appliances, people can now cook their meals in a matter of minutes. This change has been particularly beneficial for housewives, who were traditionally responsible for cooking meals for their families. Liberated from the tedious cooking process, they now have additional time to pursue more meaningful activities such as hobbies, education, or even careers. For instance, a housewife can now use the time she saves from cooking to take up a part-time job, pursue a degree, or simply spend quality time with her family.The ease of food preparation has also had a positive impact on the overall quality of life. With more time on their hands, people can now focus on other aspects of their lives, such as health, relationships, and personal growth. Moreover, the convenience of modern cooking has also enabled people to lead busier and more active lifestyles, without having to compromise on nutrition or taste. In conclusion, the ease of food preparation, made possible by technological advances, has undoubtedly improved the way people live. It has given people more time, freedom, and flexibility to pursue their interests and lead more fulfilling lives.

question: Some young adults want independence from their parents as soon as possible. Other young adults prefer to live with their families for a longer time. Which of these situations do you think is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Learning to be independent is essential for young adults. However, how early the children leave their parents is a difficult issue. In my point of view, staying with the parents for longer time does more benefits than disadvantages to the young adult. My opinion is based on creating memories with parents, saving money, and taking advice from parents.First of all, one of the most significant upsides is that the young adult can have more experience with his parents. The young adult has to try to create memories with his dad and mom in the early age. When having a job, it is of low possibilities to work in his hometown. If he lives with his parents for longer time, they have more chances to share the feelings, exercise, and travel together. All memories become priceless treasure as time passes by. Thus, I think undergoing with parents is worthwhile.Furthermore, living at home costs less than living outside. Learning to be independent means that the young adult needs to leave home. Therefore, he may have to rent a house and the rental would become a burden for parents. Moreover, another daily expense is also the considerable outgoings. Spending much money may not result in what the parents expect their children to be. In a word, the parents can save money, if their children live with them longer.The third convincing reason is that the young adult needs father and mother's suggestions. When in dilemma, the parents can comfort him and give him a big hand. They are the people who are most familiar with him can give a suitable advice and lead him to the right way. If the parents do not help him immediately, he would have to suffer more pain. Hence, taking advice from parents, the young adult can go through obstacles easily.To sum up, living with parents longer brings about memories with parents, less cost, and advice from parents. Hence, staying longer with parents is a better choice.
llm: The debate about when young adults should gain independence from their parents has sparked intense discussion. While some argue that moving out as soon as possible is the key to independence, others believe that living with their families for a longer period is more beneficial. In my opinion, the latter situation is better, and for good reason.Living with parents for a longer time allows young adults to create lasting memories with their families. Sharing daily experiences, traditions, and special occasions with parents and siblings fosters a sense of belonging and strengthens family bonds. For instance, family dinners, game nights, and vacations together become cherished moments that young adults can treasure forever. Moreover, living with parents provides an opportunity for young adults to learn valuable life skills, such as cooking, budgeting, and time management, from their parents.Another significant advantage of living with parents is the financial benefit. By staying at home, young adults can save a substantial amount of money on rent, utilities, and food. This enables them to allocate their earnings towards education, career development, or savings, setting them up for long-term financial stability. In a word, parents can save money, if their children live with them longer, as they do not have to support their children financially when they move out. Additionally, parents can offer valuable advice and guidance on important life decisions, such as career choices, relationships, and investments, which can help young adults avoid costly mistakes.In conclusion, living with parents for a longer time has numerous benefits, including creating lasting memories, saving money, and receiving valuable advice. While independence is essential, it is not necessarily tied to moving out immediately. By staying at home, young adults can enjoy a more stable and supportive transition into adulthood, ultimately leading to a more successful and fulfilling life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the statement that a zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and example to explain your answer.
human: Some people may believe that a zoo is futile in the era of globalization, which people can develop their knowledge fast and easily. However, I do not agree with them. I believe that the zoo is invaluable for human beings. It is very crucial for learning. It helps animals out of extinction. Also, it is a interesting travel location.First of all, the zoo gives humans new knowledge. When you were so young that you did not know many kinds of animals, what should you do if there were no zoo? Inevitably, the zoo is the important place for innate learning. The zoo also let students have a chance to learning biology practically. They are able to observe animals' behaviors and features. Moreover, practical learning help students relax from a boring lecture class. Besides, researchers need the zoo to pick up some examples of animals for their researches because it has diverse species of animals.Secondly, the zoo preserves a large number of rare animals and provides them safe habitats. In the zoo, there is not so harmful as a forest. They, fed by zookeepers, do not need to find food themselves. Furthermore, we can do artificial insemenation to maintain nearly extinct wildlife.Last but not least, because of all weird, acute, and beautiful animals in the zoo, it can be a great tourist attraction. There are a lot of tourists who seek to see those animals closely. If the zoo has a large number of both national and foreign tourists, it will receive a great deal of money. That also make money flow, and then economics become better. It benefits to a certain country. In conclusion, the zoo not only saves animals in danger of extinction, but also helps people around the world have better lives. I firmly believe that the zoo is so useful for the earth.
llm: I strongly disagree with the statement that a zoo has no useful purpose. In fact, zoos play a vital role in our society, serving multiple purposes that benefit both humans and animals. Firstly, a zoo is a valuable educational resource, where people, especially children, can learn about different species, their habitats, and behaviors. By observing and interacting with animals in a controlled environment, visitors can gain a deeper understanding and appreciation of the natural world, fostering a sense of responsibility and conservation.Moreover, zoos are instrumental in helping to preserve endangered species and prevent extinction. Many zoos participate in breeding programs for threatened animals, providing a safe haven for them to thrive and multiply. For example, the California Condor and the Black Footed Ferret are two species that have been successfully bred in captivity and released back into the wild, thanks to the efforts of zoos. This conservation work is essential for maintaining the delicate balance of ecosystems and preserving biodiversity.In addition to their educational and conservation roles, zoos are also significant tourist attractions, contributing to the local economy. They provide employment opportunities, generate revenue, and stimulate economic growth. A visit to the zoo can be a fun and entertaining experience for families, promoting social interaction and community engagement. Many zoos also offer behind-the-scenes tours, animal encounters, and interactive exhibits, making them a popular destination for visitors from around the world.In conclusion, zoos have a multitude of purposes, from education and conservation to tourism and community engagement. They provide a unique platform for people to connect with nature, learn about wildlife, and contribute to the preservation of our planet's precious species. Therefore, I firmly believe that zoos have a valuable and indispensable role in our society, and their importance should not be underestimated.

question: Parents are the best teacher for young children. To what extend do you argee or disagree?
human: It is obvious that parents are the first teachers who teach babies how to walk and speak and make children to become a good person. Moreover, parents provide their children the best social skills and knowledge in order to prepare for their children's future life.First, children are taught basic things, which influence their whole life, by their parents. As a baby, they do not know any thing all around but they learn everything from their parents. Parents always try to explain and describe tenderly all things in simple way so that their baby can understand and learn from that. Consequently, parents bring the whole world of wonderful and colorful thing into their baby's little mind.Second, parents train their child how to become a good person. They always make their children basically say thanks and apology in the right way. On the one hand, it is common that they try to explain who is a good or bad person. On the other hand, children are shown how to behave well with others. This seems to be easy but this can influence positively their future children and makes children's behavior better before they face the real world.Third, it is clear that parents are ones who loves their children most and always take care of their children. Thus, they tend to provide the best knowledge and advice from their experience for children. Unlike a professional, parents always support children and give them much social skill so they can communicate well with others and have good habit in life. In fact, parents' support is one factor which makes people succeed in their life.In conclusion, parents are really the best teachers who give us much knowledge and advice. Based on love, they always try their best to make good condition for their children development in order to prepare children's future life.
llm: The statement that "parents are the best teacher for young children" is one that I strongly agree with. From the moment a child is born, parents play a pivotal role in their development, teaching them the most basic yet essential skills such as how to walk and speak. These early lessons lay the foundation for a child's future learning and development. Moreover, parents are not just teachers of physical and linguistic skills, but also of moral values and principles that shape a child into a good person.Based on love and a deep desire to see their children succeed, parents strive to create the best possible conditions for their development. This includes providing a nurturing environment, both physically and emotionally, where children feel safe and encouraged to learn and grow. Parents make sacrifices to ensure their children have access to quality education, healthcare, and extracurricular activities that are essential for their holistic development. The unconditional love and support from parents give children the confidence to explore, learn from their mistakes, and develop resilience.Furthermore, parents are uniquely positioned to understand their child's strengths, weaknesses, and learning style, allowing them to tailor their teaching and support to meet their child's individual needs. This personalized approach to learning and development is something that formal education systems often cannot replicate. By preparing children for their future life, parents set them up for success, not just academically, but also socially and emotionally. In conclusion, the influence and impact parents have on young children's lives make them the best teachers. Their love, dedication, and personalized approach to teaching make them indispensable in shaping the next generation into capable, compassionate, and well-rounded individuals.

question: Some people say that television has a bad influence to young children. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays, we have undergone many technology innovations such as Tv. Many people say that television has negative effects on children, since it can be violent or inappropriate for children. However, I strongly believe that television has more positive effects than negative effects. There are two reasons to support my idea.First of all, television has useful and educational programs. Not only the up-to-date news, but also there are many programs which has educational purposes. If children can use those programs wisely, they can learn many information from it. For example, in Korea, there's program called EBS. It is targeted for children to teenager. We can study subjects through EBS lecture. Also, there are many documentary films such as the life of a great man in Korea. Using those education programs let people get a lot of inspirations instead of having negative effects. In addition, Tv is helpful to relieve our stresses. There are many Tv programs such as sports programs. Many children have a lot of stresses recently, since they have so much pressure about study. When they are watching sports programs, it's easy to relieve those stresses. As an example, I got too much stress from the school. So, I was quite aggressive, however. After I watch the soccer match between Korea and Japan, the stress was gone. Instead, this soccer match helped me to continue my academic career in the school, since it helped me to relieve my stress.In conclusion, of course, the television can have violent programs, however, if children can use Tv programs wisely, there are more positive effects than negative effects. Now that, it has useful and educational programs and quite helpful to relieve stresses for children. For these reasons, I strongly disagree with the statement that television has negative effects on children.
llm: The impact of television on young children has been a topic of debate for many years. Some people argue that television has a profoundly negative influence on children, while others believe that its effects can be largely positive. In my opinion, I partially agree that television can have detrimental effects on young minds, but I also believe that if utilized wisely, the benefits can outweigh the drawbacks.Many people say that television has negative effects on children, since it can be violent or inappropriate for young viewers. Exposure to violent or explicit content can desensitize children to aggressive behavior and promote unhealthy habits. Furthermore, excessive television watching can lead to a sedentary lifestyle, contributing to obesity and other health problems. These concerns are valid and highlight the potential risks associated with unregulated television viewing.However, if children can use TV programs wisely, there are more positive effects than negative effects. Educational programs, such as documentaries, science shows, and children's educational series, can enhance knowledge, foster creativity, and promote critical thinking. Additionally, television can provide a window into different cultures, traditions, and ways of life, broadening children's understanding and tolerance of the world around them. Parents and caregivers can play a significant role in ensuring that children watch television responsibly by selecting appropriate content, setting limits, and engaging in discussions about what they are watching.In conclusion, while there are legitimate concerns about the potential negative impacts of television on young children, I believe that with wise and moderated use, the benefits of television can surpass its drawbacks. By being mindful of the content and duration of television viewing, parents can harness its potential to educate, inform, and inspire their children, ultimately contributing to their healthy development and growth.

question: Businesses should hire employees for their entire lives. Do you agree or disagree. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.Ê
human: Many entrepreneurs hypothesize that it is safer to hire employees for their entire lives in order to ensure the productivity and efficiency of working. From my perspective, those assumptions are not only conservative but also out-of-date. I am biased towards the opposite side that businesses had better not employ the workers for the whole of their life because of the three main crucial reasons. First and foremost, various ideas and creativity from different people are indispensable for a company to flourish. The invaluable experience of senior employees can pass down to the young apprentices who get used to new job, but regularly give out creative and novel ideas. What's more, the rapid development in every field nowadays requires precise updates and access to new knowledge. Therefore, the youngsters are capable of meeting those standards. More importantly, they have activeness, inventiveness and enterprise which allow them to complete their jobs perfectly. These vital factors can decide whether the company can thrive or not.Secondly, the staff soon gets boring with their stable job in such a long time. At a certain time, they may presume that a securing job is the most important and necessary because they need to earn money to manage their life. Thereafter, the bulk of them realize that high promotion and competition can assist them to improve their skills and horizons also. Many people enjoy challenging them because they don not want to be monotonous and passive ones. The same-old-same-old environment soon makes them depressed, so this situation will have an adverse impact on the enterprise. Last but not least, the economic crisis and financial recession result in a tremendous increase in unemployment. In my opinion, the businesses ought to recruit many workers so as to tackle this aching issue. It enables the jobless to better their life and earn a living. Furthermore, the factories and companies will have abundant human sources to ensure the pace of manufacture and also devising lots of unique ideas. In a nutshell, varied characteristics of various people, feeling tired of having the same occupation and solving the unemployed problem drive me to agree with the statement that the employer should not hire the staff for a whole life. I believe that the brilliant bosses are conscious of the need for giving opportunities to diverse employees.
llm: The notion that businesses should hire employees for their entire lives has been a topic of debate among entrepreneurs and human resource experts. Many entrepreneurs hypothesize that it is safer to hire employees for their entire lives in order to ensure the productivity and efficiency of working. From my perspective, those assumptions are not only conservative but also out-of-date. I am biased towards the opposite side that businesses had better not employ the workers for the whole of their life because of three main crucial reasons.Firstly, hiring employees for life can lead to stagnation and complacency. When employees feel secure in their jobs, they may become less motivated to innovate and improve their skills, which can ultimately hinder the growth and development of the company. Secondly, a lifetime employment contract can limit the company's ability to adapt to changing market conditions and technological advancements. Companies need to be agile and responsive to new opportunities and challenges, and a rigid employment structure can prevent them from doing so. Lastly, lifetime employment can also lead to a lack of diversity and fresh perspectives within the company. When employees are hired for life, they may become entrenched in their ways of thinking and working, which can stifle creativity and innovation.In conclusion, while hiring employees for life may provide a sense of security and stability, it is not a viable or desirable option for businesses in today's fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment. Companies need to be able to respond quickly to new challenges and opportunities, and a flexible and dynamic employment structure is essential for achieving this goal. By not employing workers for their entire lives, businesses can foster a culture of innovation, adaptability, and continuous improvement, which is essential for success in today's competitive market.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Childhood is the happiest time of a person's life. Use reasons and specific examples to support your opinion.
human: I agree with the statement that childhood is the happiest period of one's life. It's not only the lack of responsibilities and daily struggle that make childhood the happiest time of our lives, but also factors like learning lots of new things every day and freedom to imagine and say what you think.Starting with our adulthood, we are strictly bounded with our responsibilities in our daily lives. We are told at what hour we shall wake up, how we shall dress up and how we shall behave. Every action we make are watched closely and judged by the community. But during our childhood, though responsibilies exist, we are much more free to do what we would like to. Being late for school or laughing at a place where you aren't supposed to do not have consequences as serious as that would be if you were an adult. Another great thing about being a child is possibility learning new and interesting things about the world you live in every single day. Being a child means that you are new in this world and every single thing around you is there to be discovered by you. There are lots of new facts you can learn, stories you can listen to and things you can see. Therefore, childhood is the period of time in which a person is surprised most.Using your imagination and saying what you think freely is another great thing about being a child. Children are not judged about the things they say as much as the adults, and freedom to express yourself is a very important for developing a colorful imagination. In adulthood, people are forced to express themselves in boundaries, therefore they are in no way free to think or use their imagination.Childhood, in several aspects, is the happiest period of our lives. It's not only because of the nature of childhood and children, but also the way our lives are changed when we are adults. In an ideal world with less boundaries, social judgement and more freedom of thought, things could be different; but since this is not the case, it seems that we will always be missing our childhood days.
llm: The statement "Childhood is the happiest time of a person's life" is a notion that has sparked debate among individuals. While some may argue that adulthood brings greater happiness, I firmly agree with this statement. Childhood, in several aspects, is indeed the happiest period of one's life.One of the primary reasons is that childhood is the period of time in which a person is surprised most. Everything is new and fascinating, from the simplest things like bubbles and balloons to the complexity of nature and the world around them. This sense of wonder and awe contributes significantly to the joy and happiness of childhood. For instance, who can forget the magic of Christmas morning or the thrill of birthdays, where the air is filled with excitement and anticipation?Another great thing about childhood is the freedom to imagine and say what you think without the burden of societal expectations or self-censorship. Children have the liberty to express themselves freely, whether through art, play, or simple conversation, without fear of judgment. This uninhibited expression of thoughts and feelings is a source of immense happiness and fulfillment. Additionally, the imagination knows no bounds during childhood, allowing children to create their own worlds, stories, and characters, further enriching their experience of life.In conclusion, the combination of a sense of wonder, the freedom to express oneself, and the limitless bounds of imagination make childhood a uniquely happy period. While adulthood may bring its own set of joys and fulfillments, the carefree nature and endless curiosity of childhood undoubtedly make it the happiest time of a person's life. As such, it is essential to cherish and nurture this period, allowing children to grow and flourish in an environment that fosters happiness and development.

question: Learning about the past has no value on for those of us living the present. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people think that "Past has nothing to do with present, as time never stops, the next generations are completely different from the predecessors". Although it is true that life changes rapidly, there are many things in the past that we can learn about, such as mistakes, success and knowledge in many fields of study. First of all, the predecessors' mistakes are the first thing that we should consider when learning about the past. As everyone's life is too short to risk trying anything without any prepare, we all should learn about other's mistakes so that we can avoid making the same ones. Each mistake, from the smallest to the bigger one, is a treasure of experience, which, if we can make full use of, will make us well-prepared for many complicated situations of our life. Therefore, past obviously saves ourselves a bunch of failures and times.Secondly, people's success in the past is as significant as those mistakes. If the predecessors' mistakes are the indirect way that leads us to the goals, others' accomplishment can be served as the direct way. By looking into the ways other people use to achieve their targets, we have the chance to make those mine, put them into practice and, of course, be successful like them. For instance, Edison's statement "Genius is 1 percent inspiration and 99 percent perspiration" is still helpful for everyone today, and probably in the future. Last but not least, the past is the basis in which people can use to develope new knowledge, inventions. If it had not been for those knowledge in the past, we could never be as modern as today. How can America be the world's leading country if Columbus did not accidentally discover it in his search for India. How can the comtemporary scientists study the earth's gravity without the apple which fall on Newton's head. They are only some of many precious knowledge that the past presents us. We cannot ignore them in any way.All in all, the past's mistakes, success and knowledge all have crucial impact on people's lives today. We should make full use of the past, instead of ignoring it, for a better and brighter future.
llm: The notion that learning about the past has no value for those living in the present is a misguided one. Many people think that the past has nothing to do with the present, as time never stops, and therefore, what happened before is irrelevant to our current lives. However, this perspective overlooks the numerous valuable lessons and knowledge that can be gleaned from history.In reality, the past is replete with experiences, both successes and mistakes, that can inform and enrich our present. By studying historical events, we can learn from the errors of our predecessors, avoiding the repetition of costly mistakes. Conversely, we can also draw inspiration from the achievements of the past, using them as a foundation to build upon and innovate. The accumulation of knowledge in various fields of study, such as science, technology, and sociology, is a direct result of past discoveries and advancements.Ignoring the past would mean disregarding the hard-won wisdom and breakthroughs that have brought us to where we are today. Instead, we should make full use of the past, analyzing it to understand how it has shaped our current world. This retrospective understanding can guide us in making informed decisions for a brighter future. History teaches us about the complexities of human nature, the evolution of ideas, and the consequences of actions, all of which are essential for navigating the complexities of the present.In conclusion, learning about the past is not only valuable but necessary for those living in the present. It offers a wealth of knowledge, cautionary tales, and inspirations that can significantly enhance our lives and the decisions we make. By embracing and learning from history, we can pave the way for a more enlightened, progressive, and successful future. Therefore, it is paramount that we continue to study, appreciate, and apply the lessons of the past to forge a better tomorrow.

question: Governments spent a lot of money for traveling outer space. Do you think the investment is reasonable? Give your own opinion and reasons to support you claim
human: Space exploration, for discovery of out of space, has been possible for human in the 20th century. The United state and Russia are the important countries that spend large budgets for the research of this subject. In my opinion, spending the budget for space exploration is an important activity to save living of humanity in the future. Many governments believe that space exploration is an activity that wastes the budget, while the essential challenge of humanity in the future would be the discovery of a new place for the living. In 20th century, although human being succeeded to achieve out of space by means of new technologies such as rockets, but finding a new place for living in another planet is impossible until now. In during history, our planet is threatening by many of other planets or stars and it is an enormous danger for living of humanity. Therefore, it is very significant to find a new place for living in other planets. Space exploration has used as a tools for military power in the cold war. In the future, many countries will try to prevent attach of other countries by using and invention new missiles. In the past, the space race happened between the United Stated and the Soviet Union. Both countries tried to send man to the moon and show their power to each other. As a result, space exploration will use as a military power for many countries.In summary, spending budget for space exploring is not the waste budget, because it may helps to save civilization of humanity. Although exploring space used for discovery of other planets, nowadays most of governments have used many rockets for military purposes and therefore the purposes of exploring space has altered.
llm: The investment of governments in outer space travel has sparked a heated debate about its reasonableness. Space exploration, which has been possible for humans since the 20th century, has opened up new avenues for discovery and advancement. In my opinion, spending the budget for space exploration is an important activity to save the living of humanity in the future. By exploring space, we can gain valuable insights into the universe, unlock new technologies, and potentially discover new resources that can sustain human life.Historically, space exploration has been used as a tool for military power, particularly during the Cold War era. The United States and the Soviet Union engaged in a space race, with each side attempting to outdo the other in space exploration and technology. This competition drove innovation and led to numerous breakthroughs in fields such as rocketry, materials science, and computer technology. Although the primary motivation was military dominance, the spin-off benefits have been immense, with many of these technologies being adapted for civilian use.Moreover, space exploration can provide a safeguard against global catastrophes, such as asteroid impacts or supervolcanic eruptions, by identifying potential threats and developing strategies for mitigation. Additionally, space-based resources, like solar energy and helium-3 for nuclear fusion, could become crucial for humanity's energy needs in the future. Therefore, I firmly believe that the investment in space exploration is a prudent and forward-thinking decision, essential for ensuring the long-term survival and prosperity of humanity. By continuing to explore and understand space, we are, in effect, investing in our own future.

question: Do you agree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.Ê
human: Television is one of the greatest innovations that we use every day. Besides, watching television has some cons and at the same time has very good pros. However, while some people argue that TV has devastated communication among friends and families, I believe it has done the opposite. I think TV programs are among the popular topics in every day talk as well as a great time for gathering. In addition Modern TV has smart system that let you be connected with people.First, it's true watching TV take a lot of your day, nevertheless it makes people meet and start a conversation about what they watch at other times like weather forecast and sport programs.Second, people like having meals while they are watching TV. Families usually tend to watch television either with each other or friends. For example my friends and I used to sit together and enjoy watching movies using VHS player at nights. It was fun and a little bit similar to the cinema. Third, TV can be one of communication ways. Moreover, TV can be connected to multimedia devices that have smart operating system like Google TV, WDTV using Skype, tango and other apps. In addition Teenagers can play games online with their friends; therefore we can communicate with each other through TV. To sum up, TV may take some of your time away from your family and friends but it can also make family get together and help to get in conversation. As well as it's one way of recent communications, based on that I think TV helps you to get connected with people.
llm: Television is one of the greatest innovations that we use every day, and its impact on our lives cannot be overstated. While some people argue that TV has devastated communication among friends and families, I believe it has done the opposite. In my opinion, the statement "Television has destroyed communication among friends and family" is an exaggeration and not entirely accurate.On the contrary, television has provided a platform for friends and family to come together and share experiences. For instance, watching a favorite TV show or a sporting event can be a great way to bond with loved ones. Families can gather around the TV to watch a movie or a popular series, sparking conversations and discussions about the plot, characters, and themes. Moreover, television has also made it possible for people to stay updated about current events, news, and social issues, which can lead to meaningful conversations and debates among family and friends.Furthermore, television has also provided a common ground for people to connect with each other, regardless of their age or background. For example, a grandparent and a grandchild can watch a cooking show or a nature documentary together, sharing their thoughts and opinions. This shared experience can help to bridge the gap between different generations and foster a sense of togetherness.In conclusion, while it is true that excessive TV watching can lead to social isolation, I firmly believe that television has not destroyed communication among friends and family. On the contrary, it has provided a platform for people to come together, share experiences, and engage in meaningful conversations. When used in moderation, television can be a powerful tool to strengthen relationships and create lasting memories among loved ones.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship.Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There is an argument regrading weather letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship. It is widely accepted by many people that a mistake will return sometimes terrible result. However, I believe that friendship is more important than mistake by a friend, although mistake is terrible. In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my opinion. First of all, a mistake does not last for a long time but a friendship lasts forever. Anybody does not remember mistakes. If someone remembers mistake, he or she has a closed mind. I want to say that mistakes will be forgotten quickly. For example, my friend Lee made a mistake that he broke my precious gift. However, I forgot about it just after two days, and I felt at peace with him. Some people might say I am silly, but I think mistake is more forgettable than friendship. Second, Everybody makes mistake. However, if you end a friendship whenever your friend makes a mistake, there will be no friends around you. I agree if a friend makes very a big mistake, we will need to end a friendship. However, when the mistake friend made was not a big problem, we need to understand friend and forgive it because a friend is a gift of our life. According to a research, 85% of people answered that a best gift is a friend.I think that a mistake can not brake friendship if it is not a big because friendship is forever and gift our life.
llm: The age-old adage "to let someone make their own mistakes" has sparked a heated debate among friends and scholars alike. The statement "letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship" has garnered both support and criticism. In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my opinion that I disagree with this statement.Firstly, taking action to prevent a friend from making a mistake demonstrates a genuine concern for their well-being. For instance, if a friend is about to invest in a dubious business venture, it is a friend's duty to warn them of the potential risks. By speaking up, one can help their friend avoid financial ruin and preserve their relationship. In contrast, letting a friend make a mistake out of fear of damaging the friendship may lead to long-term resentment and damage to the relationship.Secondly, taking action to prevent a mistake can actually strengthen a friendship in the long run. When a friend takes the time to offer constructive advice or intervene in a potentially harmful situation, it shows that they value and care about the other person's life. This can foster a deeper sense of trust and appreciation, ultimately leading to a more resilient and meaningful friendship. For example, if a friend is struggling with addiction, intervening and encouraging them to seek help can be a difficult but ultimately rewarding experience that brings the friends closer together.In conclusion, while letting a friend make their own mistakes may seem like the easiest option, I firmly believe that taking action to prevent harm is a more valuable and supportive approach. By speaking up and offering guidance, friends can demonstrate their commitment to each other's well-being and build a stronger, more enduring relationship.

question: One of the best ways that parents can help their teenage children prepare for adult life is to encourage them to take a part-time job.
human: Nowadays, the society has become exceedingly competitive than ever before, parents have the responsibilitis to teach their children to survive and to be indepedent from them, just as animals teach their offspring skills of finding foods. Parents can use many methods to guide them to achieve that, for example, asking them to do some housework or clean the rooms by themselves. In my views, I agree that it is the best way for teenage children to take a part-time job to prepare their adult life for several reasons.First of all, when children get a job, they are able to earn money by themselves, instead of getting pocket money from their parents. Thus, it is an oppertunity to learn how to deal with money. Take me as an example, when I was 16, I found a job during summer vacation and earned some money by own. At the beginning of the semester, I was told to buy a text book. Unfortunately, I spent most of my salary hanging out with my friend. Therefore, I finally realized that I should learn to make a plan before I spend my money, and that did influence me in my life now.Secondly, by taking a part-time job, they certainly have to be responsible for anything they have done. For instance, if a student get a job in a company but he is frequently late for work, the company may reduce his payment or even fire him. To compare with the school life, they might suffer only a small punishment at school. Under the circumstances, he will learn that he has to obey the rule and take responsibility for their work.In conclusion, to help their children to adapt adult life, parents should let them experience it as much as they can. Due to the reasons given above, to encourage children taking a part-time job is a good choice for them to get prepared for adult life.
llm: In my view, it is the best way for teenage children to take a part-time job to prepare for adult life for several reasons. Firstly, when children get a job, they are able to earn money by themselves, instead of getting pocket money from their parents. This independence allows them to manage their finances, understand the value of money, and make wise decisions about their spending. By earning their own money, teenagers develop a sense of self-sufficiency and responsibility, which is essential for their future.Moreover, having a part-time job teaches teenagers important life skills, such as time management, discipline, and accountability. For instance, if a student is frequently late for work, the company may reduce his payment or even fire him. Under these circumstances, he will learn that he has to obey the rules and take responsibility for his work. This experience will help him understand the consequences of his actions and develop a strong work ethic. Additionally, the pressure of meeting deadlines and completing tasks will help him prioritize his work and balance his school life with his job.Overall, taking a part-time job is an invaluable experience for teenage children as it prepares them for the realities of adult life. It not only provides them with financial independence but also teaches them essential life skills, such as responsibility, discipline, and time management. By encouraging their teenage children to take a part-time job, parents can help them develop into capable and self-sufficient individuals who are ready to face the challenges of adulthood.

question: It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
human: It’s certainly better for children to grow up in a big city. Of course you need to choose a good neighborhood. I hold this belief because of two main reasons, academic and social reasons.Some people thinks that if a child grows up in a big city they will be all day at home at the computer or at the video-game, but this is not true if you live in a neighborhood with other people about your age as I did. My friends and I used to play soccer, bike, climb trees and do a lot of other stuff every day. We did play video-games, but that wasn't our main activity. In a big city there are more kinds of people and more things to do.I have a friend that grew up in the countryside. He said that he had to study a lot to pass the test to enter the university. This is another downside of growing up in the countryside. In a big city you have more qualified teachers and a better access to technology.Growing up in the countryside is not such a good experience, you won’t know a lot of people, there are gossips everywhere, and your life will be really limited. If someday I have children, I’m absolutely sure that they will grow up in a good neighborhood of a big city and they will be very happy about it.
llm: The debate about whether it is better for children to grow up in the countryside or in a big city has sparked intense discussion. While some argue that the countryside offers a more peaceful and serene environment, I firmly disagree and believe that growing up in a big city is more beneficial for children. In a big city, there are more kinds of people and more things to do, which can broaden children's horizons and provide them with a diverse range of experiences. They can interact with people from different backgrounds, cultures, and professions, which can foster their social skills and understanding of the world. Moreover, cities offer a wide range of entertainment, educational, and recreational activities that can stimulate children's curiosity and creativity. On the other hand, growing up in the countryside can be quite limiting. For instance, if a child wants to pursue higher education, they have to study a lot to pass the test to enter the university, which can be a daunting task. Furthermore, the countryside is often plagued by gossips, which can be detrimental to a child's self-esteem and emotional well-being. The limited opportunities and lack of anonymity in rural areas can also make a child's life feel really limited, stifling their personal growth and development. Personally, if someday I have children, I'm absolutely sure that they will grow up in the city. I want them to have access to the best educational and cultural resources, to be exposed to different perspectives and ways of life, and to have the freedom to make their own choices and forge their own paths. In conclusion, while the countryside has its charms, I firmly believe that growing up in a big city is better for children, offering them a more diverse, stimulating, and liberating environment that can help them reach their full potential.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I completely agree that parents are the best teacher. Children normally think that their parents are somehow special and that makes them the most important people in the children’s lives.Firstly, the things that parents say have great power to their child. More power than any friend or other adult could have. For example, if someone tells a kid that something is wrong and they shouldn't do it, but his father told him/her that it was right, the kid will listen to the father instead of the other person, even if his father is wrong.Secondly, a child normally spends more time with their parents than with other people, so their parents have more time to teach him/her than anybody else. They have more contact and more intimacy with their children. Lastly, children usually mirror themselves on their parents. That’s as important thing because even if the parents don’t intend to teach their children something, they are always observing and learning by themselves. So, if there is a man that beats his wife and treats her bad, his child probably is going to be rude and treat girls bad.All in all, I agree that parents are the greatest teachers and I think that they should be very careful with what they say and do in front of their child, because it can define who he is going to be.
llm: I strongly agree with the statement that parents are the best teachers. The things that parents say have great power to their child, more power than any friend or other adult could have. The words of encouragement, guidance, and discipline spoken by parents can shape a child's thoughts, feelings, and actions, and have a lasting impact on their development. For instance, a parent's praise can boost a child's confidence and self-esteem, while their criticism can help a child learn from their mistakes.Furthermore, a child normally spends more time with their parents than with other people, so their parents have more time to teach him/her than anybody else. From a young age, children look up to their parents as role models and spend a significant amount of time with them, observing and imitating their behavior. This prolonged exposure provides parents with ample opportunities to impart their values, skills, and knowledge to their child. Whether it's teaching a child how to read, ride a bike, or cook a meal, parents are always there to guide and support their child's learning process.Additionally, children usually mirror themselves on their parents, adopting their habits, attitudes, and beliefs. Parents' influence on their child's behavior and personality is profound, and their teaching extends beyond academics to important life skills like manners, morals, and social etiquette. By being a constant presence in their child's life, parents can instill values like honesty, kindness, and responsibility, which are essential for a child's overall development. In conclusion, parents play a unique and significant role in a child's life, and their teaching has a profound impact on shaping their child's future. Therefore, I firmly believe that parents are indeed the best teachers.

question: Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: The Technology has developed a lot. With that development, food can be prepared more easily and it can taste a lot better than it used to. With that change, people’s lives are a lot better for several reasons. Some good reasons are about having more time and being able to prepare better food without being a good cook.Firstly, people normally have lots of things to do. Because of that, they don’t have much time to spend in the kitchen. But being able to prepare a tasty food just putting it into the microwave or into the oven is awesome. For example, if an engineer needs to make a project, but he needs to deliver it tomorrow, he could save hours preparing a food with the microwave instead of cooking everything from scratch.Secondly, when someone wants to prepare a good food alone for some reason, some time ago he/she would need to be a very good cook to prepare that food, but nowadays is very easy to prepare a healthy and tasty food. For example, if a guy wants to prepare a dinner to his girlfriend, he could just buy some food that comes with instructions. Normally you just need to put it into the oven and wait some time.All in all, that ease to prepare food has improved people’s lives. And that happened mainly because of the development of the technology. But people should be careful with what they eat, because some industrial foods are very bad for their health, so they should buy only food from well known brands.
llm: The advent of modern food preparation methods has revolutionized the way people live, making it easier and more convenient to access a wide variety of cuisines. With the development of advanced cooking techniques and industrial food production, food can be prepared more easily and it can taste a lot better than it used to. For instance, the invention of microwave ovens and pre-packaged meals has saved people a significant amount of time, which can be utilized for other activities such as leisure, work, or spending time with family and friends.Moreover, the increased availability of diverse ingredients and ready-to-eat meals has enabled people to explore different flavors and culinary traditions from around the world. This has not only broadened people's palates but also facilitated cultural exchange and understanding. Furthermore, the ease of food preparation has also made it possible for people with busy schedules to maintain a healthy diet, as they can quickly prepare nutritious meals without sacrificing flavor or quality.However, it is essential for people to be careful with what they eat, as some industrial foods are very bad for their health. Processed and packaged foods often contain high amounts of salt, sugar, and unhealthy fats, which can lead to obesity, diabetes, and other diet-related health issues. Therefore, it is crucial for individuals to strike a balance between convenience and nutrition, opting for whole foods and homemade meals whenever possible. In conclusion, the ease of food preparation has undoubtedly improved the way people live, offering more convenience, diversity, and flavor. Nevertheless, it is vital to prioritize health and nutrition, being mindful of the potential risks associated with industrial foods. By doing so, people can fully capitalize on the benefits of modern food preparation while maintaining a healthy and balanced lifestyle.

question: Students should be required to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning
human: The issue at hand is if the schools should require students to take regular standardized exams. This issue is important because nowadays many people cast doubt on it. However, I believe that standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.Firstly, standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students. For example some students are not so active on the lessons, cause they are already familiar with the issue. Therefore, exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students. In addition, many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class, so the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them.Additionally, standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice. Since, some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard, so they will never try to solve problems on their own. However, standardized tests offer them such chance. Thus, it is clear that schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides.Finally, I think that requirement to take standardized tests is the right choice, since in this case teachers can compare the level of knowledge of different students. In any class there will be students who will show low academic performance, so teachers could work with them more intensively. I support the points of those who say that standardized tests are required over those who don’t because if the teacher would know the level of each student he would fairly share his time to all of them.Ultimately I feel that schools which obligate their students to take standardized tests are right. I belive this, due to the fact that these schools can qualitatively check if they are giving an appropriate education to their students.
llm: The issue at hand is whether schools should require students to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning. In this debate, the argument that students should be required to take regular standardized tests is a strong one. Standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students. These exams provide a consistent and unbiased measure of a student's knowledge and understanding, allowing teachers to assess their progress accurately.In addition, many teachers rely heavily on exam results while grading the class, making the usage of exams the superior option for them. By using standardized tests, teachers can compare the performance of their students to others in the same grade level, identifying areas where students may need extra support or enrichment. This information can be used to inform instruction and make data-driven decisions about teaching strategies. Moreover, Regular standardized tests also help to ensure that students are held to high standards and are prepared for future academic challenges. They provide students with the opportunity to demonstrate their knowledge and skills, and to identify areas where they need to improve. By requiring students to take regular standardized tests, schools can promote a culture of accountability and academic excellence. In conclusion, requiring students to take regular standardized tests is essential for ensuring that students are learning and meeting academic standards. These tests provide a fair and accurate measure of student knowledge, help teachers to identify areas where students need support, and promote a culture of accountability and academic excellence. Therefore, schools should require students to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars
human: A famous proverb “Knowledge is power” has demonstrated the value of education. I believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. I have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work.University is more likely to become a money making business, the issue of affordability has become crucial to the students. In today’s world education is getting expensive, and people are tending to apply for self-finance education in order to get the admission. Whereas, the scholars are facing a lot of difficulties apart from their high requirements of previous education, they has a lot to face the other difficulties and burden while getting admission such as accommodation, food, traveling, clothing, etc.Moreover, it is hard to get manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. MPhils and PhDs scholars are probably engage in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. The idea of free of charge education inspires those scholars who really want to put their efforts and get a degree from best universities.Therefore, universities have to look over the issues face by most of the scholars; their message should be spread education, not making money, and motivate those scholars who want to get education. Their notion should be inspirational in such a way which makes our society educative and increase our literacy rate.
llm: I strongly agree with the statement that a university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars. In today's world, the cost of education is skyrocketing, making it increasingly difficult for many aspiring students to pursue higher education. As a result, many individuals are forced to opt for self-financed education, which can be a significant financial burden. This not only limits access to education but also creates a barrier for those who are genuinely passionate about learning.On the other hand, the idea of providing free education has the potential to inspire and motivate scholars who are truly dedicated to their studies. When education is free, it allows students to focus on their academic pursuits without the weight of financial stress. This, in turn, can lead to a more engaged and committed student body, as individuals are able to concentrate on their studies and pursue their interests without the burden of tuition fees.Furthermore, providing free university education can have far-reaching benefits for society as a whole. It can lead to a more educated and skilled workforce, which can drive innovation and economic growth. Additionally, it can help to reduce income inequality, as individuals from all backgrounds are given the opportunity to access higher education, regardless of their financial situation. In conclusion, providing free university education is not only a moral imperative, but also a sound investment in the future of our society. It has the potential to unlock the talents and abilities of individuals, and inspire a new generation of scholars to reach their full potential.

question: Some people think university professors should spend more time doing research while others think they should spend more time educating students. What is your view?Ê
human: Although professors in a university are basically teachers who do the most important thing, teaching, we cannot ignore one more influential aspect that they are always busy with, doing research. In my opinion, a professor should spend more time doing research rather than educating students for a few reasons following.A professor means a researcher or an expert of a specific science subject. He or she should always keep the passion in her field so that he or she could push him/herself forward all the time. And then he or she can do better in teaching works. For instance, the most impressive professor during my studying in university is Mr. Yang who keeps in researching and reading. He is also the one who gave us inspiration and taught us the way to study more efficient by ourselves. All of my classmates gave him a rank of AAA, the excellent teacher.As for students, we can get what we want to know from textbooks, webs or teachers. But we can only turn to our professors when we want to take part in a research and to get ourselves promoted. If a professor doesn't get any researching works, he cannot give us the opportunity. In addition, a professor who is concentrate in his or her research is thinking and creating new ideas all the time. He or she may stimulate us students to come up with some creative sugesstions. That is good for both of the professor and students.Finally, all professors in the university are fortune of the society. They are the leaders almost in every fields of science, arts, culture and so on. Without their research, there will be no new technologies come out quickly. Without their research, there will be more artcrafts being ruined by nothing. Without their research, there will be less information of our ancestors to be known on the earth.In conclusion, a professor should do their research all the time during their careers as a teacher in university. And it's worth to spend more time on it than on teaching.
llm: The role of university professors has been a topic of debate, with some arguing that they should focus more on research, while others believe their primary responsibility is educating students. In my view, professors should spend more time doing research rather than educating students, and there are several compelling reasons for this stance.Professors in a university are basically teachers who do the most important thing, teaching. However, we cannot ignore one more influential aspect that they are always busy with, doing research. This dual role is essential to the academic ecosystem, where professors are expected to impart knowledge to students while also advancing their fields through research. A professor should spend more time doing research rather than educating students for a few reasons. Firstly, research is a key driver of innovation and progress. By dedicating more time to research, the professor can make groundbreaking discoveries, publish papers, and contribute to the global academic community. This not only enhances their reputation but also elevates the standing of their institution. Secondly, research informs and improves teaching. When professors are actively engaged in research, they can bring real-world examples and cutting-edge knowledge into the classroom, making their teaching more relevant and engaging. This synergy between research and teaching ultimately benefits the students, as they learn from instructors who are at the forefront of their fields. Moreover, in today's fast-paced, ever-evolving world, research is crucial for staying updated with the latest developments. Professors who focus on research are better equipped to prepare students for the challenges of the future, by incorporating the latest findings and methodologies into their curriculum. In conclusion, while teaching is a vital part of a professor's job, I firmly believe that they should allocate more time to research. This approach not only advances academic knowledge but also enriches the educational experience for students, preparing them for success in an increasingly complex and interconnected world.

question: How do television or movies influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
human: There is no doubt that television or movies influence people’s behavior and they influence us in both bad ways and good ways. But I think in general television and movies influence our behavior in bad ways more than in good ways. They make people to eat more rubbish food, spend less time with their friends and family, and be someone that are not themselves. There are a lot of people eating foods or snacks when they are watching television. Most of the foods they eat are fat foods like chips or pizzas. It is not rocket science to know that these foods are not good for people’s health. Many companies know about this behavior and use advertisements on television to make people buy more of these foods. In turn, people will consume these rubbish foods more and we have to deal with a lot of fat diseases.Television and movies also make people to spend more time on their couch than with their family and friends, especially children. They communicate less with their parents because a lot of their time is used watching television and movies. When people are watching television or movies together, they also talk less to each other, compare to when playing social games, such as parlor games, together.Television and movies nowadays contain a lot of advertisements. These advertisements build ideal images that make people to feel bad about themselves and want to be more like these images. When people see beautiful women and men on the advertisements, they think that they are ugly. Thus they spend a lot of money to buy a lot of beauty products or go to gym to get better appearance or body. When a cool hero characters in a movie smokes and yet a lot of people like him, then people who idolize him may also begin to smoke although they don’t prefer it.I think television and movies are entertaining but most of the time they influence people’s behavior in bad ways. If you want to stay healthy, be yourself and spend time with your family and friends, then you should spend less time watching these media.
llm: The influence of television and movies on people's behavior is a widely debated topic. There is no doubt that television or movies influence people's behavior, shaping their thoughts, actions, and lifestyles. However, it is unfortunate that this influence is often more detrimental than beneficial.
