Many jobs have vanished as computers have taken over tasks that were previously performed by humans. For example, cashiers have been replaced by self-service machines, and bookkeeping tasks are now performed by accounting software.Despite these drawbacks, it is undeniable that computers have become an integral part of modern life. They have transformed the way we work, communicate, and access information. In conclusion, while computers have made life more convenient and efficient, they have also made many jobs obsolete. It is crucial to acknowledge both the benefits and the challenges posed by computers and work towards creating a balance between technology and human employment. Ultimately, the role of computers in society is here to stay, and it is up to us to harness their potential while mitigating their negative consequences.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?Children should begin learning a foreign language as soon as they start school. Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.
human: Learning a foreign language is necessary for children to strengthen their ability to learn. Whether children should start learning a foreign language as they start school or not might be a controversial issue. It seems to me that students should start learning that as they start school. Learning that not only help them to improve their minds and memories, but can extend their visions about the other countries. First, the ability of Learning in the childhood period is more powerful than other periods of life. Thereby students in the beginning of their education can learn faster and easier in compare to a young one to understand a foreign language. They can easily understand the language structure and memorize the vocabularies. It is out of of the questioned that the persistence of learning a knowledge in the childhood is more than other period of lives. By considering this and being aware of that students have not any responsibility and other difficulty in comparison with a young man, we can infer that why this time is the best time to learn any language.In addition, Learning a foreign language helps students tremendously to comprehend what happens in the around World. They would be able to understand other cultures and costumes. Moreover, It can give them a sense of power to communicate better with peers in other parts of the World. Having knowledge about other countries and their languages lead to extend the child's vision. Therefore, they would be able to develop their personalities and sense of reliance. Overall, it is easy to distinguish between a child having two languages and a child having just his native language while comparing their ability to communicate, understanding other studies, etc, to find that why children should start learning a foreign language in the beginning of the education.
llm: I strongly agree with the statement that children should begin learning a foreign language as soon as they start school. Learning a foreign language is necessary for children to strengthen their ability to learn and broaden their perspectives. From a young age, children's minds are like sponges, absorbing and processing vast amounts of information, and learning a foreign language can help improve their minds and memories.Acquiring a foreign language at a young age can have a profound impact on a child's cognitive development. It enhances their problem-solving skills, memory, and concentration, which can lead to better academic performance in other subjects. Moreover, learning a foreign language extends their vision about other countries, exposing them to diverse cultures, traditions, and ways of life. This, in turn, fosters global understanding, tolerance, and appreciation, essential qualities for success in an increasingly interconnected world.For instance, a child who starts learning Spanish in elementary school will not only gain a new language skill but also develop an understanding of the rich cultural heritage of Spanish-speaking countries. They will be able to appreciate the literature, music, and art of these countries, broadening their cultural knowledge and empathy towards people from different backgrounds. Furthermore, in today's globalized economy, speaking multiple languages can be a valuable asset, opening doors to new career opportunities and cultural experiences.In conclusion, introducing foreign language learning at the onset of schooling can have a transformative impact on children's cognitive, cultural, and professional development. It is an investment in their future, equipping them with the skills necessary to thrive in a multicultural and multilingual world. Therefore, I firmly believe that children should start learning a foreign language as soon as they begin their educational journey, setting them up for a lifetime of learning, growth, and global engagement.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Boys and girls should attend separate schools. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Women or men almost need each other in full of life even in school. Although some experts believe that common schools for both female and male lead to diminish their efficiency in education, others view it as a helpful way to recognize the opposite gender. In my opinion, boys and girls should study together in the sense that they have a chance to know each other and learn how to behave with an opposite sex. School is a small society for students, which prepares them for the future life. By attending to the same school, students can learn how to view the opposite gender in classes as a friend or a classmate. In addition, a boy would know how to speak with a girl in every situation and vice versa. They would know how to ask her in order to cooperate with his study, how communicate with girls in a group, etc. Admittedly, when they study together and help each other, they exercise the the real life as they age. By contrast, some experts believe that attending both girls and boys in a same school cause many disadvantages for them. By doing this, outdoors relationships may expand and it may accompany with sexual relationship and as result, their thoughts deviate from the studies. Moreover, attending in the school having boys and girls might be beneficial for both to increase their motivation to study better. Boys and girls will try to show their capabilities and abilities in the class, therefore they will study increasingly. Indeed, Boys do not like to seem weak in front of girls and vice versa. As a result, the productivity of the class will be increased. In a word, attending boys and girls in a same school would bring many advantages. Taking part in the study groups would increase student's motivation to study more. In addition, they would be able to know the opposite gender, which help them to be prepared for the adult life where they almost will live or work together.
llm: I disagree with the statement that boys and girls should attend separate schools. In my opinion, boys and girls should study together as it provides them with an opportunity to know each other and learn how to behave with the opposite sex. By attending the same school, a boy would know how to speak with a girl in every situation and vice versa. This interaction is essential in today's society, where men and women work together and need to communicate effectively.Some experts may believe that attending both girls and boys in the same school causes many disadvantages for them, such as distractions and decreased focus on academic performance. However, I believe that these drawbacks can be managed with proper discipline and guidance from teachers. On the other hand, the benefits of co-education far outweigh the disadvantages. When boys and girls study together, they learn to respect and appreciate each other's perspectives, which is crucial for building strong relationships and a harmonious society.Moreover, attending the same school helps boys and girls to develop important social skills, such as communication, teamwork, and conflict resolution. These skills are essential in all aspects of life, including personal and professional relationships. By studying together, boys and girls can break down stereotypes and misconceptions about each other, leading to a more inclusive and empathetic environment. In conclusion, I firmly believe that boys and girls should attend the same school, as it provides them with a unique opportunity to learn from each other, develop important social skills, and prepare themselves for a diverse and interconnected world.

question: Some people believe that success in life comes from taking risks or chances. Others believe that success results from careful planning. In your opinion, what does success come from? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: "The biggest risk is not taking any risk." The ones who have a big dream, they need to be brave and dare to live new situations. It is not guaranteed that you are going to achieve your dream if you had planned carefully as the same way when you take risks, but it is more frustrating if you had made plans and then it went wrong. Therefore, it is essential to take chances and believe this is going to work out. Assuming new opportunities is indispensable to have diverse experiences. In fact, life may not be easy; it will have various challenges especially when you take risks, but in the end, it can be surprisingly wonderful. For instance, some people abandon their job, family and friends and go to other country without knowing what the future holds for them. In the beginning, it can be tough to fit in this new place and find any opportunity, but after fighting against the obstacles blocking the way to get what is desired; it is possible to conquer what they are craving as well as start to build a new life in this other country. In fact, many people are afraid to take risks and fail. It is possible to get frustrate along the way, but it is vital to never give up on your dream. To illustrate, Walt Disney, whose career is famous, had a challenging life. One of the difficulties was some of his histories, such as Mickey Mouse and Three Little Pigs, were turned down. He heard lots of "no", furthermore one editor fired him alleging that he had no imagination, after all what he had gone through, he never stop chasing his dreams. To conclude, in this competitive world you have to be fearless and face all new situations. Even though sometimes you consider backing down and stay in the same routine that you are used to, it is necessary to have courage to take risks, be different and pursue your dream to have a successful life.
llm: The age-old debate about the key to success in life has sparked intense discussion among people. While some argue that careful planning is the pathway to success, others believe that taking risks or chances is the driving force behind achieving one's goals. In my opinion, I firmly believe that success comes from taking calculated risks and persevering through challenges. As the renowned philosopher Aristotle once said, "The biggest risk is not taking any risk." This quote underscores the importance of stepping out of one's comfort zone and embracing uncertainty in pursuit of success.In fact, many people are afraid to take risks and fail, but it is vital to never give up on your dream. Walt Disney, whose illustrious career is a testament to his unwavering dedication, is a prime example of this. Despite facing numerous rejections and setbacks, Disney continued to push boundaries and innovate, ultimately revolutionizing the entertainment industry. His rags-to-riches story is a powerful reminder that success often requires navigating through failures and learning from mistakes.By taking risks and persevering through challenges, individuals can develop resilience, adaptability, and a growth mindset – essential qualities for achieving success. Moreover, playing it safe and sticking to a predictable plan can lead to stagnation and missed opportunities. In contrast, embracing risk-taking and learning from failures can propel individuals towards their goals, fostering innovation, creativity, and personal growth. In conclusion, while careful planning is important, I believe that success ultimately comes from taking calculated risks, learning from failures, and persevering through challenges, as exemplified by the inspiring story of Walt Disney.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People should sometimes do things that they do not enjoy doing. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: People should sometimes do things, even though they don't enjoy it. This is basic part of the lives. In this essay, the reasons for why I agree that people should sometimes do things that they do not enjoy doing will be explored. Firstly, most people's lives are filled with tasks that they don't enjoy doing.In personal live, we have some responsibilities towards to other people, there is nobody who likes all of these responsibilities. For instance, housework is very difficult for me, although my husband helps me some of them, but it is my responsibility. I really don't like any of them, however I should do. Secondly,professional lives are filled with tasks that is neccessary parts of the jobs. Nobody likes attending boring conferences, or working a person who isn't well in with anyone. I'm a research asistant at a university, and as any of the univesity in ours we have a professor who isn't good at human relationships, most of the asistans don't enjoy to talk with him about any situation, although we have to ask about his field. Thirdly, doing something which an individual doesn't enjoy can led to enjoyment. People sometimes can attend any activities by insisting on any of their friends although they don't really want. For example, one of our friends tell my husband and me about a dance course which we both don't like. After insisting on some of our friends, we attended, and got really enjoyable time, we continued the course about six months although most of our friends left the course after a month.Nobody has a life with a lot of fun; there are sometimes unpleasant and boring parts which is not liked by anyone, but most of them are about responsibilities which is the part of individual's live.
llm: I firmly agree with the statement that people should sometimes do things that they do not enjoy doing. This is a basic part of life, as individuals often encounter situations that are not pleasant, but are necessary nonetheless. In personal and social contexts, people may have to attend events or engage in activities that they do not particularly enjoy, such as family gatherings or community meetings. However, these experiences are essential for building relationships, maintaining social bonds, and contributing to the greater good.In professional lives, tasks that are not enjoyable are a necessary part of many jobs. For instance, nobody likes attending boring conferences or working with a person who isn't well-liked by anyone. Nevertheless, these tasks are crucial for career advancement, networking, and achieving organizational goals. By undertaking such tasks, individuals can develop important skills, such as communication, teamwork, and problem-solving, which are valuable in both personal and professional settings.Moreover, doing something that an individual doesn't really enjoy can surprisingly lead to enjoyment. For example, a person who is not fond of public speaking may be required to give presentations at work. Initially, they may feel apprehensive and uncomfortable, but as they continue to practice and receive feedback, they may discover a hidden talent and eventually develop a passion for it. This can lead to a sense of accomplishment and confidence, which can be a rewarding experience. Therefore, I strongly believe that people should sometimes do things that they do not enjoy doing, as it is an essential part of personal and professional growth, and can ultimately lead to unexpected benefits and enjoyment. By embracing unpleasant tasks, individuals can develop resilience, adaptability, and a broader range of skills, which are essential for success in all aspects of life.

question: Some young adults want independence from their parents as soon as possible. Other young adults prefer to live with their families for a longer time. Which of the solutions do you think is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: As young people gets older they tend to seek more freedom and want to live on their own. But, the issue of what is the right age for young adults to leave their parents and start living on their own is a contentious one. Personally, I believe that young adults should live with their parents for a longer period of time.Living on your own is a huge financial commitment. At younger age people are less likely to get a high paying job, so It can be a difficult task to pay for rent, food, utilities and other expenses to sustain yourself. So, I believe that living with parents is a wise choice for adults until they get a head start to their professional career with a reasonable income.Another advantage of living with parents for a longer period of time is the enhanced emotional attachment with them. Parents have valuable advice to their children as they go through the changes in their adult life. Living together develops the environment of discussing adult's physiological and psychological changes face to face with their parents. Young adults will feel reluctant to discuss such problems with their parents if they move out and live on their own, and thus missing the valuable input of their parents.While some critics may argue that, young adults living with parents will not be free to do what they want. However, I believe that most young adults are inclined to take unprecedented advantages of the freedom they have. It is good thing if living with parents does not give freedom for young people to party all night, smoke or do drugs. In a nutshell, I believe that young adults should only consider living on their own only after they are sure they could sustain on their own. It is unwise to trade the opportunity of living with parents for a longer period of time for some late night parties or drugs. Thus, to cope with the physiological and psychological changes of adult life, to make financial life a less struggle and to prevent oneself digress from their destined path, it is important for young adults to live with their parents for a longer period of time.
llm: The question of when young adults should gain independence from their parents is a complex and debated issue. On one hand, young adults tend to seek more freedom and want to live on their own, as they yearn for autonomy and self-sufficiency. This desire for independence is a natural part of growing up, as they strive to make their own decisions and learn from their own experiences. However, the issue of what is the right age for young adults to leave their parents is a contentious one, with some arguing that it should be as soon as possible, while others believe it should be delayed.Personally, I believe that young adults should live with their parents for a longer period of time. This allows them to develop important life skills, such as financial management and responsibility, while still having a safety net to fall back on. Additionally, living with parents can provide young adults with emotional support and guidance, which is essential during the challenging transition to adulthood. For example, many young adults who move out too quickly may struggle with the pressures of independent living, such as paying bills and cooking meals, and may end up feeling overwhelmed and stressed. In contrast, those who live with their parents for a longer time can gradually take on more responsibilities and develop a sense of security and stability.Moreover, living with parents can also provide young adults with the opportunity to pursue their education and career goals without the burden of excessive financial stress. By living at home, they can save money, focus on their studies, and gain valuable work experience, all of which are essential for long-term success. In conclusion, while the desire for independence is natural, I firmly believe that young adults should live with their parents for a longer period of time, as it provides them with the support, guidance, and security necessary to thrive in today's challenging world.

question: Nowadays the way many people interact with each other has changed because of technology. In what ways has technology affected the types of relationships people make? Has this become a positive or negative development.
human: Nowadays, the Earth has become like a small village. In the course of the last hundred years, the way majority of people communicate with each other has been altered significantly because of technology. But there are vast amount of disputes whether it is positive or negative. From my point of view, this development was a very positive one in spite of its some drawbacks.To begin with, nowadays, to keep in touch with loved ones in faraway places has become easy than ever. Technology revolutionized the way we communicate and in present, it is almost possible to do everything without tete-a-tete. By means of some software such as Skype, MSN, Whatsapp we can get in touch with everybody whenever we want. For example, in earlier times, people didn't leave for faraway places, because they could easily get lost. This is also one salient prove that the development of technology was a very positive.Further, by means of some communication tools, it has become very easy to make new friends. According to statistics, 40% of people met even their life partners via Internet. In this sense, Internet is a basic tool to keep in touch with old and make new friends.However, the other side of the coin is that, by communicating via Internet or phone, we cannot express our ideas and feelings fully, because during such conversations, some of our words can make a completely different sense. As a result, the rate of divorces is increasing day by day. By way of conclusion, I once again restate my position that the development of technology impacted on the means of communication among people very positively by making it easier and more comfortable.
llm: The advent of technology has revolutionized the way people interact with each other, transforming the types of relationships they form and maintain. In the course of the last hundred years, the way the majority of people communicate with each other has been altered significantly because of technology. From my point of view, this development was a very positive one, in spite of its some drawbacks.To begin with, nowadays, to keep in touch with loved ones in faraway places has become easier than ever. Social media platforms, messaging apps, and video conferencing tools have bridged the geographical gap, enabling people to stay connected with friends and family who live abroad or in different parts of the country. This has strengthened relationships and fostered a sense of community and belonging. Moreover, technology has also enabled people to connect with others who share similar interests and hobbies, leading to the formation of new relationships and networks.While some may argue that technology has led to social isolation and decreased face-to-face interactions, I believe that the benefits of technology far outweigh the drawbacks. Technology has opened up new avenues for people to meet and interact, such as online forums and social media groups. Additionally, it has also facilitated collaboration and communication among people from diverse backgrounds and cultures, promoting cross-cultural understanding and exchange.In conclusion, the impact of technology on relationships has been overwhelmingly positive. It has made it possible for people to maintain and form relationships that transcend geographical boundaries, and has enabled people to connect with others who share similar interests and passions. While there may be some negative consequences, the benefits of technology in shaping and enhancing relationships cannot be denied.

question: With the increasing use and development of new technology, many machines are now able to do the work which people used to perform. What are the advantages and disadvantages of this trend?
human: The issue of whether using of machine are bring many advantages to society is of great concern to many people. In my opinion, although using machines have many benefits, we cannot ignore its negative effects.It is undoubted that machines can bring many benefits. For one thing, machines are more effective than human. Not like human, machines do not need rest, which means they can work as long as employers want and consistently produce high quality products without any mistakes. For another, using machines can save company's money. Because machines never ask for salary, over-time pay or pension, so employers do not need to spend money on employee's welfare. The company only needs some technicians to make sure machines are working on the right track or replace some part when machines are not working. However, the disadvantages of machines that bring to us should not be neglected by people. To start with, because of extensive of using machines, many people loss their job. Especially in large population countries, high unemployment rate may cause crime and social instability. Apart from this, using of machines are also pose serious pollution and energy dissipation. For example, nowadays people prefer to use dish-washing machine to wash dishes and plates rather than hand washing. But they did not know that compared with hand washing dish-washing machine consume at least 2 times water and electricity to wash these tableware. As you can imagine, if thousands of families use dish-washing machines, how many water and how much electricity will be wasted!In conclusion, although we cannot deny machines are play a vital role in people living and working, problems posed by machines should draws more attentions as well.
llm: The increasing use and development of new technology has led to a significant shift in the way work is performed, with many machines now capable of undertaking tasks that were previously done by humans. Undoubtedly, machines can bring many benefits to society. For one thing, machines are more effective than humans. Unlike humans, machines do not need rest, which means they can work for as long as employers want and consistently produce high-quality products without any mistakes.The advantages of this trend are numerous. Machines can work around the clock, increasing productivity and efficiency in various industries such as manufacturing and transportation. Additionally, machines can perform tasks that are dangerous or difficult for humans, reducing the risk of injury and improving overall safety. Furthermore, machines can process vast amounts of data quickly and accurately, which can lead to groundbreaking discoveries and innovations in fields like medicine and science.However, there are also disadvantages to this trend. The increasing reliance on machines has led to job losses and unemployment in certain sectors, as machines replace human workers. This can have significant social and economic implications, particularly for individuals who may not have the skills to adapt to new technologies. Moreover, the over-reliance on machines can also lead to a loss of human skills and craftsmanship, as traditional techniques and methods are forgotten in favor of automated processes.In conclusion, while the increasing use of machines in the workplace has its advantages, such as increased productivity and efficiency, it also has its drawbacks, including job losses and the erosion of human skills. As technology continues to evolve, it is essential to strike a balance between the benefits of machines and the need to preserve human employment and traditional skills.

question: In the last 20 years there have been significant developments in the field of information technology (IT), for example, the World Wide Web and communication by email. human: Decade after decade, every day, scientists discover magnificent devices in the field of IT, such as interactive boards, multicore computers and laptops, tablets, which have an incredible resolution and also mobile phones, which have the power of a computer. question: Many people believe that media coverage of celebrities is having a negative effect on children. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: Today, celebrities appear to become a spotlight of the mass media. Almost half of the news coverage on television and the Internet is devoted to the celebrity gossip. Not surprisingly, many people are worried that this attention to the famous people has an impact on them, especially on their children. This essay will compare both negative and positive consequences of this effect on infants.Fame is a great responsibility for public people as their admirers are very sensitive to any acts of their idols. Celebrity scandals and gossips can quickly reach the public which perceive it very negatively. This means that celebrities who received attention for overuse of drugs or alcohol are likely to get public disgrace. Therefore, children may see that this behavior is inexcusable.On the other hand, too much news coverage to famous people seems to have a negative influence on the choice of children of their future professions. As recent surveys showed, inspired by the fame and wealth, children now prefer more to become an actor/actress or a sports star than it was in the past. Many schools for preparation of so-called stars and various advertisements about famous people may mislead with the fact that this profession is highly required and easy reachable. This may confuse children who should not choose their future job because of the influence of the mass media, but from the basis of their own interests.In conclusion, parents should be more worried about their children's attitudes to the 'cult of celebrity'. They should teach their children how to distinguish shortcoming stars from truly talented ones and to put right priorities in life.
llm: The media's obsession with celebrity culture has sparked a heated debate about its impact on children. Many people are worried that this attention to famous people has a profound impact on them, especially on their children. As public figures, celebrities have a great responsibility to set a good example, as their admirers are very sensitive to any acts of their idols. Children often look up to celebrities as role models, and if they engage in questionable behavior, it can have far-reaching consequences.On the other hand, too much news coverage of famous people seems to have a negative influence on the choice of children's future profession. The constant bombardment of images and stories about celebrities can create unrealistic expectations and promote a culture of superficiality. Children may become more interested in pursuing fame and fortune rather than developing meaningful skills and talents. This can lead to a lack of diversity in career choices, as children may be more inclined to pursue careers in the entertainment industry rather than in fields such as science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM).In conclusion, I agree that media coverage of celebrities is having a negative effect on children. The constant scrutiny and attention given to celebrities can have a profound impact on children's perceptions and aspirations. It is essential for parents, educators, and the media to promote a balanced and realistic view of celebrity culture, emphasizing the importance of hard work, dedication, and positive role models. By doing so, we can help children develop a more nuanced understanding of what it means to be successful and fulfilled, and encourage them to pursue careers that are meaningful and beneficial to society.

question: Some people argue that the technology such as mobile phone (cell phone) destroys social interaction. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Recently, there has been a social concern in regards to whether mobile phones have a negative effect in our social communication. Indeed, mobile phones have been widely used for people of all ages, bringing convenience and entertainment into our life. However, as far as I am concerned, I strongly agree with the view that this great invention causes many social problems.In the first place, spending too much time on phones may exert adverse effects on social life. In the first place, as people increasingly tend to focus and relay on phones, they may lose their interest on daily activities like meeting with their friends so that distraction may be developed during study or social activities. Moreover, continuous use of mobile phone may damage both eyesight and physical posture of the children.Furthermore, there are many types of games available in the phone and many of them are very aggressive in nature such as "Iron man". In those games, children are rewarded for being more violent, and this violence is repeated again and again. For instance, many games involve children helping their character to kill or shoot, which many lead to increased aggressive feelings, thoughts and behaviours. Therefore, the hardship of communication may be developed.However, other people may perceive this issue from different viewpoint. With rapid development of the internet, people are able to enjoy quick electronic communication via internet. For instance, as lots of chatting apps available online such as "Weichat", people tend to send instant messages free of charge by using their phones rather than face to face communication. Therefore, mobile phones have shortened the distance of communication.After having considered all the problems that I have discussed above, we can finally draw a conclusion that although mobile phones brings convenience of communication, they also contribute to some social problems.
llm: The advent of mobile phones has revolutionized the way we live, communicate, and interact with one another. Mobile phones have been widely used by people of all ages, bringing convenience and entertainment into our lives. They enable us to stay connected with friends and family, access a vast amount of information, and enjoy various forms of entertainment on the go. However, as far as I am concerned, I strongly agree with the view that this great invention causes many social problems.In the first place, as people increasingly tend to focus and rely on phones, they may lose their interest in daily activities. Excessive phone usage can lead to a sedentary lifestyle, where individuals prefer to interact with their screens rather than engage in face-to-face conversations or participate in outdoor activities. This can result in a decline in social skills, deepened relationships, and a sense of community. Furthermore, people may become so engrossed in their phones that they neglect their surroundings, leading to a lack of awareness and engagement with the world around them.Besides, the continuous use of mobile phones may damage both the eyesight and physical posture of children. Prolonged screen time can cause eye strain, headaches, and poor posture, which can have long-term effects on their health and wellbeing. Additionally, excessive phone usage can also lead to social isolation, anxiety, and depression, particularly among young people. Therefore, while mobile phones have many benefits, it is essential to use them responsibly and maintain a balance between technology usage and social interaction. By being aware of these potential drawbacks, we can harness the benefits of mobile phones while minimizing their negative impact on our social lives.

question: Modern forms of communication such as email and messaging have reduced the amount of time people spend seeing their friends. This has had a negative effect on their social lives. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Undoubtedly, the movement of modern forms of communication has changed better, which help people to interact to others, such as email and messaging without limitation time. I totally agree that using of these soft devices have cut much of time people need to see with their relatives. However, it is had some demerits on their social lives.Mentioned to societies life style, they constantly use these kinds of electronic letter for making fellowship or just continuing theirs what they already had. Obviousness, there are other ways like social media that they could to use it for meeting theirs buddies such as Twitter and Facebook, also make the communication become feasible and limitless of time.Another perspective, using of these facilities has influenced netizens to keep themselves becoming unsociable. The consequence of this case made some people become geek, as too much of using email and messaging, without direct contacts. However, people have had own minded to keep connection with their friends as a good relationship, meet them and talk by face to face directly.In conclusion, I admittedly and strongly agree that the merits of email and messaging have reduced amount of ours time to communicate to. llm: The advent of modern forms of communication, such as email and messaging, has revolutionized the way people interact with each other. These advancements have made it possible for individuals to connect with others without the constraints of time and geographical location. On the one hand, I agree that modern forms of communication have changed for the better, as they enable people to interact with others effortlessly and efficiently. For instance, email and messaging apps allow users to send and receive messages at any time, making it easier to stay in touch with friends and family who live far away.However, I also believe that excessive reliance on these modern forms of communication has had some demerits on people's social lives. While email and messaging provide convenience, they lack the depth and intimacy of face-to-face interactions. People are spending more time interacting with screens and less time engaging in meaningful, in-person conversations. This can lead to feelings of isolation and loneliness, even if they have a large online social network. Moreover, the lack of nonverbal cues, such as body language and tone of voice, can lead to misunderstandings and miscommunications.In conclusion, while modern forms of communication have made it easier for people to stay connected, I agree that they have had a negative effect on people's social lives to some extent. It is essential to strike a balance between the convenience of digital communication and the importance of in-person interactions. By making a conscious effort to maintain face-to-face relationships and engage in meaningful conversations, individuals can harness the benefits of modern communication while also nurturing their social lives. Ultimately, a balanced approach to communication is necessary to ensure that technology enhances, rather than detracts from, our social connections.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Other believe that children who are taught to co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults.
human: It is undeniable that children have an innocent mind, and they requires a proper guidance at a specific time to make them understand the value of life. Some people think that it is better to make them competitive, while other believes to make them co-operative. Both these factors have their own values, and have been discussed in detail below:Competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle the situations independently. This factor initially arises from the school, where teacher encourages student to feel more competitive through the grading system, and this is the place where children are trying to get on the top by scoring the highest marks. This factor will lead them to be successful in their lives ahead, but will also restrict them in many ways. For example, MNCs are mainly focusing on a team work, and a person with the competitive mind would be having a difficulty in managing the situation with the team.However, those who wants to create a sense of co-operation in their children is a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead. Although, they will not be having a pace and an eager to get on the top as the competitors do, but they shall have an art of managing different situations of life with the help of a team.In my opinion, though competitive children will be far more clever and faster than the co-operative child in an initial level, but it will not help them to be on the success path for the long run; while on the contrary, co-operative child will have a potential of structuring and implementing new and innovative ideas with the help of a team.To conclude, I would say that people should create a sense of co-operation in their children to make them feel more accomplished in life.
llm: The debate surrounding the encouragement of competition versus cooperation in children has sparked intense discussion. While some argue that fostering a sense of competition in children is essential, others believe that teaching them to cooperate is more beneficial. In this essay, we will delve into the values of both approaches and explore their implications on a child's development into a useful adult.On one hand, competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle situations independently. This confidence stems from their ability to assess their strengths and weaknesses,,assistantThe debate surrounding the encouragement of competition versus cooperation in children has sparked intense discussion. While some argue that fostering a sense of competition in children is essential, others believe that teaching them to cooperate is more beneficial. In this essay, we will delve into the values of both approaches and explore their implications on a child's development into a useful adult.On one hand, competitive children are more likely to be confident enough to handle situations independently. This confidence stems from their ability to assess their strengths and weaknesses, and to strive for improvement. As a result, they are more self-sufficient and better equipped to tackle challenges on their own. On the other hand, co-operative children will have a potential of structuring and implementing new and innovative ideas with the help of a team. By working together, they learn to appreciate diverse perspectives, to listen actively, and to build on each other's strengths. This collaborative mindset enables them to approach problems with a more holistic understanding, often leading to groundbreaking solutions.Both these factors have their own values, and have been discussed in detail below. Competitive children may excel in individual pursuits, while co-operative children may thrive in team-based environments. Ultimately, a balance between competition and cooperation is necessary to raise well-rounded individuals who can adapt to various situations. By acknowledging the merits of both approaches, parents and educators can provide children with a supportive environment that fosters confidence, creativity, and a willingness to collaborate. As children grow into useful adults, they will be able to navigate the complexities of the real world, leveraging their unique blend of independence and teamwork skills to make a positive impact.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: With the development of technology, whether or not it is still necessary to protect the traditional skills and lifestyles leads to a drastic controversy which is becoming a public concern, especially considering the significant impact taken by technology. As far as I am concerned, the importance of traditions should be valued and paid attention to.Traditional skills and lifestyles play important role in modern society, in terms of healthcare, environmental protection and cultural inherit. Although technology takes convenience to humankind, it also contributes to unhealthy behaviors of life, like sedentary lifestyle. Instead, traditional ways of life is a great complimentary for modern life and highlight the importance of work life balance. In spite of the fact this kind of business bring limited contribution to government finance, it should be emphasized that the expense is trivial compared with the potential value of traditions. Therefore the government authorities and education institutes should work closely together to promote the traditional skills and ways of life, so as to make people to realize the value of them.All in all, protection of tradition is not only important for the entire society currently, but also contributes to the next generation.

By preserving these traditional skills, we can continue to learn from them and incorporate their wisdom into modern healthcare systems. By embracing and protecting our traditional heritage, we can continue to learn from the past, appreciate its wisdom, and apply its principles to tackle the complexities of the modern world. Ultimately, preserving traditional skills and lifestyles is not a nostalgic endeavor, but a forward-thinking strategy that can enrich our lives and contribute to a more sustainable future.

question: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Others believe that children who are taught to be co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
human: In present educational system there are variety of competitions in academic area and athletic area for children to attend, which could stimulating the will of children to learn and to achieve the best of them, and also be able to teach them teamwork skill. However, some people think it is better to make children be competitive than cooperative, both the values have its arguments.A strong competition sense helps children having urge to learn or to practice for being the best among peers, and this factor is initially arises from the schools and parents, to encourage children to get the highest scores through the grading system. Even though a competitive child is usually more motivated to pursue a goal or to face difficulties independently, but it is also risky that children are becoming too competitive to cooperating with others. Being competitive leads them to success, but could also restrict them in many ways. For example, it might be hard for a competitive person to deal or manage in a team work project.On the other hand, cooperation is also an essential quality for children, no matter in school activities or in communities. Having a good cooperating spirit helps kids to communicate and get along with others, which gives them more possibility to solve problems or to achieve a goal easily by working as a team. After all, in society, there is hardly anyone who could has big achievement by oneself. For example, famous singers or movie stars, despite of their talent to make them successful, there are always a team to manage works or deal with things.In my point of view, though competitive child would have more motivation and perspective that leads them to success, but it would not help them much once they enter to society or company which required more about skill of team work. To sum up, I would say that schools and adults should put a sense of cooperation in children to make them becoming a useful adult whether in society or community.
llm: The debate surrounding the importance of competition versus cooperation in children's development has sparked intense discussion. Some people think it is better to foster a sense of competition in children, as it encourages them to strive for excellence. This mindset drives children to learn and practice, ultimately becoming the best among their peers. A strong competition sense can motivate children to push beyond their limits, achieve their goals, and develop a winning mentality. This, in turn, can translate into various aspects of life, such as academics, sports, and their future careers.On the other hand, cooperation is also an essential quality for children to develop, both in school activities and within their communities. By teaching children to cooperate, they learn the value of teamwork, mutual respect, and empathy. Cooperative children are more likely to become useful adults, as they understand the importance of collaboration and can work effectively towards a common goal. Moreover, cooperation promotes social skills, conflict resolution, and a sense of belonging, all of which are vital for building strong relationships and contributing to the greater good.In my opinion, a balance between competition and cooperation is necessary for children's holistic development. While competition can drive children to achieve their personal best, cooperation teaches them the value of unity and collective success. By incorporating both values, children can develop a strong sense of self-motivation, as well as the ability to work harmoniously with others. Ultimately, this balanced approach will enable children to become well-rounded, useful adults who can excel in their individual pursuits while contributing positively to their communities. By embracing both competition and cooperation, we can raise a generation of children who are not only driven to succeed but also empathetic and socially responsible.

They believe that advertising plays a crucial role in informing consumers about new products and services, promoting economic growth, and fostering competition among businesses. On the other hand, it is an undeniable fact that the advertising market gives lots of working opportunities, from producers, writers, to models, and cameramen. This industry provides employment to a significant number of people, contributing to the overall economic well-being of a society.Furthermore, the rise of online advertisement has made it one of the easiest approaches for businesses to reach their target audience. The potential gains of online advertising, such as cheaper costs, convenience, and the ability to easily observe consumer behavior, have made it a preferred choice for many companies. Online advertising allows businesses to reach a wider audience, increase brand awareness, and drive sales, all at a lower cost compared to traditional advertising methods. Additionally, online advertising provides measurable results, allowing businesses to track the effectiveness of their campaigns and make data-driven decisions.In my opinion, while advertising may have some negative effects, such as promoting materialism and manipulating consumer behavior, the benefits it provides to society outweigh the harms. The creation of jobs, promotion of economic growth, and provision of information to consumers are all significant advantages of advertising. Therefore, I believe that advertising is a necessary and beneficial part of our society, and its benefits should be acknowledged and appreciated. Overall, advertising plays a vital role in driving economic growth, providing employment opportunities, and informing consumers, making it a valuable component of modern society.

question: Some modern artists receive huge sums of money for the things they create, while other struggle to survive. Government should take steps to resolve this unfair situation. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: The amount of money people earning sometimes is unfair. In a field of art, modern artist may receive high salary for their masterpiece creation while labors should be break their bone for years to get similar amount of money. Although some people view that government should be take a responsibility for this unfair situation, critics against such view. I agree that in this occasion the government is not granted to hand in.Proficiency brings perfectness in terms of art work. It is true while the modern artists who implement their creative thinking onto high value creation are paid with immense sum by the art collector. Also, the high sum which modern artists receive is related to the quality instead of the quantity and their rare talent. For example, a 15 centimeter Buddha temple made by hand is granted times in comparison with factory production. On the other hand, modern artists also devote themselves find a unique concept in which ordinary people cannot do, such making impossible become possible. Pieter Padang, Minion creator, has brilliant idea to alter part of song lyric "I swear" become "underwear" when the Minion sing in Despicable Me. He granted huge sums for such idea.Striking contrast, labor working in the merchandise factory receive coin of dollar even they make a hundred of 15 cm Buddha temples a day. In any case, a musician playing "I swear" several times receives different earnings that Padang got because the musician re-plays the song without any creation. Moreover, government cannot equalize the price of creation of modern artist because there is no certain parameter to value it, art value is about taste.Having said that the huge sums of modern artists receives related to their struggle in the field of art, while the term of struggle might different with other field of job. I agree that government cannot take steps to make the salary between modern artists and other job similar because art price is about taste.
llm: The art world has long been plagued by inequality, with some modern artists receiving exorbitant sums of money for their creations, while others struggle to make ends meet. It is not uncommon for a modern artist to receive a hefty paycheck for a single masterpiece, while laborers toil for years to earn a similar amount. This stark contrast has led many to argue that the government should intervene to resolve this unfair situation.In a field of art, the value of a piece is often subjective, and the market can be unpredictable. Some artists may create works that are highly sought after, while others may produce pieces that, despite their technical skill and artistic merit, do not command the same prices. As a result, some artists are able to live comfortably off their work, while others must supplement their income with part-time jobs or rely on the support of patrons. Meanwhile, laborers, who work tirelessly to build and maintain the very infrastructure of our society, often go underappreciated and underpaid.Some people view that government should take responsibility for this unfair situation, arguing that it is the duty of the state to ensure that all citizens are able to earn a fair income for their work, regardless of their profession. They propose that the government could implement policies such as subsidies for struggling artists or regulations to cap the prices of art pieces. However, critics against such view argue that government intervention would stifle creativity and lead to a homogenization of art, as artists would be incentivized to produce works that appeal to the masses rather than challenge and innovate. They also argue that the art market is driven by supply and demand, and that the government should not interfere with the natural forces of the market. Ultimately, while the current state of the art world is undoubtedly unfair, the solution is not straightforward, and a nuanced approach is needed to address the complexities of this issue.

question: People tend to work longer hours nowadays. Working long hours has a negative effect on themselves, their families and the society, so working hours should be restricted. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Working longer hours is becoming prevalent in these days. There is a saying in my native village, "Health is Wealth". I believe many of people including me are not really considering the importance of health. The need for increased working hours might be because of enhanced competitive environment and desire to acquire much money and promotion. However, people working for extended hours have been found having adverse effects on their health and personal life. In my opinion, a balance between personal and professional life should be created by restricting maximum number of working hours. First of all, many of us would agree to the fact that people; who prefer working longer hours, do not find time to focus on their health. By working too long, they often become tired, lazy and reluctant to carry out physical exercise in order to remain fit and healthy and eventually loose health and become sick. Moreover, they become extensively addicted to their work and become workaholic type persons. The repercussion are so severe that their families and friends remain deprived off their attention and in the end they end up losing balance between their family and personal life.Secondly, these workaholic people do not spend time for the contribution of society by actively participating in any social campaign. As they usually remain busy in their office so they do not find leisure time for such social activities. For instance, I would take my boss's example; he has been working for extended hours in office for many years. Recently, his health and personal life was drastically affected as he broke up with his wife and his family life has totally been in chaos and cries. He started regretting afterwards and now trying to manage his work but it seems to be too late for him.To conclude this, I would strongly emphasis and recommend, Government must include the clause of maximum number of working hours in its Labor Law and enforce to all companies for ensuring their employees do not spend extended hours in companies. This will help in uplift of society, and bring the lost equilibrium between personal and professional life of each individual person.
llm: The notion that people tend to work longer hours nowadays has sparked a heated debate about the need to restrict working hours. In my opinion, I strongly agree that working hours should be restricted due to the detrimental effects it has on individuals, their families, and society as a whole. People working for extended hours have been found to have adverse effects on their health and personal life. By working too long, they often become tired, lazy, and reluctant to carry out physical exercise in order to remain fit and healthy. As a result, they are more prone to developing chronic diseases, such as diabetes and heart disease, which can significantly reduce their quality of life. Furthermore, the lack of physical activity can lead to mental health problems, including depression and anxiety.Besides the physical and mental health implications, working long hours can also lead to an unhealthy obsession with work. Many individuals become extensively addicted to their work and turn into workaholic type persons, neglecting their personal relationships and responsibilities. This can lead to strained relationships with family and friends, ultimately affecting their overall well-being. Moreover, the excessive work hours can also have a negative impact on society, as it can lead to a decrease in productivity and an increase in errors, which can have serious consequences in certain professions.In conclusion, restricting working hours is essential to prevent the negative effects of long working hours on individuals, their families, and society. By implementing reasonable working hours, individuals can maintain a healthy work-life balance, ensuring they have sufficient time for physical exercise, personal relationships, and leisure activities. This, in turn, can lead to a happier, healthier, and more productive workforce.

question: A successful person is one who has earned a lot of money. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: It's such a common definition of a successful person is one who has earned a lot of money, especially in nowadays society. Each individual visualize success differently. Still, my term of a successful man is one who has certain achievements in life rather than the one with a high income.Money is undeniably pivotal, but ways of earning it is also various. A person's great prosperity does not state that he has gained it ethically by himself. Nevertheless, a man can only achieve his accomplishment through hard-working, dedication and passion. Whether it is a personal or a social achievement, that man is laudable.More importantly, the more beneficial for the society his achievement is, the more successful he is considered. For instance, Thomas Edison is undeniably considered as one of the greatest inventors in the 20th century since his invention's productivity is countless useful for mankind. On the other hand, the fact of knowing a man's utilization of his money remains in the dark. Therefore, judging a person by his income is difficult, especially in the success aspect.In conclusion, using only money as a scale to measure a man's success is impossible despite the fact that it is the essential in basic needs. Yet, it is the common scene that a man can be publicly considered successful when his achievements, which can only accomplished by passion, dedication and ethics, are helpful not only for himself.
llm: I strongly disagree with the statement that a successful person is one who has earned a lot of money. While money is undeniably pivotal in today's society, I believe that a successful individual is one who has achieved certain milestones and accomplishments in life, rather than simply accumulating wealth. A person's success cannot be solely measured by their bank account balance.There are various ways to earn money, and not all of them are admirable or lead to a sense of fulfillment. A person can inherit a large sum of money or win the lottery, but that does not necessarily make them successful. On the other hand, a person who has worked hard to achieve their goals, overcome obstacles, and pursued their passions can be considered truly successful, regardless of their income.A successful man is one who has dedicated themselves to their craft, has put in the effort and time required to excel, and has remained passionate about their pursuits. For instance, a scientist who has spent years researching and developing a life-saving cure, or an artist who has honed their skills to create something truly remarkable, can be considered successful, even if they are not wealthy. Their achievements and contributions to society are what truly matter, and their success is measured by the positive impact they have on the world.In conclusion, while money can provide comfort and security, it is not the sole determining factor of a person's success. A successful person is one who has achieved their goals through hard work, dedication, and passion, and has made a meaningful contribution to society. Their accomplishments and the value they have added to the world are what truly define their success, not their wealth.

question: Question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which there are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowdays, people's choice of consumption is heavily affected by various of advertising on television, street, magazine etc. This argument may be true that people will be swayed by the advertising and buy things they do not need it for their life. For example, in most asian countries, advertisement company usually hire popular singers or actors to advertise the products to boosts the sales, and some people, especially adolescent may buy things from their favourite singer advertised to support their idol instead of to fill their needs.In addition, products usually look more gorgeous and with good quality in advertisement, people are more likely to buy goods impulsively without a second thought. A good advertisement can convince people to believe that it is what they want, even though it is not the real needs of the society. And there are always people purchase particular products swayed by advertising which makes it a trend to follow for other people who is unnecessarily need it.However, buying habit is a very personal things for individuals, the advertisement is not the only cause for people to buy, sometimes it depends on one's needs and ability of consumption. It is unlikely to buy things impulsively for adults who have concern of arranging disposable income. Most of them have to allocate the money if they doing other purchase. On the other hand, children and adolescents who is not economic independence is more possible to buy things impulsively without considering whether they need it or not, since they do not have financial pressure from life and ability to define what is necessary.In my opinion, I think buying habit is people's choice to make, not entirely affected by advertisements. But for children or adolescents who is not mentally develop, it might be hard for them not to swayed by advertising. So it is important that government needs to impose rules on particularly advertisement company (for example, toys company) to avoid youngster have bias thought on what they really need.
llm: The notion that the high sales of popular consumer goods are a reflection of the power of advertising rather than the real needs of society is a topic of debate. Nowadays, people's choices of consumption are heavily influenced by various forms of advertising, including television, street, and magazine ads. It is undeniable that advertising plays a significant role in shaping consumer behavior, often swaying individuals to purchase items they may not necessarily need.This argument may hold some truth, as people are often persuaded by the allure of advertisements, leading them to buy things that do not contribute significantly to their well-being or quality of life. The constant bombardment of ads can create a sense of necessity or desire for products that are not essential, thereby driving sales and boosting revenue for companies. However, it is crucial to acknowledge that buying habits are highly personal and influenced by a multitude of factors, including individual needs, preferences, and financial capabilities.While advertising is a significant factor, it is not the sole determinant of consumer purchasing decisions. Sometimes, the decision to buy a product depends on an individual's genuine needs and their ability to consume. For instance, a person may purchase a new laptop not because of an advertisement, but because their current one is outdated and no longer meets their needs for work or study. Therefore, it is an oversimplification to attribute high sales solely to the power of advertising, ignoring the complex interplay of personal, economic, and social factors that influence consumer choices. In conclusion, while advertising undoubtedly has a profound impact on sales, it is not the only driver of consumer behavior, and real needs, along with personal circumstances, also play a significant role.

question: Some people think that by paying taxes they made enough contribution to their society. TO what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Paying taxes is the obligation of citizens in almost every country. Some people believe that they have made enough contribution to the country by doing that. Personally, I tend to disagree with this view.To start with, all people who are able to work should pay tax to the government, as it is the most important source of government's revenue, which is mainly used to serve all citizens. For example, a large proportion of the tax is spent on national defence and in maintaining social stability, so that every one can work and live in a peaceful environment. The tax is also used to pay the salaries of workers working in public service sectors, such as teachers and police officers. Although these workers do not produce profit directly, what they do is for the well-being of the whole society.However, I would argue that citizens have other important responsibilities to fulfil apart from paying tax. As we know, there are impoverished or disabled people in every society, needing help and support from others. It is true that the government can provide some fund to ease their difficulties, but such financial help is usually far from enough. In such case, aids from more capable or wealthier citizens are particularly crucial, which are a great complement to government support. Another responsibility all citizens should take is to maintain social stability together with the police force. There are criminals in every society, and the number of policemen the government can hire is limited. So it is quite necessary for the local residents to take actions and ensure the safety of the communities, by doing things like reporting suspicious activities to the police department.In conclusion, it is a significant obligation of citizens to pay tax to the government. Other than that, they have other critical obligations to take, in order to make our society function in an ordered way.
llm: The notion that paying taxes is sufficient contribution to society is a debated topic. While paying taxes is the obligation of citizens in almost every country, serving as a means to fund public goods and services, some people believe that fulfilling this duty is enough. However, I would argue that citizens have other important responsibilities to fulfill apart from paying taxes.Paying taxes is indeed a crucial civic duty, as it enables governments to provide essential public services, infrastructure, and social welfare programs. Nevertheless, the role of citizens extends far beyond this financial contribution. For instance, there are impoverished or disabled people in every society, needing help and support from others. These vulnerable groups require assistance, such as volunteering, donating to charitable causes, or simply offering a supportive community. By engaging in these activities, citizens can make a tangible difference in the lives of those in need, contributing to the overall well-being of their society.Furthermore, active citizenship involves participating in community activities, promoting social cohesion, and fostering a sense of responsibility among community members. This can include activities such as mentoring, environmental conservation, or advocating for social justice. By taking on these responsibilities, citizens can help build stronger, more resilient communities, which in turn, can lead to a more harmonious and equitable society. In conclusion, while paying taxes is an essential obligation, it is by no means the only contribution citizens can make to their society. I firmly believe that citizens have a broader range of responsibilities, including supporting vulnerable members, participating in community activities, and promoting social cohesion, all of which are vital to creating a thriving and compassionate society.

question: School should teach children the academic subje cts which have a close relationship with their future careers, so other subjects like music and sports are not important. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: People have many different views about what subjects should be taught in school. Although I accept that students have to study many subjects in school, I disagree with the idea that unimportant subjects such as music and sports should be got rid of the program.Many people believe that students only need to study academic subjects like mathematics, physics because these subject are necessary for students' future. This is understandable when labor market now has high competition; students have to meet requirements regard of qualification. In addition, the unemployment rate is always high, so their parents want children to study these subjects which can help students have a job. Although those above reasons are acceptable, I would argue that there are many things much more important than having a job. Firstly, studying music, art or sports is also very important to students. This enables students to develop their potentials through discovering the natural world around them. Secondly, to get a job in labor market, not only do students require hard skills but also soft skills such as teamwork, presentation. For instance, through taking part in a sport, students can understand team spirit and learn lessons about teamwork skills. Therefore, these subjects might fulfil the students' ability. Finally, children's future do not depend heavily on the academic subjects they study in school, it is the result of their efforts and capacity.In conclusion, although the academic subjects play a primary role in nurturing children, it seem to me that the effects of learning music, sports are profound.
llm: The notion that schools should prioritize teaching academic subjects closely related to future careers, while downplaying others like music and sports, has garnered significant attention. Many people believe that students only need to study academic subjects like mathematics and physics because these subjects are deemed necessary for students' future professions. However, this narrow perspective overlooks the broader importance of a well-rounded education. I would argue that there are many things much more important than having a job. While a career is undoubtedly a crucial aspect of life, it is not the sole defining feature of an individual's existence. Personal fulfillment,eduction, physical health, and emotional well-being are equally, if not more, significant. Music and sports, often viewed as peripheral subjects, play a vital role in fostering these essential life aspects. They contribute to the development of creativity, teamwork skills, discipline, and emotional intelligence, all of which are invaluable in both personal and professional spheres.Moreover, subjects like music and sports provide a platform for self-expression and stress relief, contributing to mental health and happiness. They also offer a unique set of skills that are transferable across various professions, such as teamwork, strategy, and perseverance. In an increasingly competitive job market, where technical skills are often prioritized, the soft skills gained through music, arts, and sports can be a distinguishing factor for individuals.In conclusion, while academic subjects are undoubtedly important for future careers, it is misguided to believe that they are the only subjects worthy of focus. A balanced education that includes music, sports, and other extracurricular activities is essential for the holistic development of students. It prepares them not just for their careers, but for life itself, nurturing well-rounded, capable, and happy individuals.

question: Some people believe that information available in the internet will end the era of newspapers and magazines. Do you agree or disagree? Give your own opinion and examples.
human: Digital media has been extremely popular among people around the globe. With this advancement, newspapers and magazines are struggling to justify their existence. Some believe that traditional paper media will come to an end very soon due to the increased usage of internet based media. But many other still thinks they are going to stay. I agree to the argument that newspapers and magazines will be history with the time. I will establish my view by analysing how internet presents the information about the current affair so fast and the accessibility to the historical news.A very important responsibility of media is to publish information about the current affairs as quickly as possible specially when there is a crisis. This helps readers to get updated and act accordingly. For example, when the aircraft MH 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident. The friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth. In such situations, newspapers and magazines can not respond as fast as digital media. Instead of waiting for next publication, people can get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two. This explains why digital media will rule over paper and magazines.People often want to access news from past for various reasons like to prepare for research, satisfy interest, etc. For example, one research fellow may want to know how a small village named Oramaki in Japan was suffering after Second World War. It is very difficult to get this sort of information from past in newspapers and magazines as one has to know before where to look at. But internet provides efficient search facility where one can search the topic and get the details. This feature of digital media is not supported by newspapers and magazines.To conclude, the fast responding internet media with vast information will be replacing newspapers and magazines as new and information provider for valid reasons. Though considering the current infrastructure and mindset of people, paper media will continue for another few years.
llm: The advent of the internet has revolutionized the way we consume information, and some believe that traditional paper media will come to an end very soon due to the increased usage of internet-based media. On the other hand, many others still think that newspapers and magazines are going to stay. In my opinion, I agree with the argument that newspapers and magazines will be history with time.The internet has made it possible for people to access news and information from anywhere in the world, at any time. Online news portals and websites have become the primary source of information for many people, especially the younger generation. With the rise of digital media, the circulation of newspapers and magazines has significantly decreased, and many have been forced to shut down. For instance, many newspapers have already started online editions, and some have even stopped printing physical copies altogether.Moreover, online media offers a wide range of benefits, including up-to-date news, easy accessibility, and a vast array of topics to choose from. In contrast, traditional paper media is limited by its physical nature, and the information is often outdated by the time it is printed. Furthermore, the internet has also given rise to new forms of media, such as blogs and podcasts, which have become increasingly popular. As a result, I believe that the days of newspapers and magazines are numbered, and they will eventually become a thing of the past. While some may argue that traditional media still has its own unique charm and benefits, I firmly believe that the convenience and versatility of online media will ultimately lead to the demise of newspapers and magazines.

question: When choosing a job, the salary is the most important consideration. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: In many societies, choice of a job depends on the size of the salary offered. Nevertheless, while I admit that the salary is very pivotal factor, I claim that there are other equally vital aspects that need to be considered in this regard.To begin with, I agree that in order for people to cover their daily and general needs they need money as well. However, aspects such as: friendly colleagues, environment and work-place condition, sometimes, have even more impact on person's happiness and quality of life.
