People, for instance, who don't like their co-workers and working condition are considered less satisfied with their jobs, despite of a high salary. In this sense, it is also one very salient proof of the accuracy of my position.Further and even more importantly, most of the satisfaction of a job comes to people from their professional achievements, skills and the position they reach. In other words, career promotion or getting some kind of credit from the administration of a company or organization are, likely, more enjoyable achievements than getting a high salary. For example, people, who work in monotonous jobs, where no achievements or a new positions can be reached feel themselves more dissatisfied, even though they have a very good salaries.In conclusion, I disagree with the idea that salary outweighs any other motivators, as there are other even more important aspects such as: friendly co-workers, working conditions and professional achievements.
llm: When choosing a job, the notion that salary is the most important consideration is a prevalent one. In many societies, the size of the salary offered is indeed a crucial factor in determining one's career path. However, I disagree that it is the only consideration that matters. While a decent salary is essential for meeting basic needs and enjoying a certain standard of living, there are other equally vital aspects that need to be taken into account.Aspects such as friendly colleagues, a pleasant work environment, and satisfactory workplace conditions can have a significant impact on a person's happiness and quality of life. A positive and supportive work atmosphere can lead to increased job satisfaction, reduced stress, and improved overall well-being. On the other hand, a toxic work environment can lead to burnout, decreased motivation, and a negative impact on one's mental and physical health. Furthermore, having friendly and like-minded colleagues can foster a sense of belonging, collaboration, and camaraderie, making the work experience more enjoyable and fulfilling.In conclusion, while salary is an important consideration when choosing a job, it is not the only factor that matters. Other aspects such as work environment, colleagues, and workplace conditions can have a profound impact on a person's happiness and quality of life. Therefore, it is essential to strike a balance between financial rewards and other essential elements that contribute to a satisfying and fulfilling career. By considering these factors, individuals can make informed decisions that prioritize their overall well-being and job satisfaction, leading to a more harmonious and productive work life.

question: Using a computer every day can have more negative than positive effects on children. Do you agree or disagree?
human: In today's world, computer is an essential part of everyday life. Around the globe, the effect is evident on children also. It is disagreed that computer can affect children in a negative way if they use a computer on a daily basis. This will be proven by analyzing how computer assists children to use vast resources available over internet to study effectively as well as develop some basic skills which help them in future careers.The best thing about internet is the availability of information in the form of text, image or video related to almost everything and through computer children can access internet to gather knowledge on the subjects they are studying or they are interested about. As an example, students preparing for delivering speech on a certain topic can browse through internet to learn each and every minute details of the subject matter. It's hard to get everything at a same place unless children are not familiar with computers. That is how, computer impacts children on a positive note.Nowadays, computers enable people to prepare presentations, draw complex graphs and pictures, document thesis in a simple though efficient way. When children are allowed to play around with computer from a very early age, they get acquainted with the previously mentioned skills and become expert before facing professional world. For instance, students who used to prepare Microsoft PowerPoint presentation for their school projects, get an edge over others at an early stage of their career. From this, it's clear that computer has a positive effect on the children.Following the demonstration of a computer's contribution in children's study and building skills which are to be used in their career afterwards, it is agreed that computer is a boon to children. However, parents should advise and guide their children properly so that they don't get misled.
llm: In today's world, the computer is an essential part of everyday life, and its impact is evident around the globe, affecting children as well. While some may argue that using a computer every day can have more negative than positive effects on children, I disagree. On the contrary, I believe that daily computer use can have numerous benefits for children.One of the primary advantages of computer use for children is the vast array of resources available to them over the internet. The internet provides an unparalleled wealth of information, educational materials, and learning tools that can aid children in their academic and personal development. By using a computer daily, children can access online educational platforms, educational websites, and digital libraries that offer a wide range of learning materials, including e-books, videos, and interactive lessons. This can help them to learn new skills, expand their knowledge, and stay up-to-date with the latest developments in various fields.Moreover, computers can also facilitate children's creativity, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills through various software and applications. For instance, graphic design software can help children express their creativity, while programming languages can introduce them to the world of coding and app development. Additionally, online educational games and puzzles can improve their cognitive abilities and hand-eye coordination. Therefore, when used responsibly and under proper guidance, daily computer use can have a profoundly positive impact on children, enhancing their educational, cognitive, and creative abilities. Overall, the benefits of daily computer use for children far outweigh the perceived negative effects, making it an invaluable tool in their overall development.

question: Children who are brought up in families that do not have large amounts of money are better prepared to deal with the problems of adult life than children brought up by wealthy parents. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: According to some people, child who is brought up in less well-off family is more quick-witted and can tackle with an adult life problems better than who is from affluent ones. However, I completely disagree with this position.To begin with, children from poorer families are prone to have bad habits such as: crime, thievery and thuggery. Moreover, these people will not have an access to a good education. As a result, they can be proselytized into bad isms. For example, most of the terroristic groups try to attract uneducated people, because the person with better education has a wider outlook, which will allow no brainwash. In this sense, people with lower level of education have more proneness to be attracted in such isms.Nevertheless, people who are born in well-off families have access to good education, which will have a positive impact on their later life. Secondly, children from rich families have better skills on how to use money, because they use it a lot of times. Finally, wealthy families can afford better health services and costly medicines, which will be very beneficial for the health of a child. For instance, many good medicines cost vast amounts of money, which cannot be afforded by poorer families.In conclusion, I disagree with the opinion that children who are brought up in less well-of families are, likely, more successful in the future life due to aforementioned reasons.
llm: The notion that children raised in less affluent families are better equipped to handle the challenges of adult life has been a topic of debate among many. According to some people, a child who is brought up in a less well-off family is more quick-witted and can tackle adult life problems better than those from affluent ones. However, I completely disagree with this position.To begin with, children from poorer families are prone to have bad habits such as crime, thievery, and thuggery. Growing up in an environment where resources are scarce can lead to a life of desperation, where some may turn to illegal activities as a means of survival. This can have long-lasting effects on a child's development, both mentally and emotionally. Furthermore, the lack of access to proper role models and guidance can exacerbate this issue, making it even more challenging for these children to become productive members of society.Moreover, these individuals will not have access to good education, which is a crucial factor in determining one's success in adult life. Education provides individuals with the necessary skills, knowledge, and critical thinking abilities to navigate the complexities of adulthood. Without it, children from poorer families are at a significant disadvantage, struggling to compete with their more affluent counterparts. This can lead to a cycle of poverty, where lack of opportunities and resources perpetuate a life of hardship and limited possibilities.In conclusion, while some may argue that children from less affluent families are better prepared for adult life, I firmly believe that this is not the case. The lack of access to quality education and the propensity for bad habits make it increasingly difficult for these children to succeed in adult life. Therefore, it is essential to provide support and resources to these families to break the cycle of poverty and ensure that all children have an equal opportunity to thrive.

question: Many of the medical problems that people are experiencing in today's world are due to the fact that we have a very sedentary lifestyle. To what extend do you agree or disagree.
human: It is certainly true that modern people are facing up to a new health problems and ailments than before. Many people claim that it is because of sedentary lifestlyle. However, while I accept that sedentary lifestyle is one of the key factors, I believe that some other factors are having even a greater impact.To begin with, I agree that sedentary lifestyle lead to many serious health problems. The main reason why people are becoming so addicted to sitting at their homes even for the whole day is an advance technology. In earlier times, for instance, even the types of entertainment tools were not in large numbers and all of them required physical presence and as a result they had more outdoor activities. Nowadays people, especially inhabitants of cities, are spending most of their time on sitting in front of TV or other tools.Nevertheless, there are some other causes why people are experiencing serious medical problems. Firstly, the environment of the modern world polluted very significantly from greenhouse gas emissions and other gasses. Many people, for example, are suffering from allergy because of these gasses. Secondly, foods with a low quality such as fast foods, junk foods and any genetically modified ones are influencing to our health very negatively. Finally, life becoming more stressful due to some recent problems such as traffic gam, traffic accidents and others.Given these evidences, it can be seen that people are facing up with many recently appeared illnesses due to aforementioned reasons.
llm: The notion that a sedentary lifestyle is the primary cause of many medical problems plaguing modern society has gained significant attention in recent years. It is undeniable that modern people are facing a myriad of new health problems and ailments that were less prevalent in the past. Many attribute this trend to the sedentary nature of contemporary life, where physical activity is often sacrificed for the convenience of technology and urbanization. However, I only partially agree with this assertion, as I believe other factors are having an even greater impact on our health.While a sedentary lifestyle certainly contributes to health issues such as obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease, it is not the sole culprit. Other significant factors, including poor diet, environmental pollution, and stress, play a more critical role in the development of these health problems. For instance, the widespread consumption of processed foods and sugary drinks has led to a surge in obesity rates, which is a major risk factor for numerous chronic diseases. Moreover, the increasing levels of air and water pollution in urban areas expose people to harmful toxins, further exacerbating health issues.Additionally, the pressures of modern life, including work-related stress and the constant bombardment of social media, have a profound impact on mental health, leading to conditions such as anxiety and depression. These factors, I argue, have a more profound effect on our overall health than a sedentary lifestyle alone. Therefore, while acknowledging the role of sedentarism in health problems, it is crucial to consider the broader spectrum of lifestyle and environmental factors that collectively contribute to the plethora of health issues faced by modern society. By addressing these multifaceted challenges, we can work towards creating a healthier and more sustainable future.

question: Foreign language instruction should begin in kindergarten. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Educational institutions have different systems when it comes to introducing foreign languages to children. Some people believe that foreign language instruction should start in pre-school. However, those who disagree contend that this should be taught in later years. This issue has garnered some attention in the academe as it has an impact on the children's learning. I personally believe that it is important for children to be taught with a secondary language as early as kindergarten.To begin with, children might not be really comfortable with the use of a language other than their native tongue when they are in their kindergarten years. Learning at school must be convenient for them if they speak in a way that they are used to. Moreover, teachers think that foreign language most likely leads to confusion for children who are yet to start learning. Another important thing to consider is that the teacher should be well-trained in the use of this specific language, so quality education will be delivered. Nevertheless, it is undeniable that kids are amazing learners, and the best time to hone them is in their younger years. The introduction of foreign language will be new to them; however, their curiosity will drive them to learn and comprehend. In this way, grasping a new language will be natural to them. In addition, the positive impact of this strategy is beneficial to both learners and teachers. Teachers will not find it difficult to make students learn such new concept in their teenage years. It is certainly clear that the advantages of early introduction of foreign language outweigh its disadvantages.In conclusion, the use of foreign language instruction as early as kindergarten is supported by some people; however, there are those who disagree. I am totally convinced that if this endeavour is properly implemented by schools, this will most likely lead to improvement of learning ability among children.
llm: The debate about when to introduce foreign language instruction has sparked a significant amount of discussion in recent years. Some people believe that foreign language instruction should start in pre-school, as early as ages three or four, while others contend that this should be taught in later years, such as middle school or high school. I personally believe that it is essential for children to be taught a secondary language as early as kindergarten.Introducing a foreign language in kindergarten has numerous benefits for young children. Research has shown that children who learn a second language at a young age tend to have better language skills, improved cognitive abilities, and enhanced cultural awareness. Moreover,Starting foreign language instruction in kindergarten also allows children to develop a strong foundation in the language, which can be built upon in subsequent years. This early introduction can help children to develop a more authentic accent, pronunciation, and grammar, as they are more likely to mimic the sounds and intonations of native speakers.Furthermore, learning a foreign language at a young age can also broaden children's cultural understanding and appreciation. It can help them to develop a more open-minded and tolerant perspective, which is essential in today's globalized world. In conclusion, I firmly believe that foreign language instruction should begin in kindergarten. It is a valuable investment in a child's future, and can provide them with a lifelong skill that will benefit them in countless ways. By starting early, children can develop a strong foundation in a secondary language, and reap the many cognitive, cultural, and social benefits that come with it.

question: International tourism has become a huge industry in the world. Some people think that the problems caused by international tourism outweigh benefits. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Along with the advancement of long-distance transportation, international tourism has boomed in the last few decades. Some people believe that this has brought more problems than benefits. I disagree with this view.I admit that tourism can have a negative impact on the natural environment. In order to meet the needs of tourists, local governments are likely to build more facilities and infrastructures around tourist attractions, which may result in the destruction of natural habitats. Tourism also creates more pollution and waste, including growing emission of greenhouse gases, dumped leftovers and overuse of water, power and other kind of energy in luxurious hotels. Based on these grounds, it seems that tourism puts great pressure on ecosystem and local resources, and it should not be encouraged.However, flourishing tourism in a place can be very rewarding in terms of local economy. Holiday makers flocking to other countries are not only bound to spend on tickets of attractions, but also pay for food, accommodation, transportation and entertainment. Both local people and governments can make a large amount of money through these services, and more employment opportunities can be created as well. I also believe the revenue earned form tourism can be used in turn to reduce pollution and protect the environment.Furthermore, the increasing development of tourism is a boon to travelers as well. The provision of direct airlines makes it possible for them to travel conveniently and comfortably. With adequate local facilities and services available, they can spend more of their holidays having fun and relaxing. In addition, both locals and tourists can experience more cultures than ever before, and they can be more open-minded to eliminate preconceptions and deepen mutual understanding among nations.In conclusion, the prosperity of tourism can provide benefits for people on a global scale. Although there are some inevitable problems, they are outweighed by advantages and can be tackled if proper measures are taken.
llm: The international tourism industry has experienced unprecedented growth over the last few decades, with millions of people traveling across the globe each year. While some individuals argue that the problems caused by international tourism outweigh its benefits, I partially disagree with this assertion. On the one hand, the surge in international tourism has indeed led to several issues, including environmental degradation, as popular destinations struggle to cope with the influx of visitors, resulting in pollution, erosion, and loss of biodiversity.Moreover, the cultural and social fabric of local communities can be disrupted by the presence of large numbers of tourists, which may lead to the erosion of traditional practices and values. However, I believe that flourishing tourism in a place can be very rewarding in terms of the local economy. When managed sustainably, tourism can generate significant revenue and create employment opportunities for local residents, thereby contributing to the overall economic development of the area. Furthermore, tourism can also promote cross-cultural understanding and appreciation, as visitors learn about and engage with the customs and traditions of the host community.In conclusion, while international tourism does pose some problems, I think that its benefits can outweigh its drawbacks if properly managed. With careful planning and regulation, the negative impacts of tourism can be mitigated, and the industry can be harnessed to drive economic growth, preserve cultural heritage, and foster global understanding. Ultimately, the key to reaping the rewards of international tourism lies in striking a balance between economic development and environmental and social responsibility.

question: Some children can learn more efficiently by watching TV. Therefore, children should watch TV regularly both in school and at home? do you agree or disagree?
human: Education is undeniably pivotal for an individual. Although, it is agreed that learning by watching TV is more effective to some children, I find it difficult not to oppose against the idea of having students spend more time on TVs. The reason for this is traditional education has its stand for most appropriate method. Thus, physical inactivity should not be encouraged for the aim of bettering youngsters' skills.To begin with, classic teaching methods has been scientifically proven and utilized as the best mode of educate a child. Technology and its advance, to some degrees, have influenced the educational industry positively. Nevertheless, it has not changed the importance of teachers' role in classes. The fact that students nowadays do their homework or researches on computers rather than go to libraries is an illustration for this. Yet, monitors are unable to replace the appearance of educators since their knowledge and adaptability is priceless. Therefore, teacher cannot be switched with some unconscious screens. Secondly, watching television is a very passive action and should not be promoted by increasing periods spent on it. On the other hand, children who have had such activities that interrelate to creativity, cooperation, competition tend to perform significantly better in general terms. For instance, a conducted experiment indicates out-performance in skills like differentiate types of plants or animals of a child that experienced various activities in nature to a child spent most of his time watching documentaries. As a result, such activities can equip a child necessary skill that is useful for his future career.In conclusion, despite the fact that learning by watching TV suits some children, kids should never be encourage to engage in such passive activity. School has been applying traditional teaching procedure since for ages. Additionally, it still performs at its best to equip a child with essential skills.
llm: The statement that children should watch TV regularly both in school and at home because some can learn more efficiently by doing so is a debatable topic. While it is true that certain educational programs can be beneficial for children's learning, I disagree with the notion that watching TV should be promoted as a regular learning activity.Watching TV is a very passive action, where children are merely recipients of information without actively engaging with it. This passive learning can lead to a lack of critical thinking, problem-solving, and creativity. Moreover, excessive TV watching can hinder children's physical and mental development, as it limits their opportunities for physical activity, social interaction, and hands-on learning experiences.On the other hand, children who participate in activities that foster creativity, cooperation, and competition tend to perform significantly better in general terms. Activities such as sports, arts, and group projects encourage children to think critically, work together, and develop problem-solving skills. These skills are essential for academic success and personal growth, and are often lacking in a TV-dominated learning environment.Instead of increasing TV watching time, schools and parents should focus on providing children with engaging, interactive, and hands-on learning experiences. This can include outdoor activities, group projects, and creative pursuits that promote critical thinking, teamwork, and problem-solving. By doing so, children can develop a more comprehensive range of skills, leading to better academic performance and a more well-rounded education. In conclusion, while TV can be a useful learning tool, it should not be relied upon as a primary source of education, and children's learning experiences should be balanced with more active, engaging, and interactive activities.

question: In some countries, with the widespread use of the internet, people are able to work or study from home, instead of having to travel to work or college. Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages? Discuss and state your own opinion.
human: Undoubtedly this is an era of internet which impacts one's personal as well as professional life. The effect is seen more on the developed countries where people choose to work or study from home instead of going to office or university. Some consider this approach to be an advantage while others reject this as a disadvantage. Both the points of views will be discussed in order.On the one hand, the benefit that professionals or students get by connecting from home is enormous. For one, it helps working people to maintain work life balance. The best example is the new mother who can join her work as well as take care of her baby. People also get the desired flexibility in terms of working hours. For students too, studying from home is an attractive option. They save the travelling time to Universities and utilize that time on their studies. In a busy city like Tokyo, students waste a lot of time in travelling. Thus, the advantages that people enjoy by working or studying from home, are obvious.On the other hand, one part of the society, has doubt over the productivity of people who prefers to work or study from home. Many employers argue that once an employee works from isolation, he or she spends a lot of time in communication via phone or email with colleagues. This harms an employee's deliverable. Teachers think that students get affected too as they can not clear their doubts in study topics instantly. Due to this they lag in their studies. These factors affect people who work or study from home.Following both the point of views, the option of working or studying from home is thought to provide more benefits than drawbacks. It is hoped that people will continue to use internet to work or study and improve on the disadvantages into the foreseeable future.
llm: The widespread use of the internet has led to a significant shift in the way people work and study. With the ability to access vast amounts of information and communicate with others remotely, many individuals are now able to work or study from the comfort of their own homes. While some consider this to be a major advantage, others reject it as a disadvantage.On one hand, working or studying from home can be incredibly convenient, allowing individuals to save time and money on transportation and avoid the distractions and stress of commuting. However, on the other hand, some employers argue that once an employee works from isolation, they spend a lot of time in communication via phone or email with colleagues, which can harm their deliverables. This can lead to decreased productivity and efficiency, ultimately affecting the quality of work.Similarly, teachers think that students who study from home can be disadvantaged as they are unable to clear their doubts in study topics instantly. The lack of face-to-face interaction with instructors and peers can hinder the learning process, leading to confusion and misunderstandings. These factors can significantly affect people who work or study from home, leading to a sense of isolation and disconnection from their colleagues and peers.In my opinion, while working or studying from home has its advantages, the disadvantages cannot be overlooked. The lack of social interaction and human connection can have a significant impact on an individual's mental and emotional well-being. Furthermore, the potential decrease in productivity and efficiency can have long-term consequences on one's career and academic success. Therefore, I believe that a balance between working or studying from home and interacting with others in a traditional setting is essential to reap the benefits of both worlds.

question: International tourism has become the biggest industry in the world. Some people think it causes tension between people from different culture. Others think it leads to understanding between countries. To what extend do you agree or disagree?Ê
human: I agree with both opinions that international tourism not only causes tension but also leads to understanding between people from different culture, because most people will be trying to understand each other after they have conflict or debates.There is no doubt that some behaviors of the tourists are not welcome in the local area. Firstly, some people leave the rubbish after visiting the attractions. Therefore, those local residents have to clean the place frequently so that the new batch of tourists will have a tidy and neat environment. Moreover, tourists may offend the local people due to their different culture background. For example, Indians don't eat beef since they worship cows. Thus, if tourists want to respect the tradition, they will not order any beef in the local restaurant. On the other hand, in order to avoid the conflicts between foreigners and locals, people are trying to understand different culture and find solutions. For instance, tourists are given the brochures about the local traditions and customs before they visit the place. Furthermore, the tour guide are willing to help tourists to understand the culture from other countries. Thus, the possibility of the conflicts is reduced because the understanding between both parties.Obviously, people are looking for the solution such as understanding each other while they encounter the conflicts caused by international tourism. Hence, I think international tourism leads to both tension and understanding between people from different culture.
llm: The rise of international tourism has led to a surge in global interactions, with people from diverse cultural backgrounds coming together. While some argue that this phenomenon causes tension between individuals from different cultures, the reality is more nuanced. In my opinion, international tourism not only causes tension but also leads to understanding between people from different cultures.On the one hand, cultural differences can lead to misunderstandings and conflicts. For instance, varying norms and customs can result in unintentional offense or miscommunication. Moreover, the influx of tourists can put a strain on local resources and infrastructure, leading to frustration among residents. However, these initial tensions often serve as a catalyst for meaningful interactions and exchanges. As people from different cultures engage in debates and discussions, they begin to break down stereotypes and gain a deeper understanding of each other's perspectives.Most people, when faced with conflict or debates, will attempt to understand each other's viewpoints, leading to a more profound appreciation of cultural differences. Through these interactions, tourists and locals alike can develop empathy and tolerance, ultimately fostering greater global understanding. Furthermore, international tourism promotes cross-cultural exchange, allowing individuals to experience and learn from diverse traditions, customs, and ways of life. This, in turn, can lead to a more harmonious and interconnected world, where cultural diversity is celebrated and valued.In conclusion, while international tourism may initially cause tension between people from different cultures, it ultimately leads to a greater understanding and appreciation of our global diversity. As people engage with each other, they will inevitably try to understand each other's perspectives, leading to a more peaceful and interconnected world.

question: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: Some people think that celebrities are known for their glamorous lifestyle rather than the work they do. While I agree this will bring negative impacts on the younger generation, this is not necessarily the case for those celebrities who are ambitious in their jobs.It is true that some celebrities tend to show off their images in front of the public. For example, some movie starts enjoy wearing luxury brand clothes and showing their expensive life style in front of the media, thereby gaining the public attention. If they continue to behave in such a way, it will create a misleading image to young people who may think that extraordinary life can be achieved without hard work. Consequently, the attention of young people may become focused on chasing the dream of celebrity status. This is detrimental to study and work ethics and habits. Nevertheless, I believe that other celebrities do set up role models to young people because of their visible accomplishments. Firstly, celebrities such as sports player whose performance and professional skills can be directly seen by their fans. This means that people understand that the great deal of efforts on training is directly linked to their results. Therefore, this kind of self-made celebrity can inspire children to develop their talents through application and perseverance. Secondly, other celebrities such as musician also have achieved great success in their career. Take Michael Jackson as an example, his works are widely spread around the world, and have been extremely welcomed by the younger generation. His songs spread the idea that people should care about each other, which suggests to young people how to become a good member of society. In summary, although some celebrities misguide young people by showing their external wealth and appearance, other celebrities do lead young people in the right direction.
llm: The statement that celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and that this sets a bad example to young people, is a topic of ongoing debate. Some people think that celebrities are known for their glamorous lifestyle rather than the work they do, and that this can have a negative influence on young people. It is true that some celebrities tend to show off their images in front of the public, flaunting their wealth and material possessions, which can create unrealistic expectations and promote a culture of superficiality.However, it is also important to note that not all celebrities are alike, and that some do lead young people in the right direction. Many celebrities use their platform to raise awareness for social causes, promote education and self-improvement, and inspire young people to pursue their passions and work hard to achieve their goals. For example, some celebrities use their wealth and influence to support charitable organizations and initiatives, setting a positive example for young people and demonstrating the importance of giving back to the community.In conclusion, while it is true that some celebrities may prioritize their glamour and wealth over their achievements, it is not fair to generalize this to all celebrities. Many celebrities are using their platform to make a positive impact and set a good example for young people. Therefore, I only partially agree with the statement, and believe that it is essential to recognize and appreciate the positive contributions that many celebrities make to society. By doing so, we can promote a more balanced and nuanced view of celebrity culture and its influence on young people.

question: Children can effectively learn from watching television. Therefore they should be encouraged to watch TV in both home and school. Agree/Disagree?
human: TV is an immense source of information and pupils can learn and develop various skills by watching it. But I believe that by allowing students to watch TV at both school and house can adversely impact on their overall growth. If children spend too much time in front of TV, it will negatively impact their health and study.It is true that TV is one of the prime source of data and information. There are international and local news channels like BBC, CNBC, Etv Gujarati, Etv Marathi etc to keep individuals updated about latest happenings. By watching TV, children can develop skills in extra-curriculum activities. For example, Cooking programs teach about how to make new dishes and similarly, sports events like cricket, football can teach leadership skills, team building skills, communication skills and many more that can help students in their future jobs.But on other hand, watching TV for a continuously long hours can adversely impact children health. For example, they can get poor eyesight in early ages of childhood, and also develop back pain. Sometimes, students watch restrictive programs not allowed for their ages and this can have major psychological consequences. Many times, students get addictive to their favorite programs like Cartoon channels, or baseball and easily get distracted from study during exam period and this can seriously impact their grades. In conclusion, I believe demerits of watching TV outweigh its merits and thus if students were allowed to freely watch TV without any proper controls by parents or teachers then it would produce more negative effects on children.
llm: The notion that children can effectively learn from watching television has sparked a heated debate. While it is true that TV is an immense source of information and pupils can learn and develop various skills by watching it, On the one hand, television offers a wide range of educational programs that can enhance a child's knowledge and understanding of various subjects, including history, science, and culture. By watching these programs, children can gain valuable insights and develop critical thinking skills. Moreover, TV can also provide children with exposure to different languages, customs, and ways of life, broadening their perspective and fostering empathy and tolerance.On the other hand, allowing students to watch TV at both school and home can have an adverse impact on their overall growth. Excessive TV watching can lead to a sedentary lifestyle, contributing to obesity and other health problems. Furthermore, it can also distract children from more important activities such as reading, outdoor play, and socializing, which are essential for their physical, emotional, and social development. Additionally, watching TV can also lead to a decline in attention span and a decrease in academic performance, as children may become more focused on entertainment than education.In conclusion, while TV can be a valuable tool for learning, it is crucial for parents and educators to strike a balance between TV watching and other activities that promote overall growth and development. Children should be encouraged to watch educational programs, but limits should be set to ensure that TV watching does not become a substitute for more important activities. By doing so, children can effectively learn from watching television without compromising their overall growth and development.

question: It has been claimed that workers over 50 are not responsive to rapidly changing ideas in the modern workplace and that for this reason younger workers are to be preferred. To what extent would you support or reject this idea?
human: Throughout human history, the offspring has always proved its stronger adaptability and advancement than its predecessor. This is still true in the industrial society nowadays, where younger workers are preferably employed and promoted rather than over-50 workers. There are three reasons that can explain their unresponsiveness to the modern workplace.First and foremost, old workers are not a patch on the younger ones for their unchanged paradigm. The old were raised in poverty, probably caused by war, look at the world from a negative and pessimistic point of view. The misery is so ingrained in their mind that they refuse to change, or more precisely, to accept the existence of such modernity. For example, most would rather choose to piece together parts of a machine than have it done by a robot for their disbelief of its efficiency and safety compared with human's capability.Secondly, their unresponsiveness can be attributed to their attitude towards life. In other words, that they are aware of their deteriorating health and lack of enthusiasm comes with their taste for monotony and safe ideology. This, by all means, is outweigh by youngsters' adventurousness and bravery. Blatantly seen, success of most companies stems from young people, whose enterprising ideas that catch up with the world is regarded as wind of refreshment.Last but not least, knowledge is worth mentioning as a key factor to help young workers outrank the elderly. Who would the employer choose, an old man with old-fashioned education and a young man who is not only good at fundermentaly subject, but also knows how to program or how to speak foreign languages. Not to undermine old workers, but their lack of authority over such basically required fields in this day and age leads to their incompetence in every modern workplace.All in a nutshell, workers over 50 have proven themselves subordinate to the following generation in all aspects. However, in my point of view, it is still of great importance to remain the harmonious coexistence of both sides for the smooth sailing of the company.
llm: The notion that workers over 50 are less responsive to rapidly changing ideas in the modern workplace has sparked a heated debate. Proponents of this idea argue that older workers are less adaptable and therefore, younger workers are to be preferred. However, I strongly reject this idea, as it oversimplifies the complexities of age and workplace performance.Older workers are often stereotyped as being stuck in their ways, unwilling to embrace new ideas and technologies. It is claimed that they are not a patch on the younger ones for their unchanged paradigm, which allegedly hinders their ability to innovate and adapt. Furthermore, their unresponsiveness can be attributed to their taste for monotony and safe ideology, which may lead to a resistance to change. However, this does not mean that they are incapable of learning or growing.On the other hand, knowledge is worth mentioning as a key factor that can help young workers outrank the elderly. Younger workers are often more familiar with the latest technologies and trends, giving them an edge in terms of responsiveness to changing ideas. Nevertheless, this does not necessarily mean that older workers are unable to acquire new knowledge or skills. With proper training and support, older workers can be just as responsive and adaptable as their younger counterparts.In conclusion, while it is true that older workers may have a different approach to change, it is unfair to assume that they are less responsive to new ideas. By recognizing the value of experience and knowledge, and providing opportunities for growth and development, we can tap into the wisdom and expertise of older workers, and create a more inclusive and diverse workplace. Ultimately, responsiveness to change is not solely determined by age, but by an individual's willingness to learn, adapt, and grow.

question: The use of machines are increasing day by day which is reducing physical work done by humans. Do you think advantages outweigh the disadvantages
human: Advancements in technology have touched new heights in past few decades. This can be seen no where clearer than in increasing use of machines now a days. These machines reduce the physical work done by humans. Some people think that this is a positive development while others believe it to be disadvantageous for humans.Both sides will be critiqued before a reasoned conclusion is reached.It is felt by many that the usage of machines is harmful for health of humans since machines decrease the work done by people. For example, in many institutions staircases are replaced by lifts now a days. People opt for elevators instead of climbing one or two flight of stairs. It is confirmed in a number of researches that daily usage of elevators in workplaces promotes obesity. So this example clearly shows the linkage between using machines and adverse health effects.On other side of the coin, many people believe that usage of machines makes work easier and less time is consumed for doing similar amount of work. Take the example of use of food processors in kitchens. The work of chopping, blending, grating, kneading has become so easy that people can not imagine their lives without this simple machine at their homes. Thus it is very obvious that using machines makes daily tasks less time consuming and less cumbersome.After analyzing these two points of view, it is believed that using machines is advantageous as machines make work easy and smooth. The negative effects on health can be put on the back seat because there are many other ways to exercise and stay healthy. Therefore, it is hoped that in coming time people will enjoy using more and more machines and will choose alternative ways to stay disease free.
llm: The use of machines is increasing day by day, which is reducing physical work done by humans. This trend has sparked a debate about whether the advantages of machines outweigh the disadvantages. On one hand, some people think that the usage of machines is harmful for the health of humans since machines decrease the work done by people. Prolonged periods of inactivity can lead to a range of health problems, including obesity, cardiovascular disease, and mental health issues. As humans rely more on machines, they engage in less physical activity, which can have detrimental effects on their overall well-being.On the other hand, many people believe that using machines makes work easier and less time is consumed for doing a similar amount of work. Machines have increased efficiency and productivity, allowing humans to complete tasks at a faster rate. This, in turn, has led to significant economic benefits, as businesses and industries can produce more goods and services with less labor. Furthermore, machines have also taken over tasks that are hazardous or require a high level of physical exertion, reducing the risk of injury and improving workplace safety.In conclusion, while there are valid concerns about the impact of machines on human health, I believe that the advantages of machines outweigh the disadvantages. The benefits of increased efficiency, productivity, and safety cannot be ignored. However, it is essential to strike a balance between machine usage and human physical activity. By incorporating regular exercise and physical activity into our daily routines, we can mitigate the negative effects of machine usage and reap the benefits of technological advancements. Ultimately, machines are tools designed to improve our lives, and with responsible usage, they can have a profoundly positive impact on human society.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extend do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: These days, most of countries on the world invest for technology. It is evident that technology promotes economy. Many people think that conventional things will not exist and should be eliminated. I totally disagree this opinion.First of all, traditional skills and ways belong to value of culture. They make differences between countries. Every country has unique tradtions which show their creation, intelligence. Consequently, people feel pround of their country, so they keep reserving conventions. For example, ways to build a house in every country are different and they distinguish between countries.In addition, in some cases that traditional way can not replace by a new technology. Lot of people like to use traditional things because if their quality and durability. In paticular, vases are made by hand would be used more. Futhermore, there are plenty of works that using traditional way is unique method. For instance, making cone hats from leaves have to use hand. Not only because there is no machine for the work, but also it looks more beautiful when it is made by hand, so resulting in greater value economy.The last thing is about education. Traditional skills and ways of life will help youngsters study and know more history. Methods which their ancestors used in the past will be displayed again for new generations. After that, they might create somethings that are useful for life.In conclusion, technology has brought many benefits, but traditional skills and ways are always valuable and will last forever.
llm: The notion that traditional skills and ways of life will inevitably die out as a country develops its technology, and that it is pointless to try and keep them alive, is a topic of debate. Many people think that conventional things will not exist and should be eliminated, making way for modern advancements. However, I totally disagree with this opinion.First of all, traditional skills and ways of life belong to the value of culture. They make significant differences between countries, allowing each nation to maintain its unique identity. The preservation of these skills and ways is essential for cultural diversity and heritage. For instance, traditional crafts, music, and art forms are distinctive elements of a country's cultural landscape. They evoke a sense of nostalgia and continuity with the past, fostering a deeper understanding and appreciation of one's roots.Consequently, people feel proud of their country and its rich cultural heritage, and thus, are motivated to keep reserving these conventions. The effort to preserve traditional skills and ways of life is not pointless; rather, it is a vital aspect of maintaining national identity and cultural continuity. By preserving these aspects, we ensure that future generations can learn from and appreciate the achievements and traditions of their ancestors. Furthermore, traditional skills and ways of life can often provide valuable insights and solutions to modern problems, making them still relevant and useful in today's world.In conclusion, traditional skills and ways of life are an integral part of a country's cultural fabric, and their preservation is essential for maintaining national pride, cultural diversity, and continuity. It is not pointless to try and keep them alive; instead, it is a necessary effort to ensure the continued richness and uniqueness of our cultural heritage.

question: The only way to reduce the amount of traffic in cities today is by reducing the need for people to travel from home for work, education or shopping. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Big cities nowadays can be described as melting pots. The problem off traffic overload, caused by overpopulation, has aroused interest of many city planners. It is argued that only if the demand to go out on the street is cut down can we solve the seemingly insurmountable issue of traffic gridlock. However, I have to profoundly disagree for there are still two viable solutions besides besides this way.First of all, public transport is a key factor to minimize the number of vehicles on the street. Buses and trains have been phased in the streets for quite a long time and have proven themselves the best candidates among all options. Apparently, a bus can carry no less than 30 people, while a train can carry as much as nine or even ten times of that number. Not to mention the fact that highway train is operated underground, which leaves the street above with buses and non-fuel-based vehicles. Together, they will lessen the crowded image in most cities nowadays.Second, rarely do we realize the helpful existence of urban areas. It is believed that if some of the enormous shopping malls or universities were relocated in the commuter belt, the city street would be les burstling and overly-teemed as it is now. As a rule of thumb, huge centers of attention distributed equally in a wide region means that residential areas will come along thus exert less pressure on the public facilities. The city itself will be absolved of enduring the influx of immigrants as well as unemployed people.In conclusion, city planner can still opt for non-personal vehicle and the exploitation of the suburb areas. It is highly recommended to put forward such solution, especially in some developing countries like Vietnam or China, with the ever-growing demand for job or education.
llm: The issue of reducing traffic congestion in cities has become a pressing concern for urban planners. In my opinion, I partially agree that minimizing the need for people to commute from home for work, education, or shopping is an effective way to alleviate traffic overload. Big cities nowadays can be described as melting pots, where people from diverse backgrounds converge, and the sheer number of residents has led to an unprecedented level of traffic congestion.The problem of traffic overload, caused by overpopulation, has aroused the interest of many city planners, who are now brainstorming innovative solutions to mitigate this issue. While reducing the need for daily commutes is a viable option, it is not the only solution. City planners can still opt for non-personal vehicle strategies, such as promoting public transportation, cycling, and walking infrastructure. Furthermore, the exploitation of suburb areas can also help to distribute the population more evenly, reducing the pressure on city centers and subsequently decreasing traffic congestion.Moreover, technological advancements and flexible work arrangements can also play a significant role in minimizing the need for physical commutes. For instance, remote work options and online education platforms can reduce the number of people traveling to work or school. However, this may not be applicable to all industries, such as healthcare or manufacturing, where physical presence is required. In conclusion, while reducing the need for people to travel from home is a crucial aspect of alleviating traffic congestion, it is not the sole solution. A multi-faceted approach, incorporating non-personal vehicle options, suburb area development, and technological innovations, is necessary to effectively address the issue of traffic overload in cities.

question: Celebrities are usually famous for glamour and wealth rather than their achievements. Some say taking them as an example can be dangerous for young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Young people all over the world are greatly influenced by media and celebrities. These celebrities are popular among younger generations because of their glamorous lifestyles. It is agreed that following celebrities can be dangerous for the youth. This will be proven by looking at how health and personality of young people is affected by following celebrities as their mentors. First of all, it is seen that following celebrities blindly affects the health of adolescents. Many young people indulge themselves in drugs and start smoking at an early age. For example, in a survey carried out in a university, it was asked to students that why did they start smoking, then around forty percent of individuals answered that they wanted to look like their favorite screen actor while smoking cigarettes. This example makes it clear that imitating celebrities has a negative influence on health of young individuals.Secondly, it is believed that when youth follows celebrities it affects personality of young people in a bad way. Adolescents follow not only the make up and attire of their favorite stars but also their behavior. For instance recently in a poll conducted by an American magazine it was found that most of the parents and teachers complain that teenagers use derogatory words and abusive language at home and at schools. So, this example makes it obvious that these glamorous celebrities have a poor effect on the conduct of young people.Thus to conclude, it can be said that when young people follow celebrities, it affects their health as well as behavior in a negative way. This has an overall effect on personality and future of an individual. Therefore it is recommended that young people should be educated not to follow these celebrities blindly, rather they should focus on their career so that they may hope for a bright future.
llm: The lives of celebrities are often perceived as the epitome of success, with their glamour and wealth captivating the attention of millions. However, it is argued that taking them as role models can have detrimental effects on young people. I strongly agree with this statement, as the influence of celebrities on the youth can be particularly damaging.Young people all over the world are greatly influenced by media and celebrities, who are often portrayed as idols to be emulated. It is agreed that following celebrities can be dangerous for the youth, as their lifestyles and behaviors are frequently unrealistic and unhealthy. This can be proven by examining the impact of celebrity culture on the health and personality of young people. For instance, the constant bombardment of idealized body images in the media can lead to low self-esteem, body dissatisfaction, and eating disorders among young people. Moreover, the glorification of reckless behavior, such as substance abuse and promiscuity, can encourage young people to engage in similar activities, putting their physical and mental health at risk.Furthermore, the cult of celebrity can also have a corrosive effect on the personality of young people, fostering a culture of narcissism and entitlement. The constant exposure to the lavish lifestyles of celebrities can create unrealistic expectations and a sense of disillusionment among young people, leading to a lack of motivation and purpose. Therefore, it is crucial for young people to be aware of the potential dangers of emulating celebrities and to seek out more positive and realistic role models, such as family members, teachers, or community leaders. By doing so, they can develop a more balanced and healthy perspective on life, and avoid the pitfalls of celebrity culture.

question: Universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: The gender issues have been already discussing for many years in order to give solutions for realising the equal proportion of developing human resources. Implementing the statue and right of equal education are believed as a sustainable policy that should be held. Nowadays, there are many institutions that accept the same average number of male and female students in many kinds of course. I strongly agree about this statement.The proportion of women is rising year by year in many parts of the world recently. Automatically, the issue stimulates the stakeholders from many places to think what kind of preparations they should take for stabilising the economic growth and the quality life of people. We can see now that women tend to work in various fields which in the past normally done by men such as being engineers, and dealing with machines. Those activities have proven that women can also do the men's works. Therefore, female students are indicated having the same potential and capability as men.Another reason is order to gaining higher education degree as it is required to establish a person's career. These days, it is so hard for young people to get a proper job when they have not degree certificate from Universities. So, learning from human's history, education provides someone to widen his or her knowledge and experience for facing the real situation of workplace through subject taught in college. According to this opinion, giving equal education for both men and women is a must.In conclusion, the needs for having developed-skills and gaining degree certificate in order to build someone's career are totally needed to implement and applied for any gender. As the world's situation is always changing, act for distributing education needs are absolutely important to compete the future challenges.
llm: The issue of achieving equal numbers of male and female students in universities has been a topic of discussion for many years. The goal is to realize an equal proportion of developing human resources, regardless of gender. I partially agree that universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject.On the one hand, there are many institutions that have already implemented policies to accept the same average number of male and female students in various courses. This approach has contributed to bridging the gender gap in higher education. Moreover, the proportion of women is rising year by year in many parts of the world, indicating a positive trend towards achieving gender equality. For instance, in fields such as medicine, law, and social sciences, the number of female students has increased significantly, demonstrating that women are just as capable as men in pursuing higher education.On the other hand, I disagree that universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject. Some fields, such as engineering and physics, have traditionally been male-dominated, and imposing a quota system could lead to less qualified candidates being accepted. Moreover, students should be accepted based on their academic merit, skills, and passion for the subject, rather than their gender. Imposing a strict gender balance could undermine the principles of fairness and equality.In conclusion, while I agree that achieving a balance between male and female students is important, I believe that universities should focus on providing equal opportunities and encouraging women to pursue higher education, rather than imposing a strict quota system. By doing so, we can ensure that the most talented and dedicated students, regardless of gender, have access to higher education and can contribute to the development of human resources.

question: It has been proved that smoking kills. In some countries it has been made illegal for people to smoke in all public places except in certain areas. All countries should make these rules. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: People the world over have designated smoothing as a shameful practice and a lethal habit. Several millions of smokers die suffering from cancers such as lung and oral. This bad habit also responsible for causing health hazards to passive-smokers: who are around smoking is taken place. Thus, it is argued that smoking should be made prohibited in public places such as bus and railway stations. This position will be proven by looking at how this arrangement has benefited both general public as well as smokers.To start, non-smoking public would be undoubtedly benefited by enforcing such restrain. Prior to 1980's public places in Sri Lanka, illustrates unpleasant situation where people smoked freely. Even in public transportation they engaged in this intolerant bad habit, some instances that lead to belligerent incidents. After enforcing restrictions the situation came to control and this act as benefit rendered to the public.In addition to this, introducing smoking ban in public places would greatly discourage people from engaging tobacco puffing. For instance, further enforcement banned smoking in capital in Sri Lanka has reduced this consumption related diseases and deaths, as per the ministry of health. As this shows, smoking restrictions has successfully daunted public from this bad puffing that put less strain on country's healthcare systems.After analyzing smoke illegalization in public places in Sri Lanka, it has been proven benefits people enjoy this arrangement. It is thus hoped governments would consider smoke banning in public places following footsteps of Sri Lanka as well as many other countries.
llm: The detrimental effects of smoking have been well-documented, and it is now widely acknowledged that smoking kills. In light of this, people the world over have designated smoking as a shameful practice and a lethal habit. The negative impact of smoking is not only limited to the smoker themselves, but also to those around them. This bad habit is also responsible for causing health hazards to passive-smokers, who are around where smoking is taking place. Second-hand smoke has been proven to be just as deadly as firsthand smoke, and it is unacceptable that innocent bystanders should be subjected to these risks.Therefore, it is argued that smoking should be made prohibited in public places such as bus and railway stations, where people are forced to congregate in close proximity. By designating certain areas as smoke-free, governments can significantly reduce the risks associated with passive smoking. Furthermore, making smoking illegal in public places can also help to reduce the social acceptability of smoking, and encourage smokers to quit. In conclusion, considering the harmful effects of smoking on both smokers and non-smokers, I strongly agree that all countries should implement rules making smoking illegal in all public places except in certain designated areas. This would not only protect the health and wellbeing of citizens but also contribute to a cultural shift away from this lethal habit. By taking a firm stance against smoking in public, governments can help to create a healthier and more considerate society for all.

question: Tourism is a modern form of colonialism. It distorts local economies, causes environmental damage and ruins the places it exploits. To what extent would you support or reject this idea?
human: Tourism, since its first appearance a long time ago, can be described as a controversial celebrity. Some believe that tourism is attributed to domestic economic distortion, environmental devastation and irrepairable damage to the exploited places. However, I strongly disagree with this misconcept for the two following reasons.First of all, tourism plays an indispensable role in nurturing the economy in a way it is meant to be. Basically, places of interest often locate in the wilderness areas, of which economy, before their appearance, haven't blossmed yet. Not until the investment of some companies do chains of hotels and services spring up. It will, by all means, attract considerable attention which goes hand in hand with the enormous income for the local residents. In other word, tourism helps divert the local economy to its right direction, which exploit the best out of its own potential.Secondly, even though environmental damage is inevitable, it is not tourism to be blamed for. In order to turn a wilderness into a place of attraction, the planners must have taken the nourishment of the sceneries into thorough consideration. To be precise, for instance, a fortune is spent on trimming the trees, watering the flowers, preserving and balancing the local fauna and flora, in the hope of beautifying the wild. Not to mention ecotourism, a new kind of environment-friendly service, which gives all environmentalists and nature lovers a hand in raising the awareness of people in protecting their coexistent creatures. Because of that, tourism should not be alledged to be notorous for its detriment to the ecological diversity.All thing considered, tourism has proven its friendly attitude towards the exploited areas in terms of finance and environmental impact. In my opinion, the combination of tourism and teaching process is highly recommended in pursuit of a harmonial relationship between human and their surroundings.
llm: The notion that tourism is a modern form of colonialism is a concept that has garnered significant attention in recent years. Some believe that tourism is attributed to domestic economic distortion, environmental devastation, and irreparable damage to the exploited places. This perspective argues that the influx of tourists can lead to inflated prices, displacement of local communities, and degradation of natural habitats. Moreover, the economic benefits of tourism often bypass local populations, instead lining the pockets of large corporations and foreign investors.However, I reject the idea that tourism is inherently a form of colonialism. While it is true that unregulated tourism can have detrimental effects, I believe that responsible and sustainable tourism practices can have numerous benefits for local communities. Tourism can provide economic opportunities, promote cultural exchange, and support conservation efforts. In my opinion, the combination of tourism and teaching processes is highly recommended in pursuit of a harmonial relationship between humans and their surroundings. By educating tourists about local customs, environmental concerns, and cultural sensitivities, we can foster a more respectful and sustainable form of tourism.Furthermore, many destinations are now adopting eco-tourism and community-based tourism models, which prioritize local ownership, environmental stewardship, and cultural preservation. These approaches ensure that tourism revenues benefit local communities and support the conservation of natural and cultural resources. Ultimately, tourism can be a powerful tool for economic development, cultural exchange, and environmental conservation, as long as it is managed responsibly and with the involvement of local stakeholders. By striking a balance between economic, environmental, and social considerations, we can create a more equitable and sustainable tourism industry that benefits both visitors and host communities.

question: In the last 20 years there have been significant development in the field of information technology (IT), for example the World Wide Web and communication by e-mail. However, future developments in IT are likely to have more negative effects than positive. To what extent do you agree with this view?
human: The appearance of information technology (IT) in the last 20 years has brought about significant developments in life standard as well as work efficiency. However, it is believed that the evolution also proves to be detrimental. In my opinion, there is a likelihood that future developments in IT will put the users at their own expense.With the rapid developing pace, IT seems to have turned its users to its slaves. In the past, there used to be World Wide Web or e-mail, but the cyber world now varies form games, online TV shows to means of communication, and probably still keeps going. Such irrisistible temptations drift people from the real world to the unreal ones, resulting in their dependence on technical equipment. What is more, the lack of soft skills attained form outdoor activities will agitate the IT addict, therefore, staying inside with computer and mobile phone will always be the first alternative.Future IT has also aroused concern on health issues. The existence of Skype, Viber or Yahoo has notably reduced even the longest distance into one click. As a result, rarely do people go out of their comfot zone, provided with snack and air conditioner, to assemble with others in flesh. Needless to say, their action will make a beeline for obesity, short-sighted, diabetes and other heart-related problems.In conclusion, despite the contribution of IT to the society, its effect on the users' independence and prositution should not be out of concern. To my mind, there have to be some alterations before IT has more serious impact on each individual's life.
llm: The advent of information technology (IT) in the last 20 years has revolutionized the way we live and work. The emergence of the World Wide Web and email communication has significantly enhanced our standard of living and work efficiency. The internet has made it possible to access vast amounts of information, connect with people globally, and conduct business transactions with ease. As a result, productivity and innovation have increased, leading to unprecedented economic growth and improvement in the overall quality of life.However, it is believed that the evolution of IT also proves to be detrimental. With the rapid developing pace of IT, it seems to have turned its users into its slaves. People are now heavily reliant on technology, spending a significant amount of time staring at screens, and neglecting other aspects of their lives. This has led to a decline in face-to-face communication, deepened social isolation, and exacerbated mental health issues. Furthermore, the over-reliance on IT has also raised concerns about job displacement, as automation and artificial intelligence begin to replace human workers.In my opinion, while future developments in IT may have some negative effects, I do not entirely agree that they will outweigh the positive effects. IT has the potential to solve some of the world's most pressing problems, such as healthcare, education, and environmental sustainability. Moreover, IT can also promote global understanding, cultural exchange, and economic empowerment. Therefore, it is crucial to strike a balance between the benefits and drawbacks of IT, and ensure that its development is guided by ethical considerations and a commitment to improving human well-being. By doing so, we can harness the power of IT to create a better future for all.

question: An increasing number of people are turning to vegetarianism. some belive that people are following a vegetarian diet for reasons other than animal rights issues. Do you agree with this? Give reasons why some people are choosing to become vegetarian
human: Since the dawn of time, human has considered meat as a fundamental protein sources. Meat has served as the main dish in almost every family's meals all around the world. Recent years, however, has seen a rapid increase in the number of vegetarians. Some people claim that this is brought about by the care for animal rights issue, others think it is much beyond that. It is clear to me that people avoid eating meat mostly for the sake of their health and relegious aspect.Firstly, health improvement is the main reason for vegetarian diet to become so popular. Many researchers have convinced that many kinds of vegetable contain antioxydant which can prevent cancer. This fortifies the fact that a vegetable diet can do good for our health. Although some argue that a meal without meat can lead to a lack of protein intake, it is proved that many kinds of bean such as soy bean or pea are also comparable protein sources.Secondy, relegious beliefs also contributes to a vegetarian diet. Some religion, such as Buddha, believes that animals were human being in their previous life, so eating their meat mean you eat the flesh of your parent sentient beings. It is often said that this view is rather unscientific. However, I am convinced that it is vital to follow one's own religious practices which can bring the enlightenment in mind.To sum up, it is evident for me that people choose to become vegetarians for health and religious concern rather than the benefits of animals. However, a meal which is nutritionally balanced is always most recommended.
llm: In recent years, there has been a rapid increase in the number of vegetarians, with many individuals adopting a plant-based diet for various reasons. While some may assume that animal rights issues are the primary motivator, I agree that people are turning to vegetarianism for reasons beyond this concern. In fact, the main reason for the surge in vegetarianism is the pursuit of health improvement. A well-planned vegetarian diet has been shown to reduce the risk of chronic diseases, such as heart disease, diabetes, and certain types of cancer. By excluding meat and focusing on whole, plant-based foods, individuals can experience significant health benefits, including weight loss, improved digestion, and increased energy levels.In addition to health improvement, religious beliefs also contribute to the adoption of a vegetarian diet. Certain faiths, such as Buddhism, Hinduism, and Jainism, advocate for a vegetarian lifestyle, promoting non-violence and compassion towards all living beings. For example, many Hindus follow a lacto-vegetarian diet, which excludes meat, fish, and eggs, but allows dairy products. This spiritual motivation has led many individuals to adopt a vegetarian diet, not only for personal health benefits but also as a way to connect with their faith and cultural heritage.Furthermore, environmental concerns and food sustainability are also driving factors in the rise of vegetarianism. With the growing awareness of climate change and the significant impact of animal agriculture on the environment, many people are choosing a plant-based diet as a way to reduce their carbon footprint. Overall, while animal rights issues may still be a consideration for some, it is clear that the popularity of vegetarianism can be attributed to a range of factors, including health improvement, religious beliefs, and environmental concerns. As the world becomes increasingly health-conscious and environmentally aware, it is likely that the trend towards vegetarianism will continue to grow.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: There is no doubt the application of technological developments in some countries will be accompanied with modern skills and new lifestyles. It is argued that these so-called cultural invasions will result in the distinction of national traditions, and there is no need to maintain them. However, from my point of view, what can be expected, is a change of the role of the tradition but not its disappearance from the society.It is undeniable that the country's culture is passed down mainly through traditional skills and ways of life. For instance, in Vietnam, many water puppet shows which once demonstrated our seasonal agriculture and communal activities, are today substituted by cinemas and music concerts.
